Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Glyn A
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in the heart of Paris with first class staff that focused on us enjoying our weekend to the full. The street facing rooms are very much better than those overlooking the courtyard with regard to their views. Prices are high but as ever one gets what one pays for.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: KenLeeds54
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out this is the best hotel I have ever stayed at. Some may find it expensive but you are in the lap of luxuary from day 1 and it's worth that little bit extra.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 1sandwedge
Reviews.Content: Everything you could want, and more. Expected Intercontinental service, but with a very, very personal tuch. No request is beyond accommodating. Kudos to the GM! "Cufflink" service all around (FGP would be proud!).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bronwenpayne
Reviews.Content: This is the most luxurious hotel I have ever stayed in from the amazing entrance to the wonderful salon. The bedroom had the most comfortable beds, lovely modern bathroom, many TV channels and a fridge. Unfortunately the one negative was a lack of tea making facilities in the room. Staff are extremely attentive, the dining room has to be seen - particularly the beautiful ceilings, breakfast was wonderful with a most comprehensive choice to suit all palates and nationalities. The situation of this hotel is perfect for exploring Paris by red bus or on foot. Try to look at the book showing the history of the hotel which is on display revealing many very famous visitors over 150 years.

Reviews.Title: “10 out 10”
Reviews.Author: 1307boss
Reviews.Content: Coming back to the intercontinental Grand Opera is like coming home. Everything about this hotel is fabulous. The staff on the club floor are at all times cheerful & engaging. The rooms are spacious, with tasteful elegant decor boasting huge bathrooms. The position is central to everything you need in Paris. I would highly recommend a stay here for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “It has the poor servise for the facilities.”
Reviews.Author: nommeliere
Reviews.Content: The ideal location, the beautiful interior design with the cleanliness. But unfortunately the service staff isn't at all educated. They don't have neither the profesionalism nor the hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Another IHG Classic 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: VangeInternational
Reviews.Content: I have never hidden the fact I love most IHG hotels and a a platinum Priority Club member try and stay at there hotels, but this one is a particular Favourite I had two days of from my business negotiations in Amsterdam and decided to jump on a Thalys Train and spend a night in Paris. I always enjoy Paris and love this hotel, though I highly recommend that you request rooms on the upper levels as being very close to the Opera house it is a busy tourist thorough fare, though that also works to your advantage in the cafes and the restaurant where you can just people watch and the Parisians are well worth watching. The service is impeccable, the rooms grand, and the food delightful ideally you would be with somone to enjoy the ambience in full, but it's a very relaxing hotel as everything is at call.

Reviews.Title: “Another amazing stay at my favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmpjmp
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another wonderful visit to this hotel. I can't recall how many times we've stayed here, but it just keeps getting better. Upon check-in, we were assigned room 2132 where we spent 1 sleepless night. Although the room was very large, it practically sat on top of the metro, so trains rumbled thru all night. I emailed the Director of Quality (Krumma Jonsdottir) who often responds on this forum. To my husband's surprise (she is a real person), she contacted the Club Manager (Ms. Ensuque) and suggested that she would help relocate us to a quiet room. Did she ever! We were moved to a beautiful 5th floor suite with at least 1 balcony in every room, and a beautiful view over the opera. Ms. Jonsdottir came and introduced herself as we sat in the club, and reiterated that she was at our disposal for the length of our stay. The club staff went out of their way to make sure that we had whatever we needed or wanted to be comfortable. Ms Ensuque has an amazing team in Gilles, Stephan, and Jessica. Yes, there are more expensive places to stay in Paris, and there are the fancy hotels in which one has to be seen: think Park Hyatt and the new W. There will never, however, be another InterContinental Le Grand. Simply put, the people here make the hotel. And no, we are not always upgraded to suites, although we do pay for club access (a bargain by the way). We just enjoy the caring attitude of the staff and the willingness to provide a smile, a bonjour, even the small things that make a stay enjoyable and unforgettable. This is why when we visit Paris, we will only stay at the InterContinental Paris Le Grand.

Reviews.Title: “December weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PhilDay
Reviews.Content: Huge classic hotel next to the Opera House. Brilliant restaurant for breakfast. Rooms a tad small but not unduly so for Paris. Make sure you get a room overlooking Paris rather than the internal courtyard (only blot on our stay)

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: bortonoverseas
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, great location, the staff went out of their way to make sure we were happy. Had a problem with noise, but once your room is on the higher floor ( anything pass 3rd floor really helps) Would stay again. The room service was really fast, the wonderful large sitting area between the lobby and restaurant is so fun people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Taralla
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stay at the Grand. Ideally located, The first time we had a view on the Opera. Absolutely fabulous. I could have spent my whole stay on the balcony, just watching the life down there. If I want to be fussy I could say that the down side of a view on the opera is the noise (traffic and subway). But really it was pretty well insulated and not to annoing. This time we were upgraded to a junior suite with a view on the inner court. Not as entertaining but not bad at all (the verriere is stunning, so is the view of the opera roof and golden statues) and it was so so quiet you could not imagine being in the centre of Paris. All the staff was really friendly and proactive. Breakfast at the Café de la Paix is fabulous. There again a very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Excellence, Merci.”
Reviews.Author: Loyalty-Club
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to this hotel and we found it excellent on all fronts. It's located in a really buzzing part of Paris and within walking distance of the major tourist attractions. Staff within the hotel were very friendly and approachable and seemed to enjoy their jobs and looking after guests. We were upgraded from our booking of a Club room to a very nice Junior Suite (including the club access paid/secured via our original reservation). I'm at the Royal Ambassador level of the InterContinental hotel group loyalty programme and appreciated the upgrade and other benefits provided. The club lounge on the 5th floor has a duplex split with a complimentary drinks (including Champayne) and food station on the lower level, with comfortable chairs, settees and Business Centre PCs on the upper floor level. Free WI-FI also works well throughout the hotel. Food in the restaurants was to a very high quality and the wines we tried were amazing! Thanks for a great stay and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian grandeur”
Reviews.Author: Peltt
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our stay at this magnificent hotel. The public spaces are hugely impressive. The Verriere restaurant in the centre of the hotel sits under a glass pyramid, and is beautifully furnished and adorned with flower arrangements and palms. The Cafe de la Paix has delicate decorations of gold and frescoes, with a perfect position to look out onto central Paris. The bar is a handsome, darker, more masculine and dignified space. We looked into the ballroom too, a glittering high semi-circular space lined with tall mirrors, ornate chandeliers and richly decorated and carpeted. Our room was an adequate size and very pleasant. The decoration and furnishings were in keeping with the rest of the hotel. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bedlinen was high quality. The bathroom had L'Occitane toiletries and thick frette towels. We did not use the Spa as it seemed to be mainly for those wanting beauty treatments rather than to just relax in a steam room or sauna. Service was very professional throughout our stay, and added to what was a really enjoyable time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: laurenchimes23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Grand hotel in 2005 and it is still the best hotel I've stayed in. On arrival it takes your breath away with how beautiful it is. The rooms are traditionally decorated with all the mo cons, I was lucky enough to have a balcony that overlooked the Paris Opera house which was a really treat. Breakfast is taken in the Cafe de la Paix which in itself is a real treat. For dinner reservations you would normally wait a good few weeks before getting in. I love love love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Much better if service is improved”
Reviews.Author: CLau888
Reviews.Content: I stayed at le Grand Paris almost once a year for the past few years. I arrived at the hotel at 8:30am due to an overnight flight to Paris, did not expect to have the room and was told so. Got the room in the afternoon and found it good. The good thing is the shower has a door ! For those rooms which has only bathtub, the curtain is a half size glass, so water is easily leaked to the floor whenever you shower. Housekeeping is doing just fine. I did not encounter any bad behaviour with the reception this time. Concierge is good as always. The hotel charges for Euro24 per day for WiFi, which I did not take. I can't believe I am still facing such arrangement in a modern city like Paris. I spent a few Euro at Starbucks 2 minutes away and get free WiFi there. Breakfast at the Cafe de la Paix has a very wide selection of cold dish, hot food and fruit. But there is one point I can never understand is that the cafe reception invariably asked customers to wait at the reception when there is plenty of tables available in the cafe,

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Nat_Dav_12
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful rooms, nice staff, good service. Beautiful meeting rooms and business centre.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Dame of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: blackpoolwhenimsixty
Reviews.Content: Wow what a beautiful hotel right in the heart of the most captivating city in Europe! Everyone should experience a slice of elegance at least once in their lives and this certainly hit the mark for us! Try and get a deal ( in one of the most expensive cities to stay! ). One small downside is that the hotel is so large that its a bit of a trek to the rooms, but all is forgiven with the experience of wondering around its beautiful architecture. Just go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: fvi92
Reviews.Content: Absolutely impressed by the rooms and the staff. If you can afford it, don't hesitate to book this typical Parisian hotel with "grand siecle" decoration, and located next to the Opera house and the Galleries Lafayette.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel In Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: patelsk142
Reviews.Content: Found this intercontinental a great spot while visiting Paris. Then location is great and near all tourist sites. The old style decor was most sensual and tastefully decorated. Especially their bathroom decor made us feel like we were in pure elegance. Loved the bathrobes also. The housekeeping was extremely well trained and ready to facilitate our every need.The executive chef of the main dining room is a top rated Michelin executive chef and his creations proved it. We highly recommend this 5 star quality facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & fabulous view”
Reviews.Author: wvanwass
Reviews.Content: A landmark hotel in Paris! Right next to the Opéra Garnier and within walking distance of all the 'Grands Magasins' this hotel has great views (ask for an Opera view when booking). One to visit on your next stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: IvanL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here between 26th to 29th January 2012. We normally stay on the other side of the city so we tried staying around this area for a change. The real plus side of this hotel is the location. It is beside all the shops, really good access to the attractions with the Metro station right outside the door, and the eateries and restaurants in the area are plentiful. We had an executive room which was spacious and clean. It had a very good view of the Opera which was nice. The decor was really good with all the usual features including minibar, flatscreen TV, separate shower & bath, nice toiletries. The lobby was impressive and the service at the desk was good. The downside was the price of the extras. Minibar prices are crazy. Broadband prices the same and the film prices on the TV were €35. I cannot understand why prices have to be so high. The local shops in the area must make a fortune from guests buying water and wine and bringing it to the room with them. It is cheaper for me to rent a movie at home (Ireland), bring it with me to France and pay extra charges for late returns than pay for one movie on the TV. Also, why do you have to charge for broadband. Can you not swallow the costs in the price of the room ? At €276 per night, surely this is not that hard. I really believe that if the prices for minibars, Films and broadband were reasonable you would sell a lot more. We ate in the restaurant on one of the nights and it was only OK. Again, price didnt reflect the food. Overall, I would stay in this hotel again mostly because of its location but please, please, please give a little back to your guests.

Reviews.Title: “So much better!!!”
Reviews.Author: javier1
Reviews.Content: I used to go tho Le Grand every year, but a couple of years ago I've stopped as it standards & people were really going down! I've decided to give them a chance again, and I'm really surprised how everything has improved, staff are loveley, professional & efficient once more, rooms perfect & comfortable, and I'm delighted my favourite Hotel in Paris is back on track!!! Yes, it is not cheap but really worth it, perfect location and great stay... Happy 150th Anniversary!!!

Reviews.Title: “Old school luxury, but PRICEY! Go for the balcony room..”
Reviews.Author: NavTrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the IC Le Grand in April 2010. We booked using points/certs (so we didn't actually pay anything). We did pay a 20 Euro per day "upgrade" fee to have a balcony room on the top (I think) level. Overall the hotel is gorgeous. The building is beautiful. The glass atrium is stunning. The check in staff were excellent. I speak passable french, but it was easier to converse in English. I have IC Plat Ambassador- they did a 1 level upgrade, but I paid the extra 20E per night for the balcony (actually 2 small balconys) room. Originally it was 40E but I haggled a bit... I think its worth it. Being in Paris is a bit a splurge, so why not have a sweet view of the Eiffel tower (which looked amazing at night), and Paris rooftops? The room was above average size wise for Paris (but not large). King bed was super comfortable. There was a desk and chair, and an easy chair. There was a sort of entry foyer which separated the bathroom from the bedroom. The bathroom was great. It also had a balcony! We did recieve the ambassador amenities (chocolates, bottled water). The gym is also excellent! Plus, you can pick up a couple bottles of juice, and a piece of fruit on your way out. Location is GREAT! At the Opera, Metro stop right there, easy walking. There are a couple cons... The wallpaper was peeling in multiple places in our room, a couple light bulbs out in the hall (not a big deal since we were staying on points, BUT if I was paying the going rate of almost 500 Euros per night, that would be unacceptable). There is NO internet anywhere for free. The service in the lobby bar was not very attentive. Again, overall it was fantastic, but if I had paid over $2000 for four nights, I would have been super picky. Also, we used the Roissy bus from Charles de Gaule- it was great. Cheap, easy, and a bit of a sight seeing tour on the way in. If you don't want to pay 30$ for a continental breakfast, the concierge recommended a small bakery just around the corner (Rue Edouard maybe?) that was great. Or grab something in the Metro.... Enjoy Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, beautiful and comfortable - Expensive”
Reviews.Author: rashaja
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights to visit Paris in winter time, right before the holidays. Since it's a Intercontinental Hotel, I was expecting very high level quality of service and I was not disappointed. The room staff was coming twice a day to make the bed in the morning, and to prepare the bed in the afternoon and to make sure you were not missing anything. Room service ( I had a cheese platter ordered ) was good but expensive, normal I would say. The rooms' style and decor is not modern, it's old fashioned but not outdate. Thankfully, I partially used my points to book this hotel , otherwise I am not certain I would have paid such a high price for a room. Location is prime, metro is accross the street and shopping ( Lafayette ) are within a couple blocks. You can take the Roissy bus to the Charles de Gaulle airport right accross the street. The only drawback was the fact that the room I got was pretty small, I didn't expect that in such a big hotel. Once I had 3 suitcases in the room, it was pretty difficult to navigate. But this is Paris. I recommend this hotel if you are not on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Well-rounded deluxe hotel”
Reviews.Author: kwc196
Reviews.Content: This hotel has Parisian flair and the consistency expected from an Intercontinental. It was my first time staying in their smallest 'classic' room, which was perfectly acceptable for a single traveler. Compared to larger rooms, the main functional differences are the lack of a separate shower stall and the smallish closet. The decor and high ceilings made for a posh atmosphere, while the courtyard-facing location made for dead-quiet room. New-for-this year l'Occitane toiletries are a definite upgrade from the standard Intercontinental ones, and the housekeeping staff was outstanding (nearly complete service on turndown as well). Room upkeep and condition were excellent, a commendable achievement in a vintage building. Service is somewhat impersonal due to the hotel's size, so guests expecting to be pampered may prefer a smaller one. The location is as convenient as it gets, especially for guests arriving by bus from CDG airport, as that bus stops around the corner. Sightseeing and shopping (both large department stores and high-end boutiques) opportunities abound within walking distance; the area is perhaps a bit light on quality independent eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned luxury”
Reviews.Author: Well_Travelled_TO
Reviews.Content: From the banks of orchids in the lobby to the l'occitane products in the bathroom this place bespeaks luxury. It's rather stuffy for my taste but beautifully done. Although the room was small and the view awful, the price was right. An added bonus is checking out people in the lobby - lovely, professional ladies with older men.

Reviews.Title: “We moved after 2 days”
Reviews.Author: TravellerfromOz08
Reviews.Content: We travelled around Europe for 6 weeks and decided that on New Year's Eve we would splurge and book a room facing the Eiffel Tower in a beautiful hotel. As we were Intercontinental club members (and enjoyed an incredible experience of quality and service at the Intercontinental in Hong Kong recently) we decided to choose this hotel. When we arrived a rather curt assistant told us that as we were members we would be upgraded to another room. We asked if it had a view of the Eiffel Tower and she said no. We had requested this 4 months earlier and told her that on NYE we wanted a great view of fireworks etc. She said that it was compulsory to have an upgrade as a club member so she HAD to upgrade us and no upgraded room had a view! After a lot of discussion and distress she agreed to give us a room with a view. We should have just taken the upgrade!!! The room was dated and shabby and if you climbed out of the window and stood on the ledge they call a balcony and craned your neck around the corner, you could just make out the top of the Eiffel Tower in the distance - that is if there were no clouds. The two nights we spent at the hotel were so depressing that we decided to leave or hate our stay in Paris. The reasons were as follows: - the hotel is so enormous that you walk around for ages before you find what you're looking for (no personal service). - because the hotel is so big, the staff are overworked and cranky or maybe just normally Paris cranky. - after charging exorbitant prices for the room, they have the audacity to charge extra for EVERYTHING! They need to realise that these days everyone includes free internet, even the cheapest of hotels. For 2 nights my internet fee was over 50 euros! - the location of the hotel is not great (only if you're going to the Opera). We wanted a nightlife (zero) and small streets with interesting cafes etc. Nothing like that here. Just big city noise and loads of traffic. - the concierge staff did not notice us when we arrived and left so we had to carry our suitcases up the stairs (cant believe there are stairs at the entrance!). Noone was there to open the grand doors at the entrance. Very bad first impression. Oh by the way, there were no fireworks over the Eiffel Tower. We didn't know that but it would have been nice for the person checking us in to let us know. And finally, we came away with a few bits on our legs and thought we'd been bitten on our walk somewhere. Now that I read other reviews, I think we must have had bed bugs too. EWWWWWWWW. Highly recommend that you don't stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and great location”
Reviews.Author: gwizz
Reviews.Content: Loved the rates, food, and accommodations here. Used Intercontinental package available through Virtuoso and got a really good deal for Paris. Room was spacious and nicely done. Overlooked opera house and had balcony.

Reviews.Title: “An awfully nice splurge for my birthday”
Reviews.Author: FlyBalletGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the weekend in an Opera view room on the second floor, overlooking the Rue Scribe. The rooms are opulent second-empire style - tons of red velvet, brocade, wallpaper. You'll either enjoy it or not - I did. Pro: The big selling point: Wonderful, solicitous service. It was my birthday, so the young woman at the front desk upgraded my room, and the staff sent up an absolutely delicious chocolate cake and a handwritten card in impeccable English. I really appreciated the gesture. The hotel does a turndown service and the bathroom amenities are L'Occitane. The location is perfect for anyone coming to see the Paris Opera - and the Roissybus stops a block down the street. Minor Cons: The hotel is huge. I wound up getting lost trying to exit once or twice. Internet costs a small fortune, as do most other incidentals. The Opera view rooms may have a view, but there is also a great deal of street noise. One afternoon an oompah band awoke me from a nap. I had to laugh. I stayed on an award stay and would absolutely stay here again. It's a splurge, but a lovely way to pamper yourself.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MOHD M
Reviews.Content: Le grand is truely a 5 star hotel, I enrolled as ambassador member where I can receive an immediate room upgrade & late checkout.  Well that is exactly what happened  I booked a classic room and I was given the upgrade option for a room on the opera or an executive room .  I took the executive The location is not on the champ but it is  a very life area, close to metro stations, department stores, shopping outlets, Restaurents, etc  The breakfast at le grand is rich in variety but not cheap , a must try. I loved the room, the beds are the best ,

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, just pricey for what for you get - that's Paris”
Reviews.Author: MJM1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the New Year for 4 nights, while the hotel itself is beautiful and in a great location I was disappointed in the room size. However, I understand that this is the 'norm' for Paris. We had a superior room with eiffel tower balcony views. The bed was definitely not a queen - somewhere between a full and a queen and there was a small writing desk and chair but not room for much else. Although the room was clean and comfortable it just wasn't what I was expecting for having paid what we did, I also felt the bathrooms were a bit run down and could use updating. Also the hotel is massive in size and you definitely get the "convention" type of feeling - ie not much personal attention paid. We were first given a room with an interior view but they corrected this quickly after calling down to bring this to their attention. The concierge was not very helpful - sent us to a restaurant that was closed for the evening, however the rest of the service staff were kind and very helpful and attentive to our needs. The bar was a nice place to spend our time and was very comfortable and the adjoining restaurant Cafe de la Paix is top notch. Understanding that luxury accomodations in Paris are on a different level, I can understand why this isn't a five star hotel - next trip to Paris I will most likely pay more per night to find a place with a 5 star rating and that is more comfortable, and my advice is that I think it would be worth it to look beyond the Le Grand for those who can afford too.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: LHRNewYork
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental Paris with my sister last November. It was her first time in Paris and I wanted her to have a great experience. We were not disappointed. The hotel's location is extremely convenient with nearby access to Paris' underground which we found easy to use. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable, what you would expect from a luxurious and grand hotel. Best of all was the service, especially the front desk and concierge staff. The club lounge staff was simply amazing, they remembered us by name and made every possible effort to make our stay even more comfortable. We wished we could have extended our four days stay a little bit longer.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent place to stay in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: paytonplace
Reviews.Content: This is a very elegant, 1st class hotel. The lobby is fabulous, with plenty of space to have drinks, high tea or do work. Rooms are spacious and well appointed. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Begs Bugs will eat you alive.”
Reviews.Author: Colin S
Reviews.Content: After reaching out to the Hotel above and the CEO of the hotel group to no real avail. they seem to think they do not have a problem or it will quietly go away. Well it won’t and I will keep bugging them until the correct action is taken. I would like to share my experience at this hotel. after staying 2 out of the 6 nights, my guests mentioned the next morning he had gotten bite during the night but his wife dismissed it as don’t be silly and we all moved on. Then after the 4th night ,I woke in the morning to find I also had bite marks on my arm from which I dismissed also, but on awakening after the 5th night I had a bigger problem. There now was many bites on my body, now I knew it was bed bugs and this was confirmed when I pulled back the white bed sheets to find were little spots of blood on the sheets. I immediately called the duty manager who quickly summoned the housekeeper to visit my room. This is where it all started to go wrong. The housekeeper with an assistant proceeded to tear the bed apart in front of my wife who was already horrified at the thought of what she saw on my body. So after searching for 10 minutes the housekeeper informed me that there are no bugs in the bed as we have a pest control company that visit regularly , the name was ready pest or Rentokil, I never quite heard her. So I showed the housekeeper the bites on my arm and she immediately informed me these are not bug bites? How she came to that conclusion so quickly baffled me as I am pretty sure she has not had the medical training that a professional doctor spent years learning. Next the duty manager called to say we are moving room, an upgrade from our junior suite to the first floor presidential suite. A nice gesture under the circumstances, there was also thrown in a bottle of house champagne, fruit and water for our troubles. Now I go to reception to talk with duty manager about a dinner booking later that evening and she proceeds to tell me all about how they have never had a case of bed bugs in 4 year and asks to look at my arm. I showed her my arm but said I am not going to show you the rest of my body. Her eye rolling response after seeing my arm, told me she was in doubt of my situation. Now she has peaked an anger in me. I also informed her about my guest experience the previous nights(room 3230) to which she just looked at me and said ..... impossible. Well my guests and wife are close by so I thanked her and joined my party to attend our dinner plans. But inside I am fuming about my honesty being questioned and I would go as far to say that she even hinted about my motive to which I replied, if I had a motive to deceive you It would have made sense to do it on my 1st night stay and not my last night. Then she informs me that the hotel will have to destroy everything in that room. that may well be, but if it is the only way to get rid of bed bugs than that is what needs to be done. This is not my concern. i do believe she is not willing to admit the fact or is in denial that her hotel has bed bugs. 2 rooms with bed bugs floors apart. I am sure we are not alone with this ? write here is you have had a similar experience at this hotel. Very Unsatisfied Customer.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: atltraveler52
Reviews.Content: We typically stay at 5 star properties and our travel agent, who has sent us to wonderful hotels, suggested the Intercontinental due to its locations and level of service. They offer a "private check in " for club level guests. Well, this is really just a regular check in done by an understaffed club level concierge crew. Our room was not ready (it was before check in time) so at was ok. The staff juggled us between tasks like maintaining the food in the club lounge. We requested an upgrade which if available we were entitled to and they told us they would show us the room but they were so busy and we wanted to tour the city that they gave away our room. The club lounge is bare bones with the same fare each day. The staff is so overworked that often there are not enough food or drinks and the tables are not cleaned efficiently. We were there for New Years Eve weekend and the hotel was "oversold" according to one staff member. This should not be our problem! At off meal hours, there are not even snacks in the club lounge. Tonight we returned from dinner at 11 pm and our room had not been cleaned. All I can say is our stay has been comical. Paris is a magical city but it will take some magic to make this a fine property to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: IliriaTirana_Albania
Reviews.Content: I was with my daughter for her 18 teen birthday,.It was wonderful ..

Reviews.Title: “Paris fun”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the InterContinental Paris Le Grand for about 25 years. I note the last few stays that service and friendly staff have improved greatly. From the General Manager to the Club staff I was treated with a very friendly and efficient attitude. Room rates tend to be high, as most good hotels in Paris are, but I felt that I received a good return in the value of what was spent. The Club room is one of the best in the system. Very comfortable and the food is outstanding. I'll return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel,one day I will go back here!”
Reviews.Author: Delta288
Reviews.Content: Wow, stunning in every way! Best hotel I've stayed in and amazing cocktail bar! Expensive but well worth it for a luxury break! Didn't try the food, but room was outstanding and the hotel is beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Impressive building”
Reviews.Author: USFan1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Grand for the second time and spent a wonderful weekend there. It´s a huge, old building with an awesome lobby, bar and café, large, wide stairs to the upper levels, very "Parisian" style. I would say it´s a perfect place to stay in Paris. Our room this time was unfortunately not in the "Opera wing" so we had no view to the opera but to a boring courtyard. The room itself was small. It has seen better days, the wallpaper in the bathroom was coming off at some spots. There was a very small bathtub and a shower. The shower even showed some mould between the tiles....does not sound good, but was not that bad, everything was very clean. But it´s not the room why you stay in this hotel but the magnificent hall where you can sit and have a coffee in the afternoon or a drink in the evening. It´s the gorgeous Café De Paix where you get the most excellent breakfast and a fantastic Café au lait. I love the atmosphere of the hotel and would came back always.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel, first class location”
Reviews.Author: rkoonce
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Paris Le Grand for a vacation/anniversary celebration. The hotel is elegant and personal. It is also quite large, covering an entire block, so there's a bit of walking required in the hallways which seem to go on forever. We were always treated with respect by the staff (who speak excellent English by the way) and the concierge desk was especially helpful with tips for local sights and taxi service. The hotel atrium is open and airy with beautiful iron framework for the glass roof. Lots of potted palms and other plants grace the area for a relaxed atmosphere. The hotel bar was well-stocked. I even tried a Japanese whiskey, which I had never had (tasty). The restaurant, Cafe de la Paix is very elegant with the gold-leaf and decorated ceilings. We had breakfast there every morning with a big buffet with American-style breakfast, eggs, bacon, sausage and the most delicious roasted potatoes and roasted tomatoes, and of course, the wonderful French pastries and breads. The cost of our breakfast was included in the room package, but off the street, it would be pricey. We ate one dinner in the hotel, and it was superb. The lamb was prepared as I have never had it and was delicious. We also had a nice pinot noir, Bouchard Pere & Fils Premier Cru Pommard which I highly recommend. Our room was on the third floor with a view of the Opera which I recommend. The only minor distraction was the sound of the metro trains which sounded like distant thunder, so not really too objectionable. The room was well appointed with a comfortable bed and plush coverings. The bathroom was modern and nicely done with granite counters and a tub and separate shower. I would have liked free wi-fi for my ipad, but apparently that's not common in the nicer hotels these days even in the US. There's lots of shopping nearby with the Galleries Lafayette and the really posh Place Vendome. Rue Cambon is an easy walk as is Tuleries and Place de la Concorde. We had exceptional weather for Paris in November with temps in the mid 50s F and sunny skies, so we took advantage of the great window shopping nearby. If you stay here, be sure to take the guided tour of the Opera across the street; it's worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations !”
Reviews.Author: McKShr6
Reviews.Content: This is the most luxurious hotel I have ever stayed at, it definitely a 5 star hotel. The room was large and we were assigned to an outside room with a view after I e-mailed the hotel with my request. We had the split bathroom type of room but with 3 people sharing a room this was more convenient anyway. The bathroom had a spa like feel and we enjoyed the L'Occitane toiletries provided. The location couldn't have been better, across the street from the Opera metro station, and very close to a pickup for the Hop On Hop Off tour bus. It was within walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and many tourist attractions and at night it was a great part of Paris to go for a walk. The hotel was very quiet we didn't hear any noise at all in our room. The service was amazing , most of the staff spoke English but were very patient with my attempts to speak French. Breakfast at the Cafe de la Paix was an experience, by the 4th morning I was able to order my omelet in French, the cook was very friendly and helped me with my French vocabulary. To give an example of the service, it was a buffet but when I went back to look for syrup for my crepes the waiter followed me back to my table to carry it for me. The jams and syrups were all individually packaged in small jars. It wasn't cheap but was worth the splurge . The concierge was very helpful in obtaining tickets, answering questions, getting us a taxi, etc. On my last night in Paris I decided I needed more gifts, so I went to ask the concierge where the hotel gift shop was located - he didn't give me directions he walked with me to the gift shop. It was really nice to be pampered and treated like royalty. The fresh flowers , mostly orchids, throughout the hotel were a luxurious touch. I liked the old world charm of the Cafe, ballroom, and most other areas in the hotel. I can't find one thing wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Josh C
Reviews.Content: 2 adults with 3 children in connecting rooms. 5th floor courtyard rooms. Nice welcome amenities and pleasant staff overall. The Bellman was a bit of an actor and the stereotype hand out for a tip before the last bags are even brought in panting and rubbing the fake sweat off of his brow. The maids kept bringing us towels - like 20 plus. Very odd. Odd restroom arrangement but overall a nice stay. The rooms smelled a bit musty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: grj11188
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the Opera Metro station and thus makes travel around Paris easy. We visited the health club sauna. Our room was spacious and luxurious with modern appliances. We enjoyed our continental breakfast at their Restaurant La Verriere. We visited Galaries Lafayette which is close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gpeterkin
Reviews.Content: Shower didn't work, room was like a sauna, and the noise from the hotel air-con units meant I couldn't even open the window. Not value for money. I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: pavee12
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay and it is by the Opera (easy access to the Metro and Orly bus to/from airport) and shopping malls (Printemps, Galeries Lafayette, and C&A). The building is beautiful. The room (junior suite) is nice and spacious. They offered us a champaign while waiting for our room to be ready. WIFI is also available in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, Old Style Hotel, But Some Major Personnel and Wi Fi Issues”
Reviews.Author: edsatty
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the last 2 most recent reviews I saw on this hotel. Some serious issues versus the extremely high price for hotel and food here. Example: 9 Euros for a can of Coke (about $13.50 U.S.) I stayed at this hotel for 4 days/nights for a business conference. No help with baggage on the way in (traveling as a solo female mind you), long line to check in, room not ready until very late afternoon, had to track someone down to get my luggage once my room was ready. No information provided about internet and forgot to ask, so had to go back downstairs and ask. Provided wrong information about internet access (24 Euros per day no less), was not given the code required for access, but made no difference since it rarely worked anyway. Only works in the tiny lobby - not in rooms or in any of the conference rooms, etc. so what's the point? Got kicked off the internet at least 4 times per day. I was here on business, so yes, in this day and age, it is an absolute necessity to have this work properly - especially for 24 Euros per day. Concierge was indifferent at best the few times I went over to ask some questions. One person at the front desk claimed to not speak English. Room - was typical European style I guess. A "king" was actually two rock hard twin mattresses pushed together. Not enough light. Shower - ??? a dribble of water out of a top shower head. Room was broiling hot no matter what I put the wall thermostat on, so ended up opening a window to a noisy street for air at night. Having seen all the complaints on Trip Advisor about internet, I complained bitterly at check out and they only charged me for one day. Hotel is in a prime location, right near the Opera metro and major shopping/restaurants/retail. However, recommendation: stay elsewhere for the price/facilities - like the Marriott Champs Elysee or Renaissance Arc de Triumph.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have even been in”
Reviews.Author: DAVE_and_ADRIENNE
Reviews.Content: First Class all the way, everything was perfect. The room was perfect, the bathroom amenities, bathrobes and slippers were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Such a rip off”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravDaddy
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum Ambassador in the ihg program and was expecting a lovely stay on a weekend get-away to Paris. What a sad surprise. First of all, the hotel is historic and lovely. The location is excellent. However, there were many shortcomings. Upon arrival in the grand entrance, no luggage assistance evident to help up the entry stairs. I only saw help evident once in a 3 day stay. A few days prior to my arrival, I emailed the concierge requesting specific restaurant reservations. No confirmation reply nor message waiting upon check in. There were several mis-steps with the concierge team subsequently. How can this grand hotel have such a poorly managed concierge team? The worst thing was the misleading and inaccurate information posted on the website about room types and available amenities. I felt the hotel management had the attitude of "nickel and diming" clients and did the very least required for ambassador members. They did not treat me well. In sum, I deeply regret choosing this hotel and feel that my consistent experience of shortcomings reflect a poor attitude on behalf of senior management. I will tell everyone I know to avoid this hotel at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: GL_trip
Reviews.Content: Few of us stayed at Hotel Intercontinental for business purpose as we booked this hotel for corporate conference. Positive: Business hotel with great facilities, great lobby area, wonderful location by located next to Opera metro station and Roissy airport shuttle terminal just around the corner, decent room size for Paris standard, good varieties of breakfast options Negative: Expensive WIFI - case1: I remembered seeing WIFI was included in the hotel rate but my print out of final booking didn't indicate it. So, I called front desk on 1st day upon checked in to confirm if our rate will include WIFI access and I got confirmation it was included. Hence I followed the instruction to subscribe for the WIFI which will be billed to the room 1st, as they claimed it will be waived upon check out later. On second day, my WIFI was disconnected despite I have signed for 3 days usage, I called the front desk to ask for help and again, I asked to confirm the WIFI rate will be part of the room rate, at this time, the lady front desk confirmed it was included and even quoted me that 'your room was booked under XXXX business conference here, right? then the WIFI is included." Oh man, I was totally wrong. When I checked out, another front desk staff handled my bill and she insisted WIFI was not included as part of the my hotel rate hence I was billed for internet usage with Euro60 (for 3 days) and euro24 (for 1 day) respectively, they even billed me for extra one day which I didn't use. case 2: My colleague's experience - He was charged for WIFI usage for 13 days despite he only stayed for 8 days!!! The front desk corrected the fee only after he checked the bill and asked for correction! So, please check your bill before signing the dotted line! case3: Lost passport in hotel room: My colleague lost his US passport in the hotel room when he was out for breakfast. He reported to the hotel immediately and the hotel just told him they will check with the maid on duty. However, the hotel just said sorry they could not find his missing passport in the room. We expect the hotel will do more to help him on filing a police report as he needed to get his passport replacement at US embassy by himself. But, there were no further help from this 5 star hotel with a passport missing in the hotel room! I knew most 5 star hotel will charge premium for everything to sustain their business, I also recognized most of the staffs were wonderful and provided good services at this hotel too, however, with one or two (for our case, more than 3 unhappy incidents) at the rate the hotel was charging, will we come back next time? The answer is clearly a No.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond...”
Reviews.Author: jboyle85
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fortunate to have two amazing client relations specialist - Ernesto and Sally - who went above and beyond to help me resolve a potentially dreadful mis-step on my part. But first, the hotel is excellent - from the beautiful lobby and open space bar to the very comfortable rooms - and i will happily stay here whenever i am in paris. The club floor lounge has a very good breakfast service as well as a comfortable lounge for morning/afternoon coffee and relaxing with lots of sunshine. On my last day in Paris, my luggage was lost in the back of a taxi and as i flew to Zurich, Ernesto spent the rest of the day tracking down the cab (without luck) and then passing the assignment to the next shift worker (Sally) to continue calling cab companies. All the while i was sent updates from either Ernesto or Sally - even just to let me know that no, my bag had not been found but yes they were still on it - until finally the next day Sally called to let me know they had found the cab driver and my bag! I was returning home to the US the next day and they arranged for the cab driver to meet me at the airport and deliver my bag - I did not lift a finger to make this happen! So to sum it up, the Le Grand is a fantastic hotel with great rooms, great food, and great people - I highly recommend for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Superb central location, impressive lobby and cafe area”
Reviews.Author: chris_explorer
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here and we enjoyed it even more. The complimentary drink at the cafe was a welcome treat after our overnight flight and helped soften the wait for our room to be available. We used the Roissy bus from and back to the airport and this location was great for that. The rooms were impeccable and it is a quick stroll to a lot of our favorite walking paths around the city. The reception area can get crowded and slow at times so be prepared to wait.

Reviews.Title: “Qaulity service”
Reviews.Author: abeerT
Reviews.Content: I have been there for the last 3 times starting Nov 2010, during my stay i realized the cleanness of the rooms, corridors and outlets, the team was welcoming, although I took my room after 3:00 pm, hotel was running High occupancy . Other than that all went very well. Specially with the perfect location near to Lafayette mall and Opera. quality service was offered in all means.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: pippy204
Reviews.Content: This hotel is okay, make no mistake what you are paying for is the location. I chose this hotel to be right in the centre of the shops and for that reason only. The hotel looks great on entry and the reception staff were very helpful offering to give us a late check out on departure which we took. We opted for the Executive room (2216) and on exit from the lift the room number signs were a little confusing but they do provide a map with your keys. The room was a decent size and had a very large bathroom and separate dressing room. Overall the room was a little dated, (it reminded me of the Westin pre renovation for anyone who stayed there). The old fashioned decor shows and it could do with an update, the air conditioning did not work and the room was a bit stuffy with miss matching lamps. The mini bar prices were higher than most other hotels in Paris and WiFi was 24€ a day which really is a joke. The 39€ buffet breakfast did not look appealing so we passed on that and I cannot comment on the restaurant as I was glad to get out and eat elsewhere. In a nutshell, I would say there are far better hotels to stay at in this price bracket which offer more in terms of value and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice building - big hotel”
Reviews.Author: compassjohn
Reviews.Content: It was comfortable and an interesting building. But it's large size cuts back on the charm. Staff was ok, but nothing out of the ordinary. The location is convenient, and there is plenty around, but it is rather central to the business district - not why we went to Paris. It did however seem to appeal to people who were more focused on nearby shopping. Personally, I enjoyed our previous stay at a smaller place on the other side of the river.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money or the star rating or to be Intercon”
Reviews.Author: dureid
Reviews.Content: Small rooms very hostile reception staff TV not working and very expensive. Changed three rooms and all were small with TV not properly working. The reception people never bothered though their manager tried. Having a gold ambassador club card didnt help at allllll.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Sandygb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location. I would recommend upgrading to get access to the concierge lounge which came in handy both in the morning and after a long day shopping and site seeing. The concierge staff had a little attitude but not surprising for a Paris hotel. The hotel room was charming and clean. The spa was nice but don't get a deep tissue massage unless you really like it very deep tissue. Enjoy Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Priority Club Winner”
Reviews.Author: BarryTheBlueWhale
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to use some of my many priority club points for a bit of luxury on a trip to Paris. The welcome was very warm and for a small (about £25) additional fee we were upgraded to an Opera-view room. The room was excellent generally though when showering the bath screen forced most of the water onto the bathroom floor. When I informed reception of this they replied that all the rooms did that and they'd send someone to clear up. I had already cleared up and was a bit astounded at the lack of concern at all the water that must be sloshing around this beautiful old building. Drinks etc were VERY expensive but there are so many bars within a few hundred metres of the hotel we didn't bother with the hotel bar more than once. A lovely building, lovely rooms, excellent staff and, with priority points, very good value. I would NOT pay the board rate though (many hundreds of euros per room).

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: angie54
Reviews.Content: Le Grand is a beautiful hotel and extremely well located! As you can see from the reviews everyone here is on business and the rates reflect that. Not many people would pay that open rate for a hotel room and they could never fill the almost 400 rooms in the hotel with people traveling for leisure and paying that amount. Therefore all the amenities reflect business travelers who just charge the meals, mini-bars, etc. to their company. However when you are paying those rates for leisure travel having to pay an additional $24 for internet in your room and astronomical charges for mini-bar is an outrage and insulting. The extra charges are obscene. Therefore Le Grand should be kept to a business only hotel. The place was flooded with people who were on business meetings, conventions...That's where they make their money and individual vacation travelers should stay at other boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Smithy200
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. It is in a good location and walking distance to Champs Elysees. The club rooms are a very good size for a Paris hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good place to be in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Armando_73
Reviews.Content: I was there with my wife and place was very good in all aspects. I had a nice stay (room, services, location, breakfast,...) and having to travel quite much is nice not to worry about anything and have everything as it has to be.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GRAND !!!”
Reviews.Author: Old-Lahaina
Reviews.Content: Very Five Star... Very $$$$ and worth it. Joining the InterContinental Gold Ambassador Club helps.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Moose26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while on a Tauck tour, so the cost was included in our tour package. The rooms are a good size, the bathrooms are wonderful,oversized with a separate tub and shower. Open the windows to here the sounds of Paris or close them for complete silence. The staff is all very polite and helpful. We had a problem with our air conditioning, after notifying the front desk, it was fixed very quickly. The concierge desk was very helpful on several occasions. The breakfast buffet is unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: pharitz
Reviews.Content: This was an incredible property and the stadd here was quite superb starting with Barbara who works in the VIP area. She truly went above and beyond and anticipated all of our needs. Then we must mention Alexandra and Lena in the club lounge who were just incredible and so helpful in whatever we needed. This is a MUST return for us when back in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the wonderful Opera district”
Reviews.Author: 3boysaremine
Reviews.Content: I traveled to this hotel for work. I was lucky enough to be able to stay in such a wonderful hotel because if I had to pay for it out of pocket it wouldn't be on my list to choose from. The room rates are very pricey but the hotel is extremely clean and in such a great area. It was a 3 minute walk to the major shopping malls- Galleries Lafayette and Printemps. I did try walking to the Eiffel tower one night but it was just too far- it would have taken me an hour and a half. The bathroom was spotless, the bed was comfortable and the staff was warm and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - Again!”
Reviews.Author: martas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second stay at the Le Grand, and it was once again, a great experience! We were upgraded to a superior room which was just right, decent size by Paris standards, with a view over the Rue Scribe, very comfortable bed, beautiful and functional bathroom, and good amenities. We also had access to the Club Level, where the food was delicious, and the service was very warm and helpful. Looking forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing... but over-the-top for me.”
Reviews.Author: SDBryan
Reviews.Content: A truly beautiful hotel that, if my company wasn't putting me up in, I would never even consider staying at. That may seem like a strange statement, but the hotel is really just so far above what I care to pay for a room that it wouldn't even be on my radar when hunting for a place to stay. The Superior Room is very nice. It's quaint in the old Paris style with a comfy bed, lots of attention to detail, a chair that I'm scared to sit in because it looks too fancy and a shower head that must have been installed to satisfy some wealthy seven foot tall French aristocrat. I had a croque monsieur, basically a hot ham and cheese, with pom frites, un salade and a Coke Zero in the hotel bar for 27 euro. The sandwich was great, don't get me wrong. I just don't typically expect to pay $25 USD for that kind of thing. I'm not really complaining. I like this hotel. It's very nice. It just caters to a different kind of clientele than myself. Maybe when I add another zero to my salary.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Intercontinental that we are used to!”
Reviews.Author: Casey D
Reviews.Content: Rooms were average, granted it is an old hotel. Pretty pricey, we took the train over from London where we had just checked out of the Intercontinental there...night and day difference. Went from very nice people to people with an attitude. The Spa in the hotel was nice. Hotel bar was nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “They want you to thank them for letting you stay here”
Reviews.Author: Doug B
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Intercontinental was overpriced and service was insulting. My wife and I planned our first trip to Paris and decided to stay here. We like to walk and the location is where we wanted to be = you pay for the name and location. The "Pros" of this review end there. The "Cons" are that the staff was rude (both the cafe and front desk), the regular rooms are small and you do not get the level of amenities that are commensurate for the price. Unless you have money to burn, I recommend staying someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: erskinechilders
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed for 3 nights on the first weekend in October. This was our third visit in the last 6 years and once again we were treated like royalty. Although the hotel was very busy-it was Arc weekend and Paris Fashion week- the service we experienced was first class (and more importantly ) friendly. We were made to feel welcome by the reception and bar staff and the concierges were particularly helpful. Our room (with a balcony view overlooking the Eiffel Tower) was luxurious and the public rooms spectacular. The entertainment value of people watching in the public areas more than compensates for the price of the drinks (which are steep by provincial English standards but are similar to much more modest establishments we visited in central Paris). We did not eat in the hotel on this occasion but have had excellent meals in the restaurant on our previous visits. We would not stay anywhere else in Paris. Special thanks to Christophe and Krumma for making it such a special weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: patten36
Reviews.Content: As we flew out of Paris at the end of our European trip we decided to splurge a bit and stay at Le Grand. We stayed here many times before and absolutely love the place. I love opera and the Palais Garnier is one of my favorites. The lobby/bar area is stunning, lovely black and white tile with luxurious couches and chairs to relax. The check in was flawless and quick. A big thank you to the front desk staff, always cheerful and smiling but very professional, please pass along my sincere thanks for all the help they offered. We loved the restaurant where we ate twice. Do try the incredible fruits de mer platters, and get the fines de claires and belon oysters, great value for a product you can't get anywhere else (well at least not that easy). Rooms are comfy and clean as is the bathroom area. Decor is plush and confortable. For the record, we got some nights on priority club points, the hotel is expensive but in my opinion worth it for a splurge. My only problem was that when my wife and I were trying to go for a drink on the terrace (which is always crowded due to it's location facing the Palais Garnier) we were told that the empty chairs in a certain section could not be used because the waiter serving that area was off-duty. My problem is that for the priced being paid for the rooms, the hotel should make sure that this does not happen (ie; found someone to be there for the service. This is just a small gripe however and in no way diminished our enjoyment at Le Grand. If your are trying to get the perfect week-end, especially with a girlfriend/wife/date (you get the picture), I can't think of a better place to start. The rest is of course still up to you. Enjoy the place, we surely did!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Back to history”
Reviews.Author: AmandaWillis1980
Reviews.Content: Cant forget the beautiful design and interior of this historical hotel in rue de la paix paris. I went for vacation and spent 3 nights it was amazing. very convenient location next to gallery la fayette and many shops. just in front of the opera. i waited a bit at the reception it was a bit crowded but seing their service make u forget. the service was perfect..if i come back to paris i wouldnt choose other than Le grand :)

Reviews.Title: “Peeling walls, carpeted floors, good by Paris standards but pretty lame by universal standards.”
Reviews.Author: Sf903
Reviews.Content: The showers suck...water leaked on the floor and the walls in the loo were peeling, probably because there was no fan or ventilation in the room. We were in room 5500 overlooking the garden. It was quiet. Another annoying thing is we asked for no housekeeping with the do not disturb sign, and they ignored it. Lower than Park Hyatt and more convenient. Overall 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: lEastmidsBBE
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend her for his birthday in february. We thought it was an amazing hotel very beautiful and worth the money. The only down side was that the food was very expensive and even the restaurants near the hotel was expensive and the food was not even that nice. We caught the metro everyday and went to places to eat where the effiel tower was which was better priced and tasted much nicer. RECOMMEND going to the the frog pub which brew there own beer in the pub .. it is like a wetherspoons and they also do snacks and happy hour. overall really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Class”
Reviews.Author: GM7535
Reviews.Content: This is by far at the top of the list for favorite hotels and it is a must see, as far as I am concerned, when in Paris. There are certainly many other hotels, more pretentious, and even with better service and/or amenities, but few to equal this in class. It is a historic hotel, right across the street from the Opera House and within distance of the major attractions in Paris. The center of Paris as we see it today, is essentially Napoleon III era, circa 1860, master planed and designed by an architect by the name of Houseman, who also designed and build the opera house, as well as this magnificent hotel. The hotel is old but completely renovated and over the year it housed royalty, chief of states and every Hollywood star that you can think about. The huge lobby, under a glass pyramid is not only an esthetic masterpiece but an engineering wander. Do not forget to ask permission to see their ballroom; it is breathtaking. I have visited this hotel numerous times over the last 15 years, even before it was completely renovated and it showed some age. The staff is great, the location is perfect; it is a little price but a better value than some of the other high end hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce S
Reviews.Content: Everthing was immaculate, rooms were fantastic with a small balcony that overlooked e Opera. The club on the second floor was Effect. We took breakfast there, had afternoon coffe an sometimes drinks and appetizers. Check out second floor as well. Location was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful hotel I have ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: kkmiausa
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Grande is located right next door to the famous Opera House. The accommodations are beyond what could be expected. The rooms were spacious and well apointed, the breakfast buffet was the best I have ever had, and the service unsurpassed. On our last night, when we went downstairs to check on our luggage, the supervisor recognized us and asked us where we were from. We told him Miami, and as it turns out he lived here during Hurricane Andrew. He is American but married a French girl, and therefore, he moved to Paris. He asked if we had seen the grand ballroom, and we had not. We told him we were ballroom dancers, and he personally gave us a tour of the ballroom. He turned on all of the lights for us, and we actually waltzed around the dance floor while he applauded. Another exciting note was this was the weekend Ben Ladin was killed, and we knew there was special security at the hotel. Watching the news, we were surprised to see a room just like ours down to the lamps, desk, and wallpaper on television. As it turns out the Pakistani Prime Minister was staying at the InterContinental Grande in a preplanned visit with the French president. This hotel is old world chic and I would recommend it to anyone staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel! But a little too fancy for me.”
Reviews.Author: branderson59
Reviews.Content: My wife and I used our Priority Club points to stay at the InterContinental Paris LeGrand because we wanted a true Paris experience but weren't willing to pay the actual rate. The hotel is incredible and the staff is first rate, they can get you anything you need. I did, however, find that this hotel was a little to fancy for my taste and fairly expensive ($14 for a coke in the mini-bar), so if you are looking for the height of luxury and you are willing/able to pay for it, this is the hotel for you but if not consider the Holiday Inn near Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: yptee
Reviews.Content: My second stay in this hotel and it remains one of my favourite hotels. The hotel is close to metro stations (Opera) and a stone throw from where the airport bus (Rossy) stops. Breakfast in the Cafe de la Paix is quite an experience, love the fresh fruit juices. Room is not big (actually quite small for EUR400 a night but this is Paris) with a small balcony. I can see Eiffel Tower from the balcony, lovely view especially at night. Small complain about the shower: water tends to get out from shower, as a result, the bathroom floor gets wet every time I shower. Wouldn't expect this from the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Location fabulous, service ordinary at these prices”
Reviews.Author: Porters051
Reviews.Content: A beautiful historic hotel next to the Opera House, so we expected to pay dearly and we did. The bottom floor Terrazzo and Cafe Le Paix are superbly furnished and decorated. However, our room was tiny given that we were paying in excess of AUD $600 a night. I would expect enough room to fit 2 suitcases and a queen bed as basic. However, we were sadly disappointed. There was always a queue at reception, with no apparent system to serving people checking in or out. Not good enough at these prices. The buffet breakfast was excellent though, and a drink on the Terrazzo is not to be missed. All up, some excellent aspects to the hotel, but they definitely need to staff it more appropriately.

Reviews.Title: “Central location at Opera Garnier”
Reviews.Author: liz c
Reviews.Content: This is a very grand hotel but seems to cater for everyone. The room was very comfortable and the only complaint i have which i did pass on to management is that, out of six hotels we stayed in, in a round trip by train of France, was that it was the only one which did not have tea or coffee in the room. This was disappointing as when one checks in after a long hot journey, it is nice just to have a cup of tea in the room when getting showered and ready to go out. Mind you they did offer us a free welcome drink, which we took up immediately and had a beer and a wine in the grand cental lobby area and no one turned a blind eye to our sweaty hot appearance!! When i mentioned my disappointment about the lack of a kettle, i was told " well you can always order room service" which i did not wish to do as its much too expensive! Still, on our return on our way home to Paris, we did ask and got an upgrade to club class and enjoyed the pre dinner and breakfast, very nice it was too with a lovely view of the opera.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service, very accommodating, large room”
Reviews.Author: jennylebeouf
Reviews.Content: Was very impressed by the service level at this hotel. Received an upgrade to a very large and well decorated Junior Suite. The positives are the location, service, comfortable bed and well decorated room, free internet and free minibar (thanks to status). The only negative i can think of is that the bathroom was tiny, which is surprising given that the room is a Suite. Light sleepers should be aware that vibrations from the metro and traffic can be felt in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Location, Nice Price”
Reviews.Author: faarias
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a couple of nights with my family. We reserved 5 rooms some doubles and some tiples. The triple rooms (which were a bit more expensive) were very large and nicely decorated and all faced the outside of the building. The two double rooms were much smaller (VERY small) and faced the courtyards. All were decorated very nicely, but the smaller rooms were almost uncomfortably small. The larger rooms all had a foyer, bathroom with separate tub and shower and were very spacious. However, they were oddly set up in that the toilet was in a separate room by the room entrance and the rest of the bathroom and sink were through the room (very odd). As an Intercontinental Ambassador, they sent us a box of caramels as well as two bottled waters to one of the rooms. The location of the hotel is very central with easy access to shopping on the boulevard houssmann or the place vendome and the opera metro right outisde your door. We chose this hotel because we wanted a decent hotel with a decne tlocation, but becasue we needed 5 rooms, we couldnt afford a more luxurious option. It served our purpose well for this.

Reviews.Title: “When visiting Paris, will only stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mparel
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to the Intercontinental Paris (29 July to 1 August). This time, we used points for a 3 night stay. We had a classic room, but as platinum ambassadors, were upgraded to a superior one. In addition, we paid the 60 euros per person for club access. This is a bargain as the club served a wonderful breakfast, drinks and snacks throughout the day, and an open bar again with dinner canapes and sweets. Every person we came into contact with at this hotel was gracious and could not do enough to make us feel welcome. From the restaurant staff at Cafe de la Paix, to the doorman, to the housekeepers, they ALL went the extra mile. The club staff was especially professional and kind--- Anna & Lavrene and 2 other ladies whose names I did not get. This is indirect contrast to the Park Hyatt Vendome where we stayed 2 nights (also using points) before moving to the Intercontinental: they were snotty, cold and the staff was very condescending. My husband, a Hyatt diamond member, even said that he would never go back to that hotel. So Intercontinental, Paris you have us for life. Your people make all the difference and I suspect this caring for your guests comes from the top.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: London364
Reviews.Content: It's an expensive hotel but adisappointment. No coffee in the room and expensive breakfast. The Concierge was not very helpful. It's a good location and beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Clovicek
Reviews.Content: 2 day stay for shopping and sport event. Just next to Opera house, very central to everything, including museums, restaurants and great shopping. For 325 a night, we got a small room on top floor, with courtyard view. The room was very small, nothing extra was included (wireless is expensive). Breakfast at Cafe de la paix, great food, but very poor and slow service. No upgrade offered for Platinum/Ambassdor club. Would stay again only if I can get better room at resonable price. Most likely better hotels in the same location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ltcollin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here august 12 through august 15 and had a great time. It was a bit pricey, but you got what you paid for. We would definitely stay there again. The location was superb!

Reviews.Title: “ok but not that great!”
Reviews.Author: ghadah
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in july for summer vacation,the location of the hotel is great,but the other staff were not satisfait at all ,it was not comfortable stay at all ! when we checked in we spent more than 2 hrs trying to check in despite the fact that i have platinum ambassador membership and i was really shocked when i saw there were no pass for us!,in the first day they took 800 euro as a grunted and i prefer if they let me know ! the next day i was really shocked when i checked my Visa and knew that the hotel took also 1400 euro i went to the reception spending time also waiting and wast my time because they have really slow reception and when i asked about the money that they took i was told that it is for guaranteed staff so they took more than 2200 euro as a guaranteed !!!! and they did not tell me so if i would like to pay by cash or other way because when they bloke the money it takes from 7 days to months to have it back to my balance ! i was really absit and they did nothing!,on the other hand the room was horrible the sink was almost broken ,the water was slow i even scared the roof will fall on us! ,they dont have any coffe maker! what kind of hotel not having that!!!,also when we asked about the adapter they told us it is in the regretter and will be charge for it. we ask to change the room and they change it for us after one night and the other room was good !,the concierge are really helpful and cooperation and nice ,the house keeper are great and fast servis!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, excellent service, drinks/food expensive”
Reviews.Author: TomandAnn
Reviews.Content: We won a Silent Auction for two nights including breakfast. Friendly reception, good bar, excellent breakfast, rooms fine, wide selection of TV channels in room (including Sky Sports 1), could not fault the service. Also, being at "Opera" it is centrally located with good metro connections just outside. €18 for a bowl of soup and €10 for a very small glass of house wine seemed a bit expensive but probably no different to other 5* hotels in Paris. Plenty of restaurants nearby. We are fans of InterContinental and very much enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with a view of the Opera”
Reviews.Author: Simken
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on many occasions and have always enjoyed it. The staff are typically French as is the service which is excellent. An easy walk to most central Paris attractions. Rooms are comfortable and the ones facing the Opera house are the best. Inward facing rooms offer no view but are still well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel which made the weekend”
Reviews.Author: Muckypaws666
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in Paris for a weekend break and wanted to treat ourselves to something nice and also central. Positives An elegant hotel, beautiful lobby and restaurant areas and a very large room and bathroom. Fantastic view from the balcony with a view of the tower on the 4th floor. Staff very accommodating and friendly. Bed very comfortable, room clean and tidy and well appointed. Fantastic views. Negatives No real negatives as such, but a few things that could be improved to bring the hotel up to date. 1. TV in the room is tiny, for the size of the room it was pretty useless trying to watch a movie from the bed. 2. No in room tea/coffee 3. No Wi-Fi 4. Ambassador Benefits As Ambassador members we were offered a room upgrade, but were told the upgraded room would actually be smaller and not as nice.. not sure how that classifies as an upgrade, so we decided not to take the upgrade and the room was still lovely, so not really a problem. Benefits that were supposed to be in room were not there, and had to be requested twice, eventually were delivered, but were not replaced the following day as they are supposed to be, but didn't follow up on it. 5. Room was not available when we arrived to check in at 3pm, had to wait 2 hours before we were able to access the room. Gave us an excuse to sit drinking (12 Euro a pint! ouch) Overall, loved the hotel, would stay here again.. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE get Wi-Fi in the rooms.. and change the TV's!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent location, great breakfast, ..... bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: edgardostern
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Le Grand InterContinental early in July 2011. Its location was excellent for sightseeing, shopping and dining, which is what we did during our visit to Paris. Although the hotel is impressive, the rooms are clean and the bathrooms are modern, we were expecting better service in general and for Ambassador Gold members in particular. We had a reservation for a Superior room (one or two levels above the classic room) with breakfast included in the rate. Check-in was slow as many people were checking in the afternoon we arrived. We were expecting a guaranteed upgrade as Ambassador Gold members, but we believe we still got a Superior room, which is what we had booked. The room size suited us and we made no fuss about it. However the room was extremely warm (it felt as if it were almost 30 C) and we cranked up the airconditioning to make it cooler. After a while, we realised that it had not cooled off one little bit and called for someone to look into he matter. It was a beautiful evening and we decided to go out and stroll while we waited for he room to get cooler. When we got back an hour and a half later we had a message asking how the room was after the repair of the airconditioner. However, the room was still warm and we called again. Reluctant to give us another room, service was called again. Maintenance came and told us that, indeed, the aircondiotining was not cooling off enough. They said that they would crank it up by manually setting the maximum cooling temperature and fan speed. It did nothing for us. We called again and they were going to send maintenance personnel once again. At that time, we felt that the system was beyond providing us with a cooler temperature and we asked for a room change. There was quite a lot of hesitation but we insisted as we had valid health reasons not to stay in the warm room. And even so, we still felt susbtantial unwillingness to change our room.
