We were finally offered a choice of 2 rooms (both were somewhat inferior to our first room, either in terms of layout or bathroom size) We took the one that felt cooler in temperature. The bathroom would have benefitted from an exhaust fan and a better sealing glass enclosure (European half length). Service provided by other personnel and concierges was excellent. Breakfast was plentiful and excellent and great to have included in the room rate as it would have been extremely expensive otherwise. All in all, great hotel, great location, need to improve service to deserve its quality ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of history but there is better, cheaper and les snob”
Reviews.Author: Warempage
Reviews.Content: I entered the lobby and was really impressed with its beautiful ceilings, decoration and atmosphere. Check-in was efficient and friendly and I got an upgrade. I asked for any other perks as I am a Platinum priority club member and Ambassador, but apart from a free newspaper there was nothing else.... I stayed here using my reward points. The room was spacious but had a bit of an muggy smell. The furniture and interior could use some refurbishment. The TV was very small and didn’t function properly also difficult angle to see the screen from the bed. Internet expensive at 24 EUR per 24h. The next day I wanted to make some photos of that impressive lobby and.... was kicked out by a snobby waiter.... He said it was forbidden to take photos inside the lobby. Now I can imagine that if I was paparazzi and take photos of people, it may be a problem, but I was pointing my camera at the ceiling! I really did not like the rude attitude of the man, who didn’t ask me I was a guest nor explained to me why I couldn't make any photos. Location of the hotel is very central, but in my opinion there are more interesting areas to stay in Paris with more interesting restaurants and shops in the area. There are a lot of tourist traps around this hotel. I didn't have breakfast here as I find 37 Euro for continental breakfast simply ridiculous. There are many other places around for breakfast. Like a beautiful Starbucks nearby at the Av de Opera situated in an old converted Opera House. Good for a quick coffee and croissant for an ok price with the same feel as were you sitting in the lobby or "Cafe de la Paix" of the Intercontinental. Conclusion: I stayed here using my reward points and was thinking I would really feel ripped off If I had to pay the full price (rooms starting at 325 EUR for Standard up to ..... lots). For that price you can find many classy hotels in Paris, which probably are more updated and friendlier then this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kwaller2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the left bank in Paris for the first half of my two week trip then moved to the right bank for the last half. The first hotel was lovely but the ceiling leaked! I had just done the Paris Marathon and was in desperate need of a little bit of an upgrade in accomodations. The Grand definitely fit the bill. It served my needs perfectly by way of location and service. The bathroom was laid out a little awkwardly but all the components were stellar. I loved the richness of the room, the colors and appointments were very tasteful. The beds were comfortable and fluffy. The food was very good and the service exceptional and attentive. I needed a razor and within minutes one came to my door with no charge. One thing I got my nails done in the spa in the hotel. It wasn't the best I'd ever had but acceptable and the employee was very kind. I strongly recommend this place and while my visit was for leisure it seemed also quite accomodating for the business traveler. The lobby was packed with business people.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand hotel but”
Reviews.Author: WanchaiS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Grand for 5 nights in July during attending a seminar. Location is perfect for those who love to shop since there are plenty of shops and department store around, e.g. Gallery Lafayette, Printemps, C&A, other brand smaller shops. Breakfast is grand and served at the famous Cafe de la Paye. Concierges are very active and knowledgeable, if you speak French, of course. I found the results were different when inquired in English and French. Rooms are a little bit too small comparing to the hotel name. Water leak to the floor when showering. These annoyed me a bit. Wi-fi is too expensive at 60 euro/ 3 days or 26/ day and is poorly function in your room (there are internet TV, of course with equal charge). Finally, lobby are too small. I stayed with other people money and it is good for experiencing the once a great hotel with its histories and reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with lots of Elegance”
Reviews.Author: MiaPianist
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times and we feel very much at home at this hotel. The location is excellent for whatever you choose to do. It is walking distnace to 2 of the major department stores in Paris, so it is great for shopping. The metro station is a few minutes walk which makes it extremely convenient. The rooms are all decorated beatifully with lots of elegance. The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are nice and clean. The concierge is very helpful for whatever you need. The breakfast in the hotel is exremely pricy unless it is included in the room charge. So if you plan to have a breakfast in the hotel, opt fo the breakfast deal. Overall, it is a beautiful hotel and well managed, I would recommend it to everyone visiting Paris,

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JPN65Montreal_Canada
Reviews.Content: It was my 5th stay, and i must say that sometime rooms are great and sometime rooms are in bad shape. Overall i must say it’s good because of the location, tradition and the restaurant Cafe de la Paix. tried to get a room looking at the Eifel tower or opera Garnier

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great room, looking forward to going back”
Reviews.Author: rubberbiscuit
Reviews.Content: We went to the InterContinental at the end of March. The location is great; only a 10 minute walk from the Place de la Concorde. From there you can walk in any direction and discover Paris. Our room was a good size - we had a bedroom, living room, and a large bathroom. I have to say the the items in the refrigerator were prohibitively expensive. I cannot comment on the hotel food because this was a business trip and our meals were eaten at other venues. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful inside and the staff are exceptionally friendly. If you are ever in Paris, definitely give this hotel a look.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, but busy and slow reception!”
Reviews.Author: Fosseboy
Reviews.Content: Always stay here when in Paris. Love the hotel. But every time we find reception to be busy and often short staffed. This visit was no exception. We had 2 rooms which were not ready until 3.30 and 6 pm. It seemed many other guests were having a room availability problem. And expect to wait to be served. Eventually we were offered upgraded rooms because of the delay and a free drink. Noisy party in next function room but their children were running around the lounge at 10.30pm. In the end I told them to stop "playing" on the piano and shouting as staff seemed frightened to say anything as party goer was spending money! Lovely decor and lounge bar.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lolapalooza
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the hotel and overall the best experience I had there. In general the service is very poor. On each visit I have had to wait at the reception desk for around 10 minutes before a staff member offers to check me in. On one occasion I was told that my room had been booked for the following day and when I produced their confirmation confirming that I was correct the receptionist actually said "Well we're full so what do you want ME to do about it?" Room service is ridiculously expensive and of a very average quality. I was charged 40 euros for two soft boiled eggs, toast and coffee...and the eggs arrived hard boiled and cold! On another occasion I had to queue for 25 minutes to get a table in the Cafe de la Paix for breakfast. The hotel has around 500 rooms and clearly can't cope with the catering requirements that involves. The room sizes are very inconsistent. I've received decent sized rooms but also tiny box rooms...for the same price. The only thing that is truly great about this hotel is the location, but I'm sure that there are cheaper options available close by.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great location, little issue”
Reviews.Author: sse1078
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 4127 in the Opera Wing. Nothing particularly unpleasant about the location, it was an interior facing room that looked out onto a courtyard astroturf. The "Superior Room" (rack rate of Euro 780) was quite nice though cramped (completely normal though for a Paris hotel, and probably on the roomier side). I upgraded from the Classic room bc there are no king size beds and I needed a king for me and my 3 kids. The bathroom was quite nice and large with a separate tub and shower and toilet behind a door. Both bedroom and bathroom had opening windows. The room was fairly quiet - insulated from noise of street and other rooms. The only thing I heard was the whir of the occasional underground metro train, but it was very low and did not affect the quality of sleep. My only complaint about this trip was cost of internet. 8 Euro per 15 min in the business center and about Euro 24 for a day in the room. I suppose that is not a knock against the hotel though, as it seemed to be somewhat standard based upon my other hotel stays on this trip. The staff were all helpful and polite and it was nice that kindly spoke english as soon as they realized my French was just passable. I stored a suitcase here for a few days when we went to another area of france for no cost and without any issue.The housekeeping staff were friendly and did a good job though on day 3, it seemed someone was in a rush and left 2 cleaning towels (easily distinguished as they are blue and white) in my room. As far as location, the Place de Vendome, Opera, Place de Concorde, Madeleine, Tuileries and Louvre were all easily accessible by foot and plenty of shopping, cafes and brasseries nearby. There seemed always to be a taxi waiting at the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great building, great location, average service”
Reviews.Author: CLau888
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Intercontinental Le Grand paris for a few times including this one. I found the hotel building a great one, very beautiful. Location is fantastic, close to subway station, not too far away from shopping street St Honor, and walking distance to Louver Museum, and lots of restaurant, but a bit far away from Eiffel Tower and George V. Reception service is always terrible, concierge service is much better. We arrived at the hotel very early in the morning, and understand the roon is not available. But we have to fight for our room at the hotel front desk in order to get the room at 3:00pm, what we deserved for. I have much worse experience at the front desk at previous stays. Breakfast must be praised for its vast variety and cook-to-order fry eggs, and fresh fruits. It is fantastic to sit in the restaurant solarium in a good sunny morning. The hotel banquet hall is just beautiful. We tried to ask for some hot water in the room, the water is free, but they charge 5 Euro for the delivery. Wired internet access is always not reliable. Bathroom is good in that it is clean and bright. But water always leak to the floor after shower.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: KJGator
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 2pm for check-in. Room was not ready. They nicely offered us a glass of champagne in atrium area of hotel while we waited about an hour. Very nice lobby and atrium. Took Roissy bus to hotel from CDG - very convenient and reasonable. Room was rather small - toilet was in a small room by front door and bathroom with tub/sink was on other side of tv. Was nice that the bathroom had a window and was sunny. Room was facing courtyard - very nice. Room was very small - not much space other than bed and tv/stand. Hotel itself is old - oddly shaped - long winding hallways to get to rooms. Bed, sheets, pillows were very comfortable. They do not have ice machines and charge 5 Euros to deliver ice to your room. Thought that was a bit pricey. The hotel is across from a metro stop but you have to connect to other lines to really go anywhere. Also, the subway is not air conditioned - this is very hot during summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: eetherid
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great Location (We walked to all the tourist attractions such as Eiffel Tower, Arc De Triomphe, and The Louvre). Also, when talking about the location its located right in front of the metro stop Opera and close to shopping and cafes. Very nice room and bathroom. The hotel conceriege was helpful in finding places to eat, pharmacies, etc. The hotel offers 24 hour room service as well. Cons: Everything is very expensive as its a higher class hotel (i.e. 9 euros for a can of soda out of the minibar). No free wifi. Overall we would recommend and more than likely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great location, Medium hospitality”
Reviews.Author: hrnikoui
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of our venture in Paris. It is located across the street from the Opera House in the heart of Paris. This is a very nice, historic, and well maintained hotel however, we had to wait to get checked-in since there was only one agent working in the reception area. Our room was on the top floor with two balconies facing the Opera house and a great view of the city. This hotel was asking for a fee to get access to the club lounge, which I have never heard before especially for the Starwood Platinum Ambassador members. There are great restaurants and shopping within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be returning”
Reviews.Author: JulesDarwin
Reviews.Content: Today the 3rd July 2011 we checked out of the Intercontinental Paris Le Grand Hotel. The hotel looked grand but the rooms and experience will not see us return. The first room we were put in on the 4th floor had a portable aircon hanging out of the window with hoses. The room couldnt be secured we asked for a different room. The next room was much smaller with a bed unsuitable for two large adults. The water in the sink also wouldnt disperse. We moved again the next day. Room 2310. The shower head was damaged the water mainly cold, the aircon functioned poorly, the water in the bath wouldnt disperse. As we were checking out I overheard an American lady complain of the same things. I wouldnt recommend this hotel, although it is central to the CBD. One other point. The internet is expensive at this hotel, as a paying guest I expected better:

Reviews.Title: “One of the most enjoyable hotel stays, ever”
Reviews.Author: Liana_Pebbly
Reviews.Content: Actually I've been to the hotel years ago, but still remember that from the moment I entered it I got the idea of what Paris is all about. Class, finesse, luxury... Generally during my business travels I was preferring the Intercontinental hotels as a safe choice, but this one is certainly on the top five of my hotel list worldwide. Now I'm planning a new trip to Paris... where will I stay? :)

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our time at Le Grand”
Reviews.Author: Smith01004
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel with Priority Club points. We had a great room. The concierges were extremely helpful with everything we needed. The area was very convenient to the Metro, restaurants and shops. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Not Ready for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: FredTravelVa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for couples, honeymooners, etc. It is beautifully restored. I really wanted to write a good review. But if you go to Paris on business, this hotel is not set up for use of the Internet/WWW. Amazing to write that last sentence in 2011. On my stay, I tried to use my laptop in the room: the connection Network/Cat 5 cord had the tab broken -- but I pushed it in and got some life but never the Internet. I called the front desk and a "techie" showed up who couldn't solve the problem. It was 1am and I was beat. I asked about wireless -- but I couldn't get a signal in my room. I went down to the concierge desk and asked to use the Business Center. He told me it was closed. I asked him to open it for five minutes -- no dice. I said: "Do I have to walk back to my firm's office in Paris to get an internet connection." He said: "Yes." Which I did. Not happy. (My laptop worked like a charm in the office.) In the morning, I learned that virtually none of the rooms have working wireless connections, but that the wireless only works at this hotel in the common areas (like the Front Lobby and the staircases). Odd. Why didn't concierge tell me?? After I heard this, I noticed that there was a ghetto of guests who sit on staircases or in the lobby trying to use the wireless internet. This hotel does not care about them. Very odd for an Intercontinental in the year 2011. My next hotel was the Hotel Amigo in Brussels -- I was in a hurry to boot up and the only thing the butler who showed me to the room said was: Here's the internet connection -- and pointed to a very nice card which walked me through the connection. Up and running in 30 seconds, the way a business traveler expects. Never again for the Hotel Intercontinental for all of its beauty -- you need to be certain that you will not have business back home. My other negative comment was that the room service is so-so vs. other fine Paris hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JOP1_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on business. Generally a very elegant hotel. Fabulous location opposite the Operas and a walk away from the Louvre and other attractions. Room was nice and quite large although the wallpaper was peeling a bit but this seemed to add to the character. Breakfast was ridiculously expensive and there was no free wi fi which given the exorbitant room charges is just unacceptable. Cafe la Paix has beautiful food but very bad service. The hostesses are very young girls who are more interested in gossiping with each other than accommodating guests and like so many restaurants, a single dinner is not a valued commodity and I was seated at one of the least desirable places in the house. Give the spa a miss altogether, certainly not a relaxing experience, no ambience and is noisy because of it's shared facilities with the gym. Room service was good and concierges were very knowledgable. Nicholas at Guest Services was awesome and persisted and persisted with constant follow up's to my room when a pillow I requested failed to tuen up in a timely fashion.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience in a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeamasterFrance
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental le Grand for two nights with a friend. I had the extraordinary chance to have been upgraded to an Opera Suite (80m² with a view on the Opera), which was absolutely fantastic and breathtaking. I cannot state how glad I have been to stay there. I found a lovely hand-written note from the General Manager of the hotel when I entered my room and this is a first! I have stayed at many 5 star hotels but I can say this experience has been a once-in-a-lifetime one. Pros: - Extraordinary suite, very large and comfy - Very good service, even at late hours (night service was responsive and nice) - Breathtaking view on the Opera - Excellent breakfast quality - Best millefeuille pastry in Paris - Best location for a hotel in Paris (according to me) Cons: - Very small bathroom compared to the size of the room but at least restrooms were separate Conclusion: I definitely will be back at that hotel and the Intercontinental Le Grand knows how to treat their members (Royal Ambassador card holder). I could indeed enjoy every one of the benefits a member is entitled to, not to mention the extraordinary upgrade. A huge thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best.”
Reviews.Author: fresh0206
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my first year anniversary and it was a moment to remember. The frontdesk agent Jenny; she was wonderful and informative. Our room is always clean by the housekeepers and they were fantastic. Location is perfect near the traing station, restuarant, and shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: mw104
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 3 night weekend break. The location is great - just by the Opera. we took the Roissybus from CDG airport. I booked an Executive level room through a Virtuoso agent which gave an upgrade and complimentary lounge access - not sure if this deal is still available. I'm also top tier in in the Priority Club /Ambassador scheme so was pleased on checking in to be upgraded to an Opera view one bedded suite on the top floor. The room rate on the back of the door was nearly 5 times more than we paid per night.Very comfortable suite with of course excellent views. The club lounge is very good with an excellent breakfast which included cold buffet items and hot breakfast items made to order. We were only there for lunch one day but was very pleased to see foie gras, smoked salmon etc. Afternoon tea was good with a selection finger foods and cakes - the macaroons were my favourite. In the evening there was free flow champagne and again a selection of cold and hot item - foie gras and smoked salmon again! Would stay again especially if I could get the same deal.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel with prices to match!”
Reviews.Author: Malim27
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night on points. Was expecting a crappy room, but actually got upgraded because of my card status (Platinum). Tried my luck for a free breakfast or lounge access, but no luck. Hotel really is a 'Grand Dame' affair, typical of what Paris was like in the old days. Lots of polished wood and marble, great buzz and snooty service. Terrific! Didn't eat in the restuarant but had cocktails in the bar which were lovely. The whole place is so very atmospheric, if a little overrun by Russians, Arabs and Japanese. The bedroom was spacious with quality bedding and bathroom supplies (L'Occitane). Nice quiet inward facing room on the 5th floor. Suspect road facing rooms may be a little noisier. However, this hotel is in position A in the city, an easy walk to most places with loads of restaurants close by for beer, food and people watching. A great experience. But be warned, this place is not cheap although for the odd stay, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, there are better and cheaper hotels very close by. Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: LambkinBern
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling to Paris and want a good hotel, I recommend that you consider other options rather than stay here, unless you have unlimited budget. Both the Hotel Scribe, which is directly across the street, or the Radisson Blu Opera are just as good hotels, but at the fraction of the cost. So, what is wrong with this Hotel? On the surface, not much. It is a big tourist hotel that plays to its strengths, which is its old Parisien granduer. The majority of the guests in the Hotel seemed to be American, and I am sure thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. It is extremely comfortable, particularly the beds, and the environment in the hotel is plush. However, the hotel has some big failings, especially when you consider the price I paid for a room for one night, which was EUR500. When travelling on business, I want to get in and out quickly, so the extremely slow and surly reception staff were an immediate put-off. Completely disinterested in my custom, I felt I had to apologise to one member of check-in staff for inconviencing her for asking to checkout. Additionally, why the check-in staff could not ask me if I wanted wireless access when I arrived is beyond me. I had to go back down to reception to get a wireless key once in my room. Finally, how a hotel can charge EUR24 for 24 hours internet access is beyond me, especially when paying EUR500 a night. Also, my other complaint was the pitiful shower in my room. Terrible. So in all - do yourself a favour and checkout Hotel Scribe and/or Hotel Radisson Blu Opera for alternatives to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay - Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: bluefan
Reviews.Content: Booked supposedly tiny "Classic Rooms" here on award stays from Priority Club Sweet Dilemma promo. Even though I became an InterContinental Ambassador recently, I was prepared to face the worst since I essentially had "free" rooms. Well, the rooms proved to be more than adequate. They even had us in very close proximity without us even asking. One had a particular large bathroom with sep shower. I got the sense that we were upgraded to "Superior" rooms rather than being relegated to "Classic" rooms. On a later award night, they even upgraded me to an Opera View superior room. Small, but oh that view. Reception desk was friendly on all occasions. One even personally delivered keys to our other room when it later became available. Best of all, as an IC Amb, I received welcome amenities of boxed mini Madeleines as well as Fauchon mini petite beurre on top of glass-bottled Evian. Got freshly-baked cookies as welcome amenity in the other room as well. Another benefit of being an IC Amb is that they will offer to extend check-out until 4pm at the time of check-in. The only complaint I can recall is that the A/C wasn't working properly so I just turned it off. Hopefully they get all the units fixed before the onset of summer. Didn't make use of all the hotel features and amenities due to our brief stay and constantly being out on the town, but found the overall service level courteous and friendly despite the hotel being very full. Wouldn't hesitate to return. But do yourself a favor and become an IC Ambassador before your stay here. If the initial cost seems high, you can attain it based on Priority Club points which is very easy to accumulate if you sign up for their numerous promotions. Another tip would be to take the Roissy Bus from CDG airport, which drops you off less than 100m from the hotel's entry.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location/Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: haknyc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at Le Grand. It is a beautiful space with nice rooms and very well located. The staff was very helpful. This hotel is within walking distance of great shopping and great art.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: EddyCS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon and it was truly a highlight! We stayed in an Opera View Suite. As fans of music and theatre we were in awe of our view from our room, and even bathroom, looking over the Opera Garnier, one of the most amazing opera houses in the world and home of the Phantom.... The room was the best I have ever stayed in, immaculately fitted out and very large, and the most stunning view. The Breakfast room and food at the hotel are second to none, we never wanted to leave! Pomegranate at breakfast was a true luxury. We were originally disappointed to have breakfast included in Paris given the bakeries of Paris, but this was even better. There were no real bakeries n the area but good shopping, good metro access and many cafe's. Plus a short walk to the Louvre and Velib spots close by. Do not come expecting help from the concierge however. They are very friendly and courteous, however do not know a great deal and do not offer the the level of information one would expect from a concierge at a hotel of this calibre. I will absolutely stay at this hotel again if I can find the funds. Go for the Opera View, it is worth it and enjoy the breakfasts!!!!! Room service wasn't too bad either, try the French Onion Soup!

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious introduction to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Piripi_NZ
Reviews.Content: They say people make the difference and this certainly applied during our stay at Le Grand. While a smaller room than other Intercontinentals we had been staying in, it was "beautifully fitted out"- my wifes words- and more importantly we slept well. However we were most impressed with the staff especially the conierge desk who quickly found solutions to our desired requests and made all necessary bookings etc without fuss. Not to mention tolerating my butchered French attempts. Great location - we walked everywhere. Why travel underground when there is so much to look at above ground? Bar made a great Mojito, admittedly didn't dine in the Hotel mainly because we were wanting to sample as much as we could elsewhere. Would defintiely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/staff, poor AC”
Reviews.Author: kakowNy
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for few nights last week. The good:The location was just perfect. Steps from the metro and in the center of everything. Easy access to the department stores, the Louvre, St. Honore, etc. Very professional staff with pleasant attitude, from the bell men to the front desk. Got upgraded to a junior suite facing Blvd De Capucines. The room was huge. It's like a small apartment in NYC. You can open the windows and watch people and car passing by. Very relaxing. Once you close the window, the room is very quiet. Great sound insulation for people who are sensitive to noise. The average: Even with the recent renovation, the room feels used and tired. The TV looks like it's 25 inches in size and it's way too small for a room of this size and price. It's also very old with poor video and sound quality. With the window open, you can not hear what's being played. And like the other reviewers stated, the AC did not work. We called the service and supposedly it was fixed. They did call to follow up but the fix did not work. The good thing was that the outside temp was very nice and we just left the windows open and it was fine. Also, they lock the Blvd De Capucines side door at night. So if you are walking back from the metro after dark, you have to walk all the way around the corner to Rue Scirbe to the main entrance to gain access, which is a pain after a whole day of shopping and sight seeing. Overall, a bit more dated than their previous other location facing the Jardin des Tuileries. But the service and the room upgrade made up for the deficiencies.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: youngsterdave76
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted by the valet who took our car for us (€40/day) and our luggage was taken for us to be delivered to the room. Check-in was friendly (although no ambassador desk), and we were recognised as ambassadors and given a 1-level upgrade. I have previously stayed at the hotel and as a previous reviewer mentioned, rooms vary in size and layout. We were fortunate enough to have a small balcony and could see the Eiffel Tower from there, although traffic noise was noticeable. We had 2 rooms, and the showers leaked over the floor in both (and my previous visits had the same issue). The decor is in line with the age of the property, and the carpets and wallpaper could benefit from some maintenance. Bathroom is a good size, with great L'Occitaine toiletries. The hotel itself is indeed 'Grand', and the public areas are kept looking good. While we were there, the chefs had made some large-scale easter eggs which were a work of art. We didn't eat in the hotel, as it seems a shame not to go out and experience the area. Service in the bar was poor, to the point where I didn't leave a tip. I had to ask to be served, and the staff member was not friendly (not a language barrier as I speak French). Location is great, with a metro station right outside, Madeline 2 minutes walk, and the open-top bus tours (€29/adult/1 day) stop a few minutes walk away. Galleries Lafayette and Primetemps are only at the next street up. Place de la Concorde is a 10 minute walk. There are plenty of eateries around. Only 2 downsides for me: 1. Wifi was not free (not even for ambassadors) and was €24 for 24 hours, which is incredibly poor (There's a Starbucks 2 minutes round the corner which is only €2 for an hour). 2. No tea/coffee facilities in the room, although I am finding a number of properties are now leaving these out the rooms. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location and Great Staff... make this Wonderful Place to stay in Paris!Paris!”
Reviews.Author: MrLee33
Reviews.Content: Having read the mixed reviews about this Hotel on TripAdvisor... we booked with some trepIdation (we mainly booked because of the location). Let me first say, the hotel location is fabulous...you are literally across the street from the Paris Opera, Metro, American Express Office, the Roissy Bus (the direct bus to the Charles de Gaulle airport), the Galeries Lafayette (great shopping) and Les Cars Rouges (which is the hop-on, hop-off tourist sightseeing double decker bus). You are a 15 minute walk to the Louvre, Place de la Concorde and Champs-Elsess. But what I appreciated most about this hotel was the great staff. We were booked for a "Deluxe Opera View Room". So naturally we were upset when we were shown to a very small, no closet, hot room (although it did have a view of the Opera). But this hotel very wisely has an "Attachee Relation Clientele" (a guest relation specialist) that you can immediately talk too if you are having any kind of problem. Within 15 minutes of us complaining about the room, the guest relation specialist on duty, Lena Ensuques-Hemissi, resolved our problem to our complete satisfaction. Our new room had high molded ceilings, large windows, a beautiful bathroom, complimentary champagne and yes...two small closets. We stayed 6 days here and found that all the hotel staff that we encountered were very polite and willing to go out of their way to help us. For example, the Concierge called five different restaurants to find out who had "beef bourguignon" on the menu (when all we asked is what restaurant may have this dish on the menu). This hotel is not the most beautiful, fanciest or most elegant that we have ever stayed at. It is a hugh older hotel which has it's draw backs. But what this hotel has is a great deal of character, charm and a wonderful staff. If you are an independent traveler this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best location, luxurious room with good aircon. Top service!”
Reviews.Author: Jtung74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my friends (2 rooms). As a regular visitor to Paris I found this hotel excellent especially the location. Check in and service: We arrived at the hotel very late. I knew it was a very busy period for the hotels in Opera/Vendome area and as I expected the hotel was fully booked. In fact we had to be transferred to another hotel nearby. This is normally not a good start of a hotel stay but it was dealt with very professionally. First of all we were treated with drink in the beautiful main bar while they found us another hotel. Then the customer service manager Linda arranged the transport etc to the new hotel and was very apologetic. As a tourist I really didn’t mind changing hotel – it gave me opportunity to see more area of Paris. The whole process of finding replacement to check in at the other hotel was smooth and fantastic. The next day we went back to hotel pretty early knowing that the rooms wouldn’t be ready anyway. The receptionist was very kind to have taken down my mobile phone number and called me when the rooms were cleaned and ready for check in. Everyone here spoke perfect English. Rooms: We had two rooms – one Executive and one deluxe, both on the 5th floor. The Executive room was decorated in red and faced the Opera House. The view was just fantastic. The Deluxe room had no view but the room was well appointed with a very tasteful decoration. Sometimes you can hear the metro and feel the vibration but it stopped after midnight so it didn’t bother me. The sound insulation was good as well. The bathrooms in both rooms were similar size, with L’occitine amenities and Frette robe/towels which were much appreciated. Bed was comfortable. On Easter Sunday we received some Easter Eggs. Good touch especially in such a big hotel. Air-condition in both room worked extremely well which was essential due to hot weather. If I have to be very critical about the rooms, I would say that there should be free wifi nowadays and the TV system isn’t the best in the world. The water screen in the bathtub was also not great – water came off on the floor after shower. Concierge Concierge team did a great job. We didn’t know if most places would be closed during Easter weekend so had to rely on Concierge. They were hard working and very humorous. Food and Beverage: I know the price in Paris is very high and people complain about the price in the hotel. I didn’t have an opportunity to try the restaurant but was told by locals that it was a very good option. Coffee in the main lounge costs EUR8 which sounds very high but I also tried some other hotels in the same area as well as some local bar. And I was surprised to find out that even in local bar they charged EUR7 for a coffee. It makes the price in Intercontinental reasonable plus the atmosphere at the Intercontinental was so much better. Overall this is a great hotel and I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great scene during fashion events, mediocre rooms”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekker63
Reviews.Content: Renovated a few years ago- rooms are good, but have had inconsistencies in size- from closets to respectable square footage. Decor is very traditional. Service in the lobby bar area at breakfast is inconsistent. You could do much worse in paris, and I'll probably stay here again for business given location. But not my dream hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of the life”
Reviews.Author: alexzhdanov
Reviews.Content: Very goodhotel by Intercontinental closed to Grand Opera. Everything is nearby, so, location is fine. Little bit outofdated, but charmed.) Especially looks good the view ti the Eiffel tower or Grand Opera. Very expensive service (roomservice' CocaCola 12 euro) )))

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Good choice for us”
Reviews.Author: CatherineS494
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Paris. First trip we stayed in a 3-star hotel on the left bank. The Le Grand had a great location for us. We could walk to the big department stores to go shopping, and the subway is just outside the front door. The streets are always busy with people, so it's perfect for having a cup of tea at a cafe and people-watching. The hotel itself is comfortable, though our room and bathroom were on the small side. The staff were willing to help with questions, and most spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Le Grand Hotel- Highlight of our Europe Trip”
Reviews.Author: ourcherishedlife
Reviews.Content: One major highlight of our Europe trip was Paris (j’adore Paris!) and I think staying at Paris Le Grand beside the Opera House is what made this trip extra special. They upgraded us to the Opera Wing on the top floor where we had our own balcony, TWO balconies ~ one from our bedroom and one from the bathroom, that looked directly onto the Opera House. Also a five star hotel with turn down service, this hotel really stood out as their bathroom products were L’Occitane En Provence and the building just felt magical. We met a very enthusiastic bell man who kindly gave us a tour of the magnificent ballroom, what parties could be held there! It was also very central to everywhere we wanted to visit like the Louvre and Musee D’Orsay. Travel Note: The Airport Bus from CDG to Paris actually drops you off right in front of the hotel. A pic from our blog www.ourcherishedlife.com shows our surprise when we got off the bus and got in a taxi and requested Le Grand Hotel only to have our taxi driver look at us confused and pointed toward our hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location – great reception floor, nice bedroom & I found the staff really helpful.”
Reviews.Author: bluesy
Reviews.Content: Great location – great reception floor, nice bedroom & I found the staff really helpful. So why the poor mark? Because I expect all the basics to be in place for this price! No tea or coffee making facilities in the room – no ice (although for £5, they will bring a bucket to your room!) Air –con that didn’t work! Only MP’s on expenses could afford anything out of the mini-bar! £8 for a handful of Pringles and £28 for a Vodka and Coke !!! (£33 if you want ice!!!!) I would eat the lampshades before I would pay £9 for a bag of M&M’s !!!! Come on – you have so much going for you here, don’t try to grab every euro out of my pocket!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very polite staff, well presented however let's itself down on a few basics.”
Reviews.Author: Flyaeu
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveller spending no less than 2 nights per week in hotels around the world. Their is so much good about this hotel, the decor, it's friendly staff, spa, gym I could go on. The hotel does let itself down, in a few easily addressed areas. Tea & Coffee should be available in all rooms, Free WFII in public areas at least, when the rooms are serviced used glasses should be replenished, a do not disturb sign should mean do not disturb, not a phone call at noon asking if they may service you room. Be aware of costs too, the opera district is exceptionally expensive, I do mind paying but I won't be ripped off!!! Would I return yes I would the hotel really is well worth a visit as is the city of Paris however sometimes the basics are good, and all companies should not be afraid of going back to basics from time to time

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Lawtraveler084
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay here on the way to a conference on Strasbourg using a combination of Priority Club and Ambassador Club benefits. What a wonderful hotel. The rooms were beautiful and the staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant”
Reviews.Author: trip12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night to see this end of Paris. It is a expensive hotel but very luxurious. The hotel itself is a beautiful historic building. We had a good sized room with nice terrace which was clean. We arrived early and the front desk staff was very nice to get us in a room early. Overall I really enjoyed my stay and will return if I choose to stay near the Opera again. PS The Rossy Bus from the airport stops right across the street from the hotel which makes getting to and from the airport very easy

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: RAM07
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Le Grand Hotel in September. We had to wait 6 hours to check in, which would have been understandable being that our flight arrived in Paris so early and the rooms were full the night before so they had to wait for them to check out. Nonetheless, what wasn't understandable was the fact that all of the European people, waiting the lobby, for the exact same rooms to be cleaned, were able to check in hours before us even though we had been waiting the longest. One by one,we watched as every person in the lobby was checked in before us. It was ridiculous! We finally went to the desk and told them that we were sitting there in the lobby waiting for a room and they kept putting us off meanwhile letting others check in. This happened until every person in the lobby had been checked in even though we complained twice toward the last hour or so. The hotel was outrageously priced, $30+ euros for a hamburger, and $8+ Euros for a can of soda. Worst of all the food wasn't even that good. You basically had to go somewhere else in town to eat and most of those places were high as well, but not as high as the Le Grand. The was very small and basic and most of the staff were rude. The decor in the build was nice and the rooms were a good size, by European standards, but I would not go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: OrangeWhale
Reviews.Content: Right next to The Opera, Galeries Lafayette and The Metro, makes getting around very easy. Hotel is also across the Fragonard Parfumeur, worth a visit. It is also a short distance from the Roissy Bus stop, turn right when out of hotel lobby and walk abt 200m. Bus stop is just in front of Nepresso shop. Hotel room is just like any others, nothing over the top. Wardrobe and bathroom doors are quite poorly designed, getting in the way of each other when opened. Watch out of the mini bar, once u lift up the bottles/cans, it will be charged, regardless if u actually consumed or not. Quite a big spread at breakfast table, includes hot meals, even Japanese miso soup, rice and stuff.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed with service”
Reviews.Author: blankeeta2000
Reviews.Content: Disappointing stay last week with virtually no Plat Ambassador benefits. My room had a terrible view. When I arrived, around 10:30 AM, they had no rooms available that they were willing to give me despite the fact that I told them I was VERY ill and would take whatever they could give me. I was furious that they kept suggesting the spa to “relax”…I had a horrible stomach flu and they were aware of that. They would not agree to call me or come and get me in the lobby to let me know if the room was ready, I was to check in with them to see if the room was available. Please know that I also emailed in advance to let them know of my earlier arrival. I just expected more from the staff. It is a pretty hotel, but my stay was certainly not reflective of the standard I expect from Intercontinental. I will not return. Other notes: Internet is 8 euro an hour Movies are 16 euro Hotel cafe sunday brunch is 75 euro/person The RoisseyBus is an excellent way to get from CDG to this hotel cheaply

Reviews.Title: “great location, big hotel"”
Reviews.Author: citymouse225
Reviews.Content: have stayed here a couple of times... love the location and rooms/bathrooms are nice (if you are traveling alone they might put you in a VERY small room) and staff is helpful. On the downside, 1) the breakfast (if not included in your plan) is expensive for what it is so I would go someplace else or order pastries in the lobby area and 2) there's almost always a line (no matter what time of day) at the reception desk (not concierge) which I cannot understand. they were accommodating for my early arrival check-in (noon-ish) and the concierge services are great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way - stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pakse
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in the desk clerk (who had excellent English and was polite about my feeble attempts with French) informed me that the two rooms I had booked were not ready. She told me the customer relations manager was coming to assist. Wow, when these guys have an issue - they solve it. Almost instantly we meet the customer relation manager (we have not been inside the hotel for 3 minutes). She escorts us up to the lounge, gets our family all tucked in with coffee and pastries and disappears with a promise to return in 10 minutes, as the bellmen take our bags. Within 5 minutes she is back, she has found two rooms. Two rooms....hah! These rooms were larger than my first home. It was really one of the huge suites that has side bedrooms; massive living room, two full bathrooms, a separate claw-foot deep tub and the master bedroom is all done up in red velvet. It's insane, it's over the top even for Paris - and we love it. She exceeded my every expectation - we have a balcony overlooking the Opera. So here I am - just some guy with a problem (wife wants a connecting room for the kid...) and these guys pull out all the stops to assist me. The room was perfect, the lounge was tiny but wonderful food - (the macaroons were the best I have ever had). The concierge designed a custom tour suited to exact request (don't ask...we're strange), and then managed to get us a last minute booking at Alain Ducasse's resturant. The stay could not possibly have been better. We'll remember the hotel and most of all the staff and their assistance for years. (Full disclosure - I am a top tier member of the holiday inn rewards program).

Reviews.Title: “awesome location”
Reviews.Author: misspeach80
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in the middle of the city. the metro stop is 5 mins away. the concierge is super helpful and nice. there's internet access on top floor you can access anytime of the day or night. my room was huge, not the typical small european room. the opera house is right across the street!

Reviews.Title: “One night of decadence in Paris - what fun!”
Reviews.Author: IaOrana_Maruuruu
Reviews.Content: We walked into Le Grand through the main foyer, a wonderfully decadent display with a greenhouse-type ceiling. Inspiring and refreshing. The hotel adjoins the Cafe de la Paix, which is a great place to sit and have a coffee and watch life go by. The hotel is located at Place de l'Opera. The corridors are luxe with fine appointments throughout. Check-in was warm and solicitous, and my thanks to Jenny at the front desk for making it so. The concierge sported a set of double-keys, indicative of his superior training and he helped organize our outing to Versailles. This is a place for a splurge and we had one of the best rooms in the hotel. Two french doors opened onto a balcony facing the Opera Garnier. Quite an compelling view particularly as the night we were there the French President was attending an event for graduating military. The washroom was spacious and included a separate shower and a tub. The shower head was one of the best and was a real luxury after a week of roughing it elsewhere (a small apartment that we occasionally rent). I know some rooms face into an inner courtyard, which is probably not an experience I would want; since that was not my experience though, I have nothing to add except that you should keep in mind that the hotel was three basic sides - and facing the Courtyard may not provide the most fabulous of views. The king size bed was very comfortable. A separate chair for lounging. A writing table with a separate chair. The wall was covering with fabric wallpaper. Close to the major stores - place de la Madelaine, Printemps, Galeries Lafayette. It's a great central right bank location if you're looking for an upscale experience. I'm more of a Marais type, and this was a splurge. We had a wonderful stay. Having said this, I have some minor gripes about service which really shouldn't happen at a hotel of this stature and at these room rates. In our room the TV wasn't connected (not just the power, but all the cables); there was no extra TP, and no corkscrew. None of these capital offenses on their own, but the wait to get them fixed was ridiculous. Only the missing TP became an emergency. Would I stay here again? In a heartbeat. Bring your own corkscrew.

Reviews.Title: “tries to be more than it is... more fluff than substance”
Reviews.Author: FransHC
Reviews.Content: the little things that make that difference simply were not there, in fact painfully absent.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I imagined Paris should be and more......”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyPatD
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, first class, wonderful conceirge desk, helpful, patient. Gave great restaurant tips. Our room was large, beautifully decorated, up to date, comfortable bed. Same for bathroom. After a long and busy day, a pleasure to come home to. The public rooms are on a grand scale. The location couldn't be better, 1/2 block to the Metro, across from Garnier Opera House, walking distance to all the major sites. Even had room service for dinner one night, and it didn't disappoint. Did not spend the $ for breakfast since there are so many wonderful cafes nearby. Had drinks in the beautiful bar. Outstanding service. Our first trip to Paris, and we splurged, but you get what you pay for, escpecially in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location - Close to opera and Lafayette”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in one occasion.. As expected, this high standards hotel cannot let you down. Opera is right by the corner, Galeries Lafayette 2 blocks away and cafe la paix (hotel's cafe) makes the best hot chocolate ever (TRY IT!) Needless to say anything about the rooms since when you are in there you feel like a king. Give it a try for sure (despite its high price...)

Reviews.Title: “A classic french hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scot_in_Aussieland
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in the intercontinental le grand before & stayed again this time round so i could use my priority club points. I was travelling with a friend & on the points you can only get a double bed room so i called the hotel & they easily upgraded us to a superior twin room which only cost €30. The hotel is very beautiful, right next to Opera and the metro station. When we arrived in the morning they had not set aside a room for us (a bonus for being a gold priority club member) but they did have a room on the club floor ready & that was given to us - to be honest we did not care either way as we were straight out the door. I was asked if i wanted late checkout (another priorty club bonus) which was good as i had stayed in other hotels recently that never mentioned it. The room was beautiful, luxurious and well appointed. When we returned from our day of shopping the room had already been turned down. The black out curtains are great and the beds are super comfortable. The showers are to die for, i didnt want to get out! We used the conceirge a couple of times & they were very helpful and when we asked for directions on our map, they went onto google maps and got a close up of the route we needed to take to get to our destination which was very handy. Only downside are the ridiculous prices in the bar. After our dinner on Saturday night we came back to the hotel for a nightcap. We knew it would be expensive because it was 5 star but €20 for a cocktail, €17 for an amaretto on the rocks and €10 for a packet of cigarettes was beyond a joke. We had considered breakfast but again it was €40 per person, so we ate outside the hotel, no buffet breakfast is worth that much. On checkout there seemed to be a random €40 charged to my room the receptionist couldnt work out (the description was very vague & seemed to be an automatic charge)but straight away she said we did not need to pay it, it must of been a mistake in the system. Overall, the stay was enjoyable, only downside is the pricing of amenties.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: MarioPTY
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Paris. I choose this hotel for the location, charm and was recommended for the Ambassador Staff in London. Great room ( mine was a superior overlooking Rue Scribe). The bed was great, the comfort of the room Is superb, the bathroom was Very roomy (it is Paris and the standards are the opposite), the amenities are from L'Ocitanne, towels fluffy, in spite that the hotel does not have WiFi I had in my room. The only thing I 've missed was a coffee maker and an alarm clock. The food at the Cafe de la Paix was superb and so the service. The staff is great, they check me in very fast and early ( I arrived CDG at 7:55 am ). The concierge very friendly and helplul and the ambience ( the atium in the lobby area ) is awesome. Definitely, that hotel is my home in Paris. Try it!

Reviews.Title: “It's about the service”
Reviews.Author: mrvalueseeker
Reviews.Content: It's a perfect location (2 blocks from the 2 largest shopping centers in Paris). It's a classic hotel redone in 2003 -- the lobby bar is beautiful, with an all glass atrium ceiling, and the room floors are well maintained. The rooms are small -- our double bed was quite tight for myself, my wife, and our 3 month old sleeping in the middle. But the bathroom was quite magnificent, with good sized tub AND shower (and L'Occitane products). Most impressive was the service. From check-in to check-out, we were well accommodated, even thought I was using 2 free nights. They found a room for us to check in earlier before noon. They answer the phone in 2 rings, at 6:30 in the morning to have housekeeping to bring up a kettle. They helped us countless time bring our baby buggy out of the hotel. And they let us check out at 3pm when leaving. I've stayed at a lot of hotels, and for the first time in a long time I didn't feel like staying at a chain hotel while staying at a chain hotel. Well done Paris-Grand. We'll be back. Mr. Valueseeker

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sairlines
Reviews.Content: We have very much enjoyed our stay at Intercontinental Le Grand. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated, the rooms are very comfortable with good size bathrooms for Paris standards. We had a room with inside view on the cafe/lobby which was very quiet and calm. The staff was friendly and helpfull at all times. Location in central Paris is the best! Only minus I can think off: internet is not for free and no coffee/tea making facilities in the room. Would definitely come back here if I can!!

Reviews.Title: “WORST EVER”
Reviews.Author: tstar2
Reviews.Content: PRIORITY CLUB MEMBERS BEWARE.....this hotel will not honor the same amenities you get in the states...and will make no bones about it.Platinum members are treated like regular street customers......no newspapers,no business ctr access,no continental breakfast,...and a charge for everything..The worst hotel experince in my life....and I am diamond on hilton honors,platinum on SPG Starwood,and holiday inn..Avoid if at allpossible

Reviews.Title: “great weekend !!!!”
Reviews.Author: nisreen-a
Reviews.Content: my husband and i spent the weekend in paris at le grand hotel for the second time ,the standered of this hotel didnt change ,exellent .we stayed in the standerd room very nice , spacious and clean .breakfast was excellent , the location is the best in paris ,sightseeing and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good from far but far from good”
Reviews.Author: mustafarawi
Reviews.Content: First off be warned if you stay on the Opera side of the hotel you will be disturbed by the vibrations of Metro trains every ten minutes all day and most of the night - we didn't sleep! And you pay more for the privilege! When we first arrived, the opulence and grandeur of the entrance and lobby (not to mention the high rates) set us up to believe that we were about to experience a truly luxurious stay. However, scratch beneath the surface and only disappointment awaits. We booked a night there for my wife's birthday at the tail end of a business trip - it was the fourth hotel between us that week - and had booked a room with an Opera view which is supposedly the highest category of room apart from the suites - so better than superior and classic etc... We were paying over 400 euros. The view of the Opera was beautiful and the room itself was spacious, very elegant, luxurious looking and beautiful. So at first we were very impressed. It turned out though that the bathroom was literally the size of a closet. We asked reception if there was a room with a larger bathroom but after initially suggesting we pay more to upgrade to a suite and later insisting that the hotel was full, we got the truth that there were rooms with better bathrooms but they were reserved for VIPs. OK, so we decided to live with it, no big deal in the end. Really it was the disturbing vibrations of the Metro that really ruined our stay in the end. The hotel should warn people who book on the Opera side of this, when we complained the staff freely admitted that this was an issue. How the hotel can charge extra for these rooms is incredible. What is the point of a great view if it feels as if there are minor earthquakes going off every ten minutes. The final disappointment was the quality of food from room service - edible but truly disappointing given the prices. Overall, the staff were very polite but frankly I felt that the hotel is so big and so busy that they have no real reason to be helpful, they gain nothing from it, which is a shame because so many people had told me the hotel is good and I had stayed there almost ten years previously and remembered it to be good. However, we will never recommend it or stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I Have Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: jjohnsontwin
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent one night here during a short winter vacation in Europe. I cannot even express how gorgeous this hotel is! I tried to take pictures, but they did not do the Le Grand justice. We only had two afternoons to spend in Paris, so we emailed ahead of time asking to check in early or to see if we could check our luggage. The hotel was so accommodating!! When we came through the marble entrance, two bellman took our luggage and placed our bags into our room while we spoke with the reception. Reception recognized us a Priority Club members, gave us a coupon for a free drink at the bar, and (without us even having to ask!) offered a 2:00PM checkout so that we could see more sights! If you called the front desk for something, it was brought to your room within 2 minutes. I could go on about the customer service, because it was incredible. However, you also must understand the location is unbeatable! There is great shopping (H&M, Zara) literally across the street from the hotel. Up the street you can find ATMs and a grocery store. Of course, there is food everywhere as well! The Le Grand has taxis waiting out front 24/7, but the metro is very close as well (beware of pick-pockets!). We were able to take a taxi to the Eiffel Tower for 8 Euros, so save yourself a headache and just do that. You must pay to use the computers in the business center and there is no wifi... HOWEVER, there are two people who work in the business center who can find things for you and that is free. Also, the business center has a buffet and coffee. I cannot say enough about this hotel. I longingly remember my sister and I on our 3rd floor balcony facing Rue Scribe. We did not even have the best view, but who cares! It's Paris and this hotel is so worth it. I am a loyal ICH Group customer, and if I ever get the chance to come to Paris, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I am returning for my Third stay!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: scott719
Reviews.Content: If you take all things into consideration, this is the 'Top 5* palace Hotel' in Paris. Price, st amazing lobby, tea service, Famous Restaurant, stunning rooms and most , an exemplary staff that has found the fine line between superior service and a certain easy-going formality that makes you feel at once, at home. How is that possible in the other 5* hotels in Paris where I have stayed? Somehow 'Le Grand' has found the answer. I travel to France with my Partner 'Le Terrible' who introduced me to this hotel as he is in France 10 times a year and this is his absolute favorite hotel in Paris. We stayed here in October and will stay again in just a few weeks. To give you an example, my partner 'Le Terrible' was able to correspond with the famous and exemplary General Director Christophe Laure to ask for some aid in our following booking. M. Laure not only helped us with our situation but he went above and beyond and we look forward to meeting him in February. This is the type of service I write about. Imagine! A warm, personal email from the Generl Director signed, Christophe. Well M. Lauvre's style is paramount in making this hotel so special. We have always statyed in the Executive rooms as my partner known by the staff instantly give him an upgrade ( of course...noe he is a member of Priority Club). The rooms are just stunning. Refurbished a few years ago, they have kept the classic lines of this grande dame while adding every modern amenity possible. The bathrooms in the Superior rooms and especially in the Executive are beautifully done with wonderful top line products. The Beds lull you to sleep in a room that is 5& luxe with lovely appointed furniture that is in keeping with the grand nature of the hotel and yet, cozy. Wifi, A/C, Cable TV and a nice size room for any hotel of this level in Paris, especially in the 'middle category' of room prices. The main lobby is a place I could sit with a wonderful glass of Bollinger or Krug for hours. The ambiance is Grand Paris at its best. The tea service that is offered in the open in the raised salon area is a special treat and makes for a real lovely experience and mind you..you might be to full to dine at dinner..so perhaps the tea service and a light dinner in the famous 'Cafe de la Paix' that is a Paris institution and the main restaurant of the hotel. This report is from my trip in October but really covers the 3 visits since 2009. I will give an update after our February visit. After a day in Paris, it is such a delight to return to 'Le Grand' to be greated with a warm ' Bonsoir'.

Reviews.Title: “living in a palace......”
Reviews.Author: LIK0S
Reviews.Content: Exactly across the opera stands this majestic intercontinental hotel.The building is designed from the same architect of the opera,conveing the early 1900s Paris glamour.We had an upgrade room with opera view which had a descent size to Paris standards.The room had classic decoration but did not bother us as it matches with the hotels atmosphere.The wooden bed was very confortable.The lobby was very elegant but the big surprise was the conservatory.What a fantastic place to have an evening tea.The hotel is in walking distance from all the major shops( maje boutique is next door and galleries Laffayete 5 minutes away).So after shopping we returned to the hotel to leave the bags and carry on with Paris discovering.I think that for the money that you pay for Le Grand it is hard to beat and i will be back....for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: rgrady3
Reviews.Content: Note: I am a Platinum Priority Club member with this hotel group. I purchased their Ambassador status in advance to get an automatic room upgrade. It is possible my experience was a result of this status. For $200 you can purchase Ambassador Status, and the automatic upgrade makes it well worth it (not to mention a free movie each stay and free weekend night stay). First, the hotel is located near the Opera right where the RoissyBus runs from CDG so transport to the hotel was great. The location put you two blocks from the main department stores in Paris. In addition, the Opera metro station was a block away to take us everywhere else we wanted to go. We arrived around 9:30 Sunday morning and were checked in to our room immediately. We had a superior room and were given a city view with a view of Eiffel! I expected the room to be very small, but that was not the case. The hallway had a tall shelf/drawer "armoire" built in, the doorway to the bathroom, and a built-in closet. The bathroom was what I would expect in the US (bathtub/shower, vanity with sink, etc.). The room had a queen bed with desk, easy chair, cabinet with a refrigerator (with room for personal items and not just the mini bar) and TV. Plenty of room to get around, and it had a small balcony to enjoy the view from. Decor included art reprints from painters such as Degas and Manet, and the furniture and trimmings had an old-world feel. There were only a few cons to this hotel: 1. They wanted 8 Euro per hour or 24 Euro per day for internet which is outrageous. They seemed to have moved the business center to the Executive Level which will run you about 150 Euro per night for two people so that wasn't really available either. 2. When we asked room service for a dinner setting to eat some food we brought back they wanted 10 Euro. We avoided paying this by just calling the front desk and they sent it up for nothing. 3. The down pillows were not very comfortable, and getting the non-allergenic ones were not much better. 4. We avoided Cafe de La Paix do to the unappetizing menu and poor Tripadvisor user reviews. 5. I used a combination of points and cash to book my stay so paying for the entire trip could be expensive, but I think it would still be well worth it. Overall, this was a great hotel and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautifully rejuvenated old lady in the City of Light”
Reviews.Author: LuxeDandy
Reviews.Content: Considering that Paris is one of the most prohibitively expensive cities to reside luxuriously in, finding a hotel that satisfies the requirements of location, history, luxury and service is very tricky. Personally, I think Paris is a city in which it is essential to stay opulently; it is such a grand, ornate place that the idea of retreating to a hovel in some god-knows-where arrondissement, no matter how much one saves, is mind-bendingly depressing. Le Grand Hotel, a fine old lady of sophistication that offers enough of the gilt and presence of the city’s ‘grand dames’, is perfect for those who consider The Ritz, George V and Crillon just a little bit ‘too much.’ We stayed in a deluxe room for a three day weekend including Valentine’s Day and extracted excellent value from the hotel’s location, first-rate concierge and comfortable bedding. I don’t normally like Intercontinentals, mostly because they are characterless blocks of concrete, but they occupy a wonderful spot in the City of Light. The heyday of Le Grand may well be over, when Chaplin, Churchill et al were in town, but it has as much history as any of the Parisian ‘palace’ hotels; L’Hotel might be where Oscar Wilde perished, but it was Le Grand where he wanted to be. Parts of the hotel have acquired a corporate dullness that is distinctly un-Parisian, but it seems that the recent renovation has been directed to eradicate this. Rooms have been wisely redecorated in Second Empire style and the lobby feels as luxurious as many of the more expensive rendez-vous in the city. We never ate breakfast at the hotel (what’s the point when you are in Paris?), nor did we eat dinner at the vaunted Café de la Paix. There’s just too much to do in Paris to hang around the same spot all day. What the hotel did provide was an extraordinarily convenient base from which to explore the best sites in Paris. The location is fabulous; on the Place de l’Opera, very close to the Place Madeleine, Place Vendome and Place de la Concorde and within easy walking distance of the Tuileries, this is the best value hotel in the area – Le Meurice is in a more prized location but is also legendarily expensive. I also prefer this side of Paris to the chi-chi Champs Elysees/Avenue Montaigne district because, apart from the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe, most of the action is down this end of town. Le Grand offers old world elegance with a very high standard of service for a price that won’t even buy a massage in the Plaza Athenee.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Homesick_Alien
Reviews.Content: I came here with a colleague on a business trip in November having hear great things about this luxury hotel. First impressions were validated on entry to the beautiful and ostentatious lobby area. Our flight was delayed getting in so we did not check into the hotel until after 11pm. Tired and hungry we asked if the restaurant was still serving which it wasn't and then asked if the bar would have any food to which we were informed that there would be a very limited selection. A better selection, we were told, would be available via room service, however we wanted to have a drink and relax. We were a bit frustrated that we could get better service in our rooms than in the bar. After much badgering we were provided with our limited menu. The club sandwich I ordered was excellent but for €25 it would certainly want to be! The bedroom was quite disappointing. It felt dated and considering that the hotel was nowhere near capacity I wondered why I was sent to the furthest reaches of the hotel (which is huge). The tv was at a very strange angle in relation to the bed and the reception was quite poor. My window overlooked a selection of pipes and grates so I kept the curtains closed for the duration of my stay. The sound of the metro passing underneath the hotel was an unwelcome distraction at night. The shower screen leaked water so that I used up all available towels every morning mopping up the pool of water that had formed on the bathroom floor. The breakfast almost redeems the other disappointing features of this hotel. They lay on a huge buffet that caters for every possible taste and inclination and everything is delicious (except for the coffee which is awful). Overall, for the money, a disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: kdom777
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel from Dec 31 - Jan 3 with my family to celebrate my parent's wedding anniversary. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left the hotel did not disappoint. Fabulous rooms, amazing breakfast and impeccable customer service. One tip for travellers to Paris, head to Rue Mouffetard for dinner and drinks. The area is full of lovely bistros and bars at very reasonable prices. Far fewer tourists than in other areas and you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “not recommend this hote, we could not go to sleep till 4 am”
Reviews.Author: sisal08
Reviews.Content: the hotel was charging 350 Euro per person for new year party and the music was so loud we were not able to sleep in our room till 4 am , We called the reception and he said to talk to hotel manager the next day to get a free breakfast. We made a reservation based on good review of the Expedia which is not reliable. My wife was using the calling card to call her mother in USA and the hotel charged over 200 Euro for a few minutes phone call using prepaid phone card. Room service charging 15 Euro for one cappuccino which arrived cold, hotel concierge was rude and lying by saying all the coffee shops are closed on Jan 1st , because they wanted us to go to hotel coffee shop which the food was awful and charging 3 times more than any other coffee shop around this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding As Always”
Reviews.Author: jp7124
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every year for pleasure...great location, great rooms (if you ask nicely), great restaurant. It is a very large property and you could seem to get lost in the crowd at certain times of the year. However, the hotel seemed empty during our 3 days right before Christmas. We had outstanding service, a great room and a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ozmerish
Reviews.Content: The LeGrand is just that every time I step foot into the lobby. The hotel never fails to make me feel as if i was in a bygone era. While the surroundings are pure opulence, at the heart of the LeGrand is a staff that treats you with respect and cannot do enough for their guests. The location is second to none and the best of Paris is literally at your feet. We love walking around the side streets and discovering something new each visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Luxurious..”
Reviews.Author: Snoozhe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awe inspiring! It was put together so beautifully, from the lobby to the rooms. Our check in was completed by a very friendly woman from Sweden who spoke flawless English. The location is fabulous within walking distance to the Louvre, etc. (like everyone before has discussed). Our room was a good size (for European standards) and had a small balcony with a view of the Hotel Scribe and part of the Opera (which is not so beautiful since it's under construction with a huge piece of wood covering the facade). We had comfy robes and slippers--small thing and a design flaw--but the shower door is not long enough and will spray all over (including the floor)--don't get anything near it that you don't want wet. The concierge was very helpful and recommended a moderately priced restaurant--I cannot recall the name--but it was within walking distance and had a "seafood" name. You could order fixed price and we had an excellent meal with wine for about $70 Euros (for 2). This was quite a treat for us--but keep in mind we paid with priority club points--which made it even nicer! The posted rate while we was there about $280 Euros--quite high with the American dollar exchange rate. Daily internet was $24 E a day, a little high. We tried to get on at some free spots--but it didn't always work. I'm not sure you would find this luxury with such a great location for any less though. If you can, splurge!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing two night stay.”
Reviews.Author: Big_White_Baer
Reviews.Content: First and foremost let me state that although I don't work for the Intercontinental Hotel Group (IHG) I'm an Intercontinental Royal Ambassador (RA) so I'm a little biased towards IHG hotels. My wife and I reserved a room at the IHG Le Grand over Thanksgiving weekend utilizing my RA buy one get night one free night certificate (BOGO). Upon our arrival at 1400 we were told that our room was not ready as the maids were still cleaning it. One of the benefits of RA status is the ability to check into an IHG hotel at 0800 in the morning and check out at 1600 the following day. However, I let this slide as we were offered two complimentary drinks at the lobby bar while we waited. Reception had our bags delivered to our room before we walked through the door which was nice. Our room was upgraded three levels to a club executive room which was very large and furnished well. PROS: LOCATON! LOCATION! LOCATION! Metro stop less then 50 yards from the hotel. Free mini bar with RA status. Free welcome gifts delivered to room with RA status. CONS: Breakfast and Club Lounge access not included in BOGO rate. We could not get the central heating unit to exceed 64 degrees. The shower handle came off in my hand when I tried to turn it on. The exhaust vent on the ceiling above the toilet was hanging halfway off the ceiling. The Roman curtains were breaking away from the runners and would only open one side of a two side system. The bidet hose leaked. These comments were all documented to the hotel’s general manger and to the president of IHG directly. Over Valentine's Day weekend this same year we were given an upgrade to an Opera Suite in the Le Grand utilizing my points and were expecting the same upgrade for this stay. I know I may sound like a spoiled little brat but please take into account that RA status is not cheap or easy to acquire. All in all the IHG is a very nice, very expensive hotel in a terrific location. I'm sure we'll return again as we both love the sights of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The best Paris has to offer”
Reviews.Author: Mich_van_S
Reviews.Content: One would be hard-pressed to find a better location in Paris: exactly at the Opera metro station, opposite Opera Garnier, a hop-skip-and-jump from Galleries la Fayette ... This is smart Paris at its very best. Hotel staff very friendly and excellent in English, hugely helpful concierge and beautifully appointed rooms. The restaurant Cafe del la Paix was the best in Paris and warrants a visit even if you don't stay at the hotel.
