Small attention to detail like placing a spare hair-drier in the room following my pre-stay enquiry about the performance of the appliances, were outstanding. I would recomment the advance purchase internet rates: for E330 I had a superior room with a balcony and view of the eiffel tower. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful; you'll probably be cheated”
Reviews.Author: DavenPatty
Reviews.Content: The accounting in this hotel is outrageous! They will re-structure the cost of your room on a whim. The will enter charges as "accomodation" and never let you know what that means or what its for. Three days after I checked out they added a charge of 715 euros to my credit card. They agreed their first three explanations for the charge were their mistake. Then they said they charged it because the SHOULD have charged more for the room when I checked out. I made reservationsfor my colleagues so they charged my for the extra rate they SHOULD have charged them, too. Be very careful. (Otherwise, itas a great hotel if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in paris”
Reviews.Author: Rogcar84
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the Intercontinental Hotel Le Grand in Paris. Great position, by the Opera. Good for shopping, attractions, etc. Beautiful room, very clean. Palatial hotel. Very good food at the restaurant, Cafe De La Paix. All the staff were exceptionally friendly, helpful (including the management) who made our stay very memorable. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Once again our thanks to you all. Roger and Carolyn Graham. London

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, apart from the location”
Reviews.Author: beautytravelerLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights at the Intercontinental so you would think they'd give you a nice room. No such luck, my room on the 4th floor was tiny and dark. In the bathroom the paint was coming off the walls. All very Parisian. I'm sure there are other, nicer rooms but judging from mine the hotel needs a lick of fresh paint. Another big minus goes to the expensive internet (24 Euros per day - ridiculous). Best things were the location next to the opera and Galerie Lafayette, and the fabulous breakfast buffet!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Don't believe the critics”
Reviews.Author: Tamaren
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was a bit nervous before we arrived at the hotel after reading some of the reviews here. I am pleased I did not let the critiques switch our reservations. It is a wonderful hotel and lives up to the reputation of Intercontinental. We booked a classic room that was upgraded to superior due to our Ambassador membership. The room was not huge...but then again, we weren't in Paris to stay in our room...it was enough for us to be comfortable. The decor was classic and just what we were looking for. The food in Cafe de la Paix, was not cheap, but it was good and the breakfast was included in our room rate. Overall, I wanted to express our satisfaction and urge caution when reading the negative comments. Obviously something didn't go right with their stays. It happens and everyone has had a bad experience. But those comments are not indicative of the hotel and you should pay more attention to the positives since they are a better reflection of the reality.

Reviews.Title: “What Paris is all about!”
Reviews.Author: brandonrenee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days, for a quick birthday trip to Paris. Good location! Great room (request an Opera view). Clean, Parisian, and lovely. :) I'm a bit confused about all of the haters on here. We have high standards, and this Hotel was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand experience”
Reviews.Author: Rover10
Reviews.Content: Without doubt the two outstanding features of this hotel are the property itself and its location. A superb 19th C building with grand public areas and incorporating the atmospheric Cafe de Paix as its dining room. We opted for a deluxe room for the extra space (it also seems to get you a better table in the Cafe). The housekeeping was outstanding - unobtrusive and timely. The location is excellent - 20 min stroll south to the Seine, Louvre, Notre Dame and 10 min north to the great shops of the Bvd Haussman. The Concierge was helpful and accurate on nearby restaurants. Snags? A few. The hotel straddles a Metro line and the rumble of trains can be heard (faintly) even on the 4th (of 5) floors so light sleepers beware. Breakfast service in the Cafe can be overwhelmed at peak times. If you can put up with the latter, then you should enjoy Le Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother staying here”
Reviews.Author: serum121
Reviews.Content: The suite that we stayed in did not have it's ac working. After complaining they sent up a tech who still did not succeed it getting it going. They forgot to serve water to suss as Ambassador gold members. Despite reminders we never received a daily newspaper.we booked a twin room and was given a tiny queen sized bedroom which was supposed to have been an upgrade. They said they had no twin rooms available. We had to pay a surcharge of 80euro a day to upgrade to a suite, or spend 4 uncomfortable days. The suite was with a nice view but a long way from the lift. Overall a unsatisfying experience.

Reviews.Title: “Less Than Grand”
Reviews.Author: VoxVolpe
Reviews.Content: This large hotel is less than grand in all aspects. From the checking in process, the rooms, the cold coffee served by room service to the non-exsistant valet/front entrance service this hotel lacks an overall feel of competence. Many of the staff could be found smoking in the side front of the hotel and the concierge was down right rude when asked by my wife to find a certain non tourist shopping area near the Bastille, honestly this is the first rude Parisien I have experienced especially while speaking to them in French. The rooms are in great need of repair as the wallpaper was coming off and the bathroom clearly had mold. The prices seemed high for the quality and I can think of a dozen hotels in Paris that you get better value for the money or an overall better experience. This less than grand hotel is one to miss.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Passenger86
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that the InterContinental in Paris is one of my favourite hotels. I have stayed many times there and every time I go they surprise me with an better service and higher quality. The rooms are superb and the restaurant Cafe de la Paix could not be better. Exceptional breakfast with a vast choice of goods from french to japanese. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who goes to Paris and can afford a 5 stars. In that case the InterContinental is definitely the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: omara67
Reviews.Content: Very nice luxury hotel in the heart of Paris, a bit expensive however the service is outstanding

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: aramfx
Reviews.Content: great location, excellent room and lobby. internet is very expensive - 24 eur per day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smart but overrated”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkBoo
Reviews.Content: Traditional, smart, international hotel. Our room was very pleasant and a good size (we had a junior suite), but the hotel is HUGE and the service seems to fall down due to the sheer size of the place. After checking the room we were given we asked to change to another as, despite great views of the Opera, it had twin beds just pushed together (not a double as booked) but we waited a good half hour for someone to come with the new room keys (and then only after we called down to reception). Our new room heating didn't work and this took several attempts over 2 days to get sorted (eventually by bringing in an electric radiator - not ideal!), service at breakfast was abrupt and a bit offhand, one day we had to wait in a 10 minute queue to even get into breakfast, there were no free seats at all in the huge louge area one afternoon - I wanted to read downstairs and have some tea while the heating was sorted in our fridge of a room, but was reduced to sitting effectively in a thoroughfare. All in all I was left with the feeling that I was less important than the day to day running of this massive hotel. I wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but overpriced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: FromNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I am comparing the hotel to 3.5 stars and higher hotels such as Westin, Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton. Thesis statement is that this is a run of the mill, average luxury hotel but nothing spectacular about it, especially to warrant its prices. I didnt feel like I got value for my money and would not stay again given other options or would only recomment to a friend under a long list of conditions and caveats. I reserved at this hotel because Westin Vendome was booked and Four Seasons may not be open yet. Hotel is nice but overrated and overpriced. Its selling point from its standpoint and that of other reviewers is its location - proximity to the vaunted Opera House and to conveniences such as the subway, shopping, restaurants. . Yes, the location is convenient. However, I personally did not find the Opera House to be anything particularly fancy, especially visually to warrant a high price - I paid ranging from 450 to 660 Euro. The hotel itself is an average luxury hotel. The ground floor public space is nice but not anything spectacular or out of the ordinary, some other reviewers made it out to be. The rooms are clean albeit smallish. Of personal taste, I didnt find my Opera facing room to be anything special (room itself and the view) and actually disliked it because of the audible street noise that begins at around 8 am and doesnt stop til around 10 pm - car honking, motor cycles, tourists and occasional street performers on steps of Opera. My most substantial, fact based gripes are twofold: 1) Gym is tiny and except for 3 or 4 treadmills and 1 or 2 elliptical machines, it has a paltry single cable resistance machine. A large, professional gym with a lot of machines is an important criterion for me and this hotel is sub par regarding that. 2). In room internet charge is expensive especially when factoring in the high room rate. I dont know how this compares to other luxury hotels but in absolute terms, its expensive- roughly 30 Euros a night. As for service, I didnt use use room service or need much interaction from the front desk staff. But there seems to be an undercurrent of slight rudeness to indifference by the front desk staff and ground floor employees (eg, the porters who set up the restaurant tables). I'm not a particularly friendly person myself who requires effusiveness from others, but the aformentioned staff seemed to either be slightly rude (no hello when you pass right by them) to having that forced, affected politness.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: alwaysenjoyinglife1
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Excellent Location. Gallerie Lafayette and Printemps was walking distance. Tour bus stop right around the corner, pharmacy, plenty of cafe's. 2. Staff friendly, spoke english, other guests friendly as well. Cons: 1. Internal pipes or building gave out consistent knocking noises throughout the night keeping me up. 2. Although the "do not disturb" sign was up, the maid still came into our room to clean. 3. The closet room *we had a junior suite) was INCREDIBLY dark with one mere small ceiling light. Made it absolutely impossible to see what you are doing or identify clothes. Way too dark and they need to install 5 more ceiling lights.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN PARIS”
Reviews.Author: sizamle
Reviews.Content: My husband and i, we stayed for 4 nights in August in this hotel. In this hotel you really have the filling of luxury. The hotel has the best location, within walking distance to all attractuib. The service is what you expect from a 5 star hotel. The rooms are comfortable with classic style decoration which is my style. We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel and definitely we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant surroundings and great service - ideal for romantic weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Beltraveller
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We were celebrating our 30th Wedding Anniversary, and this was the ideal place to do it. Our room wasn't quite ready when we arrived, and we were treated to complimentary champagne and nibbles in the lovely, bright, spacious conservatory style cafe (with a fabulous pineapple chandelier) on the ground floor. Our room was compact but comfortable and we had a view of the Eiffel tower from our balcony window, (although you had to go out onto a small balcony to see it). The staff were very helpful, and we had more complimentary champagne that evening when we returned to our room to find a half bottle of champane, lovely chocolates and a tin of mini madelienes. We were made to feel very special! Location was excellent and a great place to base your weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: cathyleics
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel nothing is to much trouble.We couldn't get into our case but hotel were able to help us.Breakfast out of this world !

Reviews.Title: “Architecture like you'd expect in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LynneAshley
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great as mentioned in other reviews. We were asked upon check-in if we wanted to upgrade and we did. Our flight from Boston arrived early morning and we were able to get right in a room by 9:30 that morning. The room on the 5th floor, was large with a balcony, large enough only to stand out on and look out but with a beautiful view of the Opera House, the streets and people below, and the boutique shops as well. It was nice to be able to leave the large windows open all night and get fresh air. It also had plenty of lighting. We did not take our laptops as it was vacation so we did not use the internet. We ate dinner that first night at the hotels outside eating area...we opted for sandwiches, they were great ...pricey, but we wanted to stay close that first night as we were tired. The bathroom was very large, modern, and had room that you could leave out your makeup and such without a problem. I found all amenities to be great. The staff speaks English with no problem and could not have been more helpful. I did get a massage at the hotel the first day we arrived....it was wonderful. I had a very nice woman by the name of Pauline who gave a great massage to someone who had just gotten off a cramped flight and been up almost 20 hours. It was everything I could have wanted on my first trip to Paris.....and when I return I would stay there again. A truly great hotel with a wonderful staff as well. They know their customer service. The only thing my husband and I noticed is that the hotel did not have doormen...maybe a sign of the economic times...but it seemed odd that a hotel with high standards did not have them.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mos505
Reviews.Content: The Grand is one of the more impressive European Intercontinentals, with its classic architecture matching the neighboring Opéra Garnier. Its physical standards are not that far from some of Paris' most expensive hotels. This very central location makes it very convenient for most activities, including shopping and sightseeing. Transportation options are excellent, with a major subway station and the airport 'Roissybus' station right in front of the hotel. Due to the building's age, there is quite some variation among the rooms; the most basic 'classic' rooms are very small and best avoided. The rooms quickly improve as prices climb, with some having a preferred opera view. The Club lounge is very nice as well, but the hotel does try its best not to upgrade to Club level.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL HAS THE ATMOSPHERE OF A CENTRAL TRAIN STATION”
Reviews.Author: divaAthens
Reviews.Content: There is no way you can call this property deluxe although top rate is charged. Club room size is a joke , tv not working in check in , bath amenities not enough for 2 persons and not replaced. hotel needs maintance in many areas.Club lounge tired and outdated.internet charge outrageous.Brealfast in cafe dela paix unattentive.Hotel caters for mass production business, individual feels like a number in a queue.

Reviews.Title: “Best location ever”
Reviews.Author: amfssp
Reviews.Content: If you stay at this hotel, you can do anything in Paris really easily. The building is a monumental attraction and service is great. Location is the best. I had the chance to have a second honeymoon with my partner. Dont miss a Capuccino at Cafe de la paix on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: ahcLondon
Reviews.Content: Old style Parisien Luxury hotel in a fantastic location. Stayed with my husband and teenage daughter for a long weekend to Paris. It was her first time in Paris, so we did all the main sights, which the hotel was perfectly located for. Also Close to a fabulous range of high end shops to browse. Concierge team were tremendous in recommending a good range of places to eat. Yes, the hotel prices are on the expensive side, but we got a good rate, perhaps because it was still holiday season and were upgraded to a suite with an extra bed for our daughter. This is very much a 5* hotel and a fabulous treat for a luxury stay. Would definitley recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: justmarried57
Reviews.Content: My husband and i got the chance to stay at this hotel for 3 nights and when i arrived i was overwhelmed with the beauty of the hotel. When we arrived the receptionist had perfect english and upgraded us to a beautiful suite with 2 balconies overlooking the opera house! Even although i was in paris i could have easily stayed in the hotel for the duration as our view was fantastic! also may i add also that i have never slep in such a comfy bed,it was truly amazing. I recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to visit paris, the location could not get any better, walking distance to most places and a metro stop across the road. This was the 3rd time i have been to paris and by staying at this hotel it was by far the most enjoyable, it is very expensive and i dont think i could afford to stay there again but if you can afford it then definetly go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Andrew41
Reviews.Content: It all worked, no complaints. Very beautiful hotel in a great location. Can definitley recommend and would not hesisate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our return to a special place”
Reviews.Author: braunwynn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental for a 3rd time this past March to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. Though we have lived in Paris (for 3 years, 15 years ago) and stayed in numerous hotels (we visit Paris at least every 15 months), we always feel as though the Intercontinental is a special place. From their great location in the center of Paris to their incredible concierge support to the old-world ambience, we always love being there. Their service is always exceptional, our room is always charming and the hotel management always goes overboard to ensure that guests are made welcome. We opted for a club level room for this past visit and couldn't have been happier. We were upgraded to a fabulous room overlooking the Opera house and loved that we were on the same floor as the club lounge. My husband, unfortunately, developed food poisoning from a restaurant and spent 2 days in bed. Having the access to the club lounge made it easy for me to obtain food throughout the day while being able to stay near him. In addition, the club staff found a local doctor and an English-speaking pharmacy to enable us to easily obtain a diagnosis and medicine to speed his recovery. All in all, I highly recommend the Intercontinental for its location (very close to the large department stores....if one likes shopping), its charm, its service and the overall quality of the experience of staying there.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff particluray receptionist”
Reviews.Author: Mkoussar
Reviews.Content: I have been in Paris in 9 July this year together with my wife and my daughter my visit to Le Grand hotel, as a frequent traveler I had the chance to be most of the five stars hotels in Eroupe. I was amazed when I fund this hotel is evaluated as a four stars because in comparison with other five stars hotels in Paris. Due to lack of non smoking room Young lady in reception ( Ms. Lena Schlenner ) who was very helpful efficient welcoming has upgraded us to a beutiful well decorated suite on arrival. All the hotel staff from bell boy, receptionist and concierge staff were so friendly and helpful they made every single person. Fitness room was not big but good enough. I decided to use this hotel always in my future visit in Paris. I wish they keep the same standard and current reasonable prices. Mehdi

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, seriously useless.....”
Reviews.Author: MohammedUAE
Reviews.Content: After a long drive from Cahmonix i thought i will get the same service which i usually get from other Intercontinental Hotels,, however this didnt.... the woman who checked me in saw that we are 2 people and decided to give us a small "shoebox"sized room on the 1st floor, i said why first floor she was like you booked this type of room "which is untrue" secondly i was in a rush to return the car to the rental agency before they close so i was a bit cranky still she was rude... my credit card got charged but apparently their system didnt accept it, so i called the bank and they said it went through, i told the other lady at front desk about it she was nice enough to say she will cancel whatever charge i have... request higher floors... thats my tip and be sure that the room service tray fits in the room not like my shoe boxed sized 1506!! other staff were friendly except for that front desk woman... she wasnt nice...

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE value”
Reviews.Author: marmaduketravel
Reviews.Content: First, the positive -- the hotel is in a beautiful building and has gorgeous views of the opera house. The location is great, just next to a metro and there are several taxi stands nearby. Lots of great shops and restaurants in the area. But, this hotel might be the worst value for my money I've ever had. It was certainly the worst experience I've ever had with a hotel in Paris. From start to finish I had problems every day for four days -- check in, room, dining and then check out. Instead of the charming service I've come to enjoy at hotels in Paris, I had several interactions with hotel staff at the front desk and concierge that were very close to being outright rude. I also saw/heard several other guests having similar experiences. When my wife and I came back through Paris at the end of our trip, we didn't consider staying here again. Here's my advice -- stay somewhere else, but drop by the lobby of the Intercontinental for a tea and linger for a few moments at the front desk and just listen to the conversations. I bet you'll decide not to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DonManolo
Reviews.Content: Fanfare..... Got to the hotel at 2 PM to find our rooms (confirmed for a noon check in) were still occupied and not expected to be released till after 4. Took a breath, went to the Louvre (short walk) and by 6 there were still no rooms! After a showdown which we won, we were upgraded to an enormous 2 bedroom suite, but the beds were bare and the floors not vacuumed. It was 8 PM before we could finally take possession. Some staff were pretty awesome. Others were, hmmm.... French..... Cafe de la Paix puts out a great spread for breakfast! Avoid room service! Coffee for 4 came with a bill for 48 Euros. I complained and they left the coffee and did not charge. Location is good. Walking distance from the Louvre.. Across the street from the metro. Lots of good food close by. Overall, I'm sure you can do better for the price. Not terrible, but not formidable for sure.

Reviews.Title: “If it could modernize the facilities, it is actually a beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Myerone
Reviews.Content: After cruising at Baltic Sea, we flied to Paris for different experience. When we arrived Intercontinental Le Grand, we were impressed at its art deco with neoclassic painting on the ceiling. We arrived a little bit early, went shopping in Galleria Lafayette, but it is too crowded. We came back after 3pm still not ready, it is fine by us. Around 3:30pm we went inside the room, they upgraded us to the Opera view (we booked the Executive Room), the room is in good size with fantastic view, we were so happy, however we could vaguely hear the Metro. After using the toilet we were puzzled that there's no washer in the toilet room, that means after toileting, we need to go to bathroom where is on the other side of the room to wash our hands. Then every time we take shower, the water would flood all over the floor no matter how careful we use it, and there's no drainage hole on the floor, we need to use all the towels to dry it. I think it is quite pity that we can't enjoy the shower that we consider very important when we travel. But after all, we still quite like this hotel, I hope next time we visit, Le Grand has modernized its facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, wonderful service and staff!”
Reviews.Author: London2010june
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my visit to Le Grand hotel, I cannot tell you how wonderful this hotel was. I am just surprised why its a 4 star??? We were upgraded to a suite on arrival, All the hotel staff from bell boy, receptionist and breakfast staff were so friendly and helpful they made every single person in the hotel feel special. The breakfast was amazing, huge selection of breads, fresh fruits, Japanese, German food stations too, as well as an egg station. I only wish I could have stayed longer, but I shall be returning again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Negatives Outweigh the Positives”
Reviews.Author: LittleDeuceCoupe
Reviews.Content: The benefits of this hotel are its location and buffet breakfast that's included in the room fee. While the lobby is lovely, the rooms (especially the bathrooms) need updating, the service is mediocre, the Concierge staff has an "attitude" and gave us incorrect information or directions 5 times, and we had problems with our rooms. The first rooms they assigned us were on the first floor and had clearly had smokers in them even though the property is smoke free. The front desk just shrugged when we asked for different rooms because our teenage son suffers from allergies and said that smoking happens. A manager showed us different rooms and we still wound up with one with a bathroom that's shower was falling apart and another that we couldn't cool off even after the electrician came twice. They gave us a fan that we used to circulate the warm air. My husband's and my room was on the 3rd floor L'Opera side, and the thunderous Metro could be heard every 15 minutes. We were away on a family vacation for three weeks and stayed in six different hotels...the LeGrand was the only one we were happy to leave. It's too big, impersonal bordering on rude, and badly in need of updating. Find a better place for your Paris trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay at an Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: mamiesgirl
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to travel to Europe this June and stay in three different Intercontinental properties. My husband is a platinum level Priority Club member as well as Ambassador. We used points for our stay and I contacted the management in advance to let them know we were celebrating a significant wedding anniversary on this trip. The public areas of this hotel are spectacular and elegant. The main area with a glass ceiling was simply beautiful. Check in was very smooth and we were in our room in no time with our luggage. Even though we used points we received a room upgrade and had a decent sized room. Our bath had separate tub and shower but just one sink. The closet was large and had a full length mirror. There was a flat screen TV but only a few English channels. We had French doors leading to a small ledge with rail that overlooked the Opera. Towels and sheets were of the quality expected of this type of hotel. There was no iron or board in the room but they sent one up quickly upon request. The location of this hotel is very convenient. There is a metro station literally across the street. A number of small cafes serving all meals are in the immediate area. Great shopping is also nearby. We could hear street noise by the blackout curtains ensured we slept soundly. The best thing about this hotel was the service. We arrived to a bottle of chilled champagne in our room. Everyone at the Concierge desk was extremely helpful and friendly. One gentleman even made me bag tags (those on our checked suitcase had broken in transit) from cardboard and rubber bands! One evening we were treated to chocolate mousse cake from room service.

Reviews.Title: “Not getting any better”
Reviews.Author: montrealer1110
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights in June, 2010. This was my third visit to this hotel and definitely my last. Our room must have measured 15sq ft. It was so tiny two people couldn't move in it. The internet when it is working, is as slow as a dial up connection. The rooms were clean and the beds are very comfortable, but the temperature in the room was awfully hot. The air conditioning did not cool the room properly. The front desk staff are very polite but the staff in the bar has to be the worst staff I have ever seen in a hotel. Rude, obnoxious, and virtually invisible. The breakfast rate of 40 Euros is obscene. There are hundreds of better places to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good but can do better”
Reviews.Author: Oursdur
Reviews.Content: The pros +) Rooms are fairly big for Paris +) Guest relations staff very helpful and keen to attend guests once a claim is presented +) Efficient concierges when it comes to arranging transport, even at short notice The Cons -) Unpleasant reception staff for check in -) Some rooms require serious refreshment (paint, bathroom) -) Unable to confirm bed type at the time of booking due to high occupancy -) Welcome message in room with someone's else name! -) Don't visit the fitness center in case you are tall (above 1.9m you won't be able to stand on the treadmill)!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter019Nyc
Reviews.Content: Centrally located and just minutes from Opera station, this hotel is very easily accessible. There are a number of eateries and shopping area surrounding it. Lady at the front desk was very warm and immediately provided a room. Interior is ornate with beautiful carvings. I was in a classic room which looked exactly like the photo in the Hotel website.Bed was very comfy and there are basic amenities like Iron, locker, fridge,tv and a weighing machine too. There are l'occitane products to use for bath. Internet and movies are charged. I missed having a microwave oven in the room as I have dietery constraints. For breakfast you have variety to choose from. The waiting staff is very attentive.Checkout was swift. I enjoyed my stay here and would be booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Govar
Reviews.Content: We stayed using points from my husbands stays at Holiday Inns. It was a very nice hotel. Multilingual staff, efficient valet, elegant. The room was nice, but i would have been upset if I really paid 700 euros a night and it looked like a normal room. We never ate or drank at the restaurant. Breakfast was almost 40 euros per person and drinks were 15-20 euros each. Staff was friendsly. A few minutes walk from the metro (the opera was beautiful at night). Overall we had a nice expereience, but it is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not for the cost”
Reviews.Author: Shannon2007
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Right across from the Opera and a block away from the huge shopping area with includes the Galerie Layfayette. Many good restaurants are nearby and the area is not too touristy which is pleasant. The hotel itself is luxurious and if the company is picking up the tab, this would be a good choice. However, the rack rate for the basic room is over 700 Euros and this hotel is just not worth that. To further add insult to injury, internet is 24 Euros per day and a beer in the bar is at least 12 Euros. My personal favorite, the mini bar soda... 9 Euros for a 12 ounce can of Cola. Even the fitness center was 25 Euros a day. I don't mind paying for a good hotel but I hate to feel completely overcharged. This hotel is simply not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lys0N
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. It is well situated to explore and only a couple of minutes walk to the metro. Our room was well appointed and charming (we had an executive). It was also spacious, clean, well serviced and comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and had a great variety that catered to all palates. The customer service was what you would expect for a big luxury hotel chain. The staff were always pleasant, warm and formal....but not personable in that, they would know you or greet you by your name (but that is generally the norm in a large hotel with numerous staff). We spent our honeymoon in this hotel - September last year for a week. What I found memorable was the service we received upon our arrival. We were greeted very warmly by front desk and upon entering our rather spacious room, we had waiting for us a fruit platter, chocolates, lovely champagne and a warm welcoming card hand signed from guest relations. We were given a balcony room with a clear and beautiful view of the Eiffel. Tired and exhausted after a 24 hour flight, it was a pleasant interlude to what was a nice and comfortable stay at Le Grand Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome !!”
Reviews.Author: Sterling_USA
Reviews.Content: Actually my family has stayed at this "Grand" Hotel on 2 seperate occasions. We were thrilled ...and loved every thing about this wonderful hotel...from the lavishly decorated rooms and baths..to the Grand Ball room...to the views of Opera Garnier from our top floor rooms...to the Cafe de la Paix...and the wonder staff.....and Conceierge.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel - if you have the right room”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2010ABC
Reviews.Content: Very smart and clean, but beware the room you are given. I was upgraded on arrival from a standard room on 4th floor to a junior suite on 1st floor. The room was huge and plush, but seemed to be just above the Metro, so much noise and some vibration. After a considerable amount of searching, they found me another room on 2nd floor (Scribe wing), more normal size. Some very slight noise and vibration fro the Metro. Although having to move was a pain (and I still wonder whether my 'upgrade' was because someone else had the same problem too), I cannot fault the efforts of the staff to find the other room. One other big plus: I ordered room service breakfast, it arrived within 10 minutes, a real first for any Paris hotel. Food is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice but Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mkouzmine
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of the Intercontinental in London, so when my family decided to spend a few days in Paris, I booked us into the Intercontinental in Paris. The two hotels are very different. While the I in London looks to be a less luxurious, the one in Paris seems, at least at first glance, to be the real deal. I'm not, however, so sure. My kids are shouting out to remind all the the lounge in the la Grande in Paris has the best hot chocolate in the world. I will agree. Our room was fine. Classically decorated. As a member of their points program I got a gift of some Madelines which was nice. The room was small, but that's what one expects in Paris. The front desk staff was fine. The waitstaff in the lounge was fine. Nothing positive or negative to report. We ate in the hotel at the famous Cafe de le Paix. The food was great, the mice running around our feet were not. Even more distressing waa the fact that no one, besides the patrons were concerned with having rodents in the restaurant. We informed the front desk. They sent a basket of cookies and fruit the next day to apologize.

Reviews.Title: “A descent choice in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: GreyJames
Reviews.Content: I ve stayed there with my wife for three nights. I believe that is one of the best choices from the five star hotels because if you choose George V you will pay a fortune. If you wombat be around 300 Euro per night is the best. I have to say also that has one of the best restaurants in the city "cafe da la pais". 5 min from gallerie Lafayette

Reviews.Title: “A bit touristic, but still an amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: svcalleg
Reviews.Content: Getting a nice room in the heart of Paris is always a wonderful experience, and doing this at the Intercontinental Le Grand is particuarly amazing. The atmoshpere lacks in "intimacy", it lacks a bit of personality, if you know what I mean, but for the rest it is absolutely excellent. The concierge service is very efficient and provides a lot of information and the rooms are very elegant and spacious

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel, Great location and Great service”
Reviews.Author: SKBSTL
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a glorious 5 day trip to Paris! The hotel was outstanding, The staff was wonderful particularly the concierge team. Every suggestion was just perfect. The rooms were clean and well maintained and spacious too. I had emailed ahead to let them know we were celebrating a special anniversary. When we arrived , they had upgraded our room to have an Eiffel tower view and champagne and chocolates arrived that evening. Overall a great time. The location of this hotel is central to everything. I would absolutley stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Totally overated not up to the usual Intercontintental brand”
Reviews.Author: susieb-7
Reviews.Content: After having read some of the negative reviews I can say as a fan of the intercontinental brand this hotel is faded grandeur not worth the money. The hotel had 3 lifts only 1 was working and the room safe was faulty an engineer had to come to the room to take the front off the safe to be enable me to get my valuables out. As an ambassador I got an upgrade and only paid for one night out of the two and thank god I did as i would not have been happy to have paid 1050 E for 2 nights . I agree the concierge staff are excellent but the service at the breakfast cafe de la paix apart from the head waiter and a few others leaves a lot to be desired I was seated outside as they were not interested in giving me an inside table and a lady who I asked if she worked in the hotel gave me a dirty look and walked off I thought i had asked assistance form a member of the public I later saw her at the front desk off the restaurant she was a member of staff. The breakfast was not great stale cakes spoons on the floor no fruit left all 30 mins before breakfast ended to buy breakfast here is whopping 76E for two if not included. The intercontinental club lounge rolls out the same food day after day and speaking to another disgruntled guest who said it was the same stale sandwiches every day. with tables left uncleared for all the time i was there whilst staff chatted and even the champagne was a cheap variety i have bought from my local supermarket at £14.99 a bottle. I say all this because all the other Intercontinentals i have stayed at and they are numerous have beem high end luxury and service with faboulous food in the club lounge and fantastic service the lounge at night seemed to have only one member of staff on and closed at the strange hour of 9pm. As for the service button on the phone i dialled and redialled for about 30mins and when I mentioned this to the person who finally answered i was snapped at and told by the female who answered the phone that she was very busy no apology at all. In short as you may have gathered I was not impressed the hotel does not even come close to all the other wonderful Intercontinental hotels i have stayed at and I will not be choosing this hotel for my next visit to Paris just because this hotel is old does not mean it should be delapitated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, luxury hotel a little big”
Reviews.Author: fancytraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in this hotel, which has the perfect location to all the important sights and close to good shopping and restaurants and cinemas. The hotel is really big and rooms are not too big but beautifully decorated. We had a superior room, with nice bathroom, and nice view. It's true that check takes some time and the staff is polite but not really friendly, as other reviewers have mentioned. Breakfast is very good, and the lounge is very comfortable and lovely. I also tried the spa, but I must say that for such a big hotel, the facilities aren't that great, the sauna is very small, and the relaxing area not big either. I had a really good massage though and staff were friendly. I would not recommend this hotel to people looking for a small, quiet boutique hotel feeling, but more for a luxury stay in a big hotel, in the centre of Paris with everything nearby.

Reviews.Title: “You can tell it is only an Inter Continental”
Reviews.Author: jolly999
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Ritz and Hotel Daniel in recent months in Paris. The Ritz is personal and very elegant in a traditional Paris Grand Hotel style. The Daniel is a very small personal luxury boutique hotel which is also outstanding. i found this hotel far short of either. An okay location, but even though we were paying 40 per cent of rack advertised rates (courtesy of a major American investment bank) I only just about found it okay value. 15 minute queue to check out, room service phone engaged causing me to order food at the front desk. Staff fine, but just rather overwhelmed by a hotel which is too busy to be the real five star deal. Athenee, Crillon and Four Seasons in different league altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ttirrem
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on sunday january 24th at 1PM and had to wait in the lobby until 3:30PM to check into our room!!! Normal check in time is 2PM. We recently became Intercontinental ambassador members, a service that is supposed to entitle you to preferred service at a certain charge per year. We requested that the concierge reserve a table for us at a local restaurant and the concierge forgot. The room was very dated and the paint was peeling off the ceiling in the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Oh my god!”
Reviews.Author: Sreading
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel from a long list of many on Eurostar's site, and paid £310 for two for one night in the hotel and return trains from London - quite good value I thought, given that the hotel seemed central and close to Gard du Nord. Well! I've been in some nice hotels in my time but this one is AMAZING! It is a beautiful old building right next to the Opera House, and even the public areas are fantastic - huge displays of white orchids, beautiful bar and lounge area, high ceilings, ornate plasterwork, beautiful murals... and that was just the start. I'd booked a standard room but when we got there the lovely receptionist said they had a room upgrade for us! We ended up in a 3 room suite - big comfortable sitting room, bedroom with huge king-size bed and dressing room off to the side, and bathroom bigger than our bedroom at home! It really made what was going to be a great weekend anyway, truly outstanding. Almost don't want to write this review in case everyone books it and we can't get in again...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, rooms can be very old, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: SvenZH
Reviews.Content: Since several years I ll go to this hotel a few times a year ( 5-7) The location is great for my business but also there are all the big department stores around the corner and the elegant shopping streets ( Rue royal, St Honore etc) are very close too. The hotel is very big and gives a very luxury, elegant feeling. Rooms ranges from very small ( classic) to big suites the Problem is that there are not up to date anymore, the bathroom tends to show there age and so are the walls . Ok the atmosphere is very nice but when in the morning you step on small parts falling from the ceiling ( see pictures) that's not a good start in the day... The other thing that's annoying is the lack of wireless ( in the room not possible, in the lobby with a voucher ) It's just not good enough today for a 5 star hotel to offer only wired internet for 24 euro a day... The fitness is ok but nothing special, it's basically a room in the basement with some workout machines. Restaurant ( cafe de la paix) is nice, good food and great location. There are no major issues at this hotel but with rates starting at 270 euro ( room are very tiny for that rate) and 440 euro for an average room witch is what I got, the rooms could support some renovation and technical update

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Week in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Temperate
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights at the Intercontinental Grand in late October/early November, using Priority Club points for the entire stay. The location is unbeatable - with the Metro right around the corner in front of the Opera, and, if you already have Metro tickets, there's a closer entrance right on the corner. We have been to Paris before, but were spared all the jet-lagged airport-to-town train and Metro connections by using the Roissybus, which we caught right outside baggage claim and dropped us, 45 minutes later, within view of the hotel. The hotel is gorgeous, as other reviewers have said, and our room and bathroom (which was almost as big as the bedroom) were wonderful. For the time of year we were there, the bedding was actually a bit too heavy and when we left a request for a lighter blanket with the front desk, the bed was made up accordingly later that day. We foolishly had an "American breakfast" at a cafe around the corner from the hotel and opposite the Opera one morning that ended up being the most expensive meal of our trip. Prices weren't posted and they did not provide us a menu - so beware. We saw others, fresh off the bus, doing the same thing. Our best, and most reasonable American breakfast was actually at a cafe close to the entrance to the Louvre, where prices were prominently posted, and for a quick croissant and pot of tea, we breakfasted at a bakery at the bottom of the steps inside the Metro. Although we had been to Paris before, we hadn't ever toured the Opera itself. The timing is difficult if you are staying in this hotel because the Opera building doesn't open for fourts until around 10 and it closes doors for entry at about 4, and we were usually gone earlier and back later, but the day we worked it out, it was worth the effort. We were also able to shop some of the department stores that are close to the hotel, after returning from days of sightseeing in the early evening. We didn't really need a hotel this oppulent for the limited time we spent in the room, but would stay here again, if only for the great location, particularly if we had Priority Points to cover the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it. Terrible, Rude and Unhelpful!”
Reviews.Author: Guzzler_22
Reviews.Content: This is what I have sent to the Intercontinental website. So its as honest as it gets! Hi, Before I riddle the hotel; one thing we want to say is that we loved Paris and will be back there again - loved the place, the food and the wine. back to the hotel review: We have a lot of French and Parisian (in specific) friends in HK. I must say that when we arrived at the Le Grand in Paris, most of our friends had said that we would be very pleased with our choice. Sadly, we had only complaints to take back. 1. The amount of time it takes to process anything: A. When we arrived at the hotel with our baggage, no one came to help us for 5 minutes. We had to ASK someone to help us. Seriously! B. At the time of check in, it took them 20 minutes to check us in. When we fly to and live in NY, Sg or Bombay or Maldives or anywhere else, even if its a crowded time, we have never stayed more than 10 minutes at the Reception. C. That was the beginning of the "waits we had to face at your hotel" - We were told we had access to The Club on the 5th floor and access to the buffet. Now if we have been given access to The Club, the reception at The Club should know of it; he made us wait 5 minutes. I can understand if it happens the first time; but this happened on 2 more occasions and what's worst is that all 3 times it was the same gentleman who was receiving us. On the 3rd occasion, we told him to forget it and went out and had breakfast. D. You have a button on your phones in the rooms labeled "Reach Us Anytime" or something to that effect. Even during normal hours like 9-11 am; it would take about 10 minutes for any one to respond with simple requests like whats the charge for the internet or can we have some scissors? 2. Rudeness of your staff A. At Cafe La Paix (I hope I got it right), there is a lady (tall and wears glasses, she wears glasses), ok I think we have never seen a person more rude EVER. And its not just who faced her ire, there were at least 3-4 occasions we heard some other guests of your hotel saying, "please speak politely". Even when we would come to the Cafe for breakfast @ 8am, she would make us wait for 2 minutes and invariably always give us the seats outside when we clearly said we want it inside. The second time she did I told her we are sitting inside and I saw her mouth "tokya" I know I am not French, but I have enough French friends to know what abuse that refers to B. While checking out: When we were checking out, it was laughable. Your team not only know how to communicate with guests, I dont think they communicate among themselves: At the time of checking in (which took 20 minutes as mentioned above); we were assured that breakfast buffet is included. I never check bills from hotels; but this time my wife just asked for it and thankfully she did: even after promising a buffet included there was a Euro 450 charge for breakfast! And then instead of apologizing for the mistake or lack of communication among your own team members, your staff had the audacity to say "You made a mistake!". Now I know English is a tough language, but seriously not this tough, is it! The only helpful people were at the Concierge. Very nice and helpful people. Like I said, we loved Paris and the biggest thing was that we never had anything to be happy about while staying with Intercontinental. Usually we stay at the 4 Seasons and I think we have been right on our decisions. You really need to tell your staff at this hotel what service is all about. I am putting this review on tripadvisor.com and you can be rest assured all my friends will know about this experience of mine. Thanks! _______

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Le Grand”
Reviews.Author: smaactraveler
Reviews.Content: First time to the Le Grand, although have visited Paris a number of times (stayed at other 4/5 star hotels while there). Decided on the Le Grand after staying two years ago at the Intercontinental Bora Bora/Thalsso Spa. At the time we joined the Ambassador Club and we are gold members. Traveled to Paris this time with my 17 year old daughter, to visit my oldest daughter who was there for her study abroad term. Also, this time wanted to stay away from all the touristy stops, and really walk the neighborhoods of Paris. We also were there to do some shopping during 'soldes' time. The Le Grand is a lovely hotel. Being a ambassador member I found that my room was upgraded to a junior suite. A wonderful room, and a true 'junior suite', not a European junior suite. It has a sitting room area, bed area, desk area, large bathroom and a walk in closet. Only thing I would say, it that the closet needs a ton more lighting. The room was immaculate and comfortable. The bathroom walls could use a tiny bit of fixing up., as there was a tiny bit of peeling paint, obviously due to the humidity that gathers in the room. TV is not great, only two English speaking channels. I cannot understand with the availability of services why hotels in Europe still cannot provide better English speaking options for TV. Opted for the breakfast at the hotel one morning at $38euro-p/p. It was a nice change, pretty extensive in items offered (hot and cold). If you love breakfast, the price isn't all that bad, myself I am not a huge breakfast person so I am not sure I really ate $50+ worth of breakfast. They arranged car service for us, to and from the airport which was impeccable. All in all, I highly recommend the Le Grand!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice insist on a good room though”
Reviews.Author: Hotel79
Reviews.Content: Well located. Rooms are nice and Spacious if you get a junior suite. classic rooms are tiny! Helpful staff usually ... No interesting restaurants in the hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “the best I ever been to”
Reviews.Author: shaygi
Reviews.Content: from top to bottom, everything in this hotel is in perfect standards. the rooms are magnificent, extremely spacious and indulging, lobby and hotel design extremely appealing and the service is impeccable. Very good location - not the one I would pick for a leisure travel but one of the best areas in Paris. it has the feel of the old and luxurious hotels of the fifties but up to date and well maintained. I read in a previous review here that TV is charged - this is not the case. Interent however is a bit expensive but can be accessed also via the TV screen, without a laptop, which is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Deals!”
Reviews.Author: PhillipDrummond
Reviews.Content: The great beauty of this hotel is something we have enjoyed several times and something which has been remarked on repeatedly by Tripadvisor reviewers. One of the great hotels of Europe - well-situated, huge, luxurious, elegant, calm, quiet , the list goes on. Our only ongoing objection: the strangely insistent music in the glorious central lounge, where, as always, we would much prefer that silence reigned! Rather than simply repeat the obvious, then, it is perhaps worth underlining one of the ways in which, while times are hard, you can enjoy this superb hotel at much less than the official and frankly daunting rack rates. We recently spent a couple of nights at the hotel on my Intercontinental Hotels Ambassador membership, which for 150 dollars a year guarantees an upgrade, a free weekend night a year, late check-out, and fresh fruit and mineral water at any ICH hotel. On this occasion, a room booked at 390 Euros per night was accordingly upgraded on arrival to one with a wonderful view down over the Opera House, the rack rate for which turned out to be 820 Euros per night. The first night was payable, the second I took as my annual free night. The 'Business Plus' package on which this was booked also included free access to the Club Room, which appears to have a separate (and in our opinion excessive) charge of 150 Euros per day. The whole deal, in other words, only cost a total of just 390 Euros for two nights - for a room which would have totalled 1640 at rack rate, plus the Club Room extras. (Oh, and because of a mix-up over names, we accidentally received no fewer than three welcome gifts from the Manager.) This is, self-evidently, not only an extraordinary bargain when set against the rack rate but moreover well below the typical charge at many inferior hotels. If you can't find a 'Business Plus' deal on Intercontinental's own site, by the way, check out the 'Virtuoso' category at www.classictravel.com. They currently have deals including upgrades and Club Room access similar to what I have described above, still including Valentine's Weekend 2010, when we look forward to another visit to this fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carolyn352
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the week of Christmas and found the hotel and staff to be wonderful and helpful. Beautifully decorated for the holidays. The BEST chocolate chaud in whole of Paris. Conceriege staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: luchelle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night on the way to Bordeaux in November. On a previous trip I'd seen the hotel foyer and wanted to return as it looked fabulous. The rooms are very clean, classic and comfortable,but be aware that everything except the bed and bath (including internet and television) is charged extra. I've become so used to getting it for free from almost all the other hotels we've ever stayed in that it was a bit of a surprise. The evening we had to stand in line(with the rest of the 100's of people from the opera) at the hotel restaurant to get a table, and when we finally gave up and headed for the bar area a mouse ran over my foot!!I know this could probably happen at any hotel,but it was the last straw for me. In my opinion it caters for large business groups(part of the foyer was actually closed to the general public and only open to people attending some or other conference when we were there) For the leisure couple I recommend a nice boutique hotel,there are several fabulous ones in the the 7th arrondissement!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: titou59
Reviews.Content: We had a excellent stay. The location is perfect and the service is great the room are not so big but really cosy they were really helpful for the garage of my car

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Couldn't have Been Better!”
Reviews.Author: harrisbabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel at the end of November. I booked this hotel using priority club points and although this is a very grand hotel I was expecting to get a basic room as we were not paying for it. I was completely wrong, a week before our stay I emailed the hotel to ask them how much an upgrade would be as this stay was for our wedding anniversary, I had a response within an hour saying that they would gladly upgrade us for free as it was a special occaision. The following week we arrived at the hotel and checked in, we got to our room which was on the top floor (most expensive) to find a huge room with a enormous bed, marble bathroom with separate shower and separate wc, there was also an anniversary card and a bottle of champagne on ice waiting for us. On returning to our room later that evening we found a cheese board, fruit platter and a box of french macaroons waiting for us. This hotel could not have looked after us any better than they did especially as though we were not paying for our stay. I would definatly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a romantic break in Paris. It's centrally located right next to the metro and the royal opera house. The only downside to this hotel was the price of breakfast, in room bar etc, 9 euro for a can of coke and 45 euro for breakfast, so be prepared to eat out if you are not willing to pay these prices. This hotel is a must for anyone looking to stay in Paris using priority club points.

Reviews.Title: “The Le Grand is tres Grand and perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Alligro
Reviews.Content: This was a girls trip to Paris and by the # listing on Trip Advisor, I was a bit nervous as to the quality. I was so happy I chose Le Grand Intercontinetal. The location was perfect, the views were perfect, the beds were perfect, the staff was perfect (and very helpful) and the Lobby cafe was perfect. I would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Very Helpful employees”
Reviews.Author: dmf4br
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel - Very Helpful employees, room was very nice and hotel staff was extremely attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect upmarket hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: gazborangers
Reviews.Content: Le Grand Intercontinental was absolutely perfect. From the friendly check in to the well appointed rooms, Intercontinental really seem to have got their act together. Situated just down the road from Galeries Lafayette and Printemps, the hotel is ideally placed for exploring the delights of Paris. A knowledgeable concierge booked two fantastic restaurants for us and nothing was too much trouble. My only gripe is the expense but compared to other luxury hotels in Paris the price we paid was a steal!

Reviews.Title: “Not 5-star, but solid 4-star that needs improvement in some areas”
Reviews.Author: LoveGrandHotels
Reviews.Content: Hotel was re-opened in 2003 after major renovations - but that is nearly 6 years on and the rooms particularly are starting to show wear and tear. For example, some minor mold in the shower, peeling paint/wallpaper, exterior room balcony & doors that needed painting badly, new toilet seat needed (!), and a frumpy coach in a junior suite that goes for 1,300 Euro per night (although I only paid 400 Euro for it). Club lounge was nice, but service cutbacks evident - tables VERY slow to be cleared (I'm talking hours!), same menu selection 4 days in a row, with only the basics when it came to food. Service was helter skelter. It was tasty the first night, but by day 3 of 4, it was old. Madrid and London Club lounges in comparison are much better overall. Upon check-in, was given a room that when I walked in, was not serviced yet and completely a wreck with used sheets and towels all over the floor. I am an Ambassador member and stay, when I can, almost exclusively at Intercontinentals - so I know when things need to be improved - and management better get a hold of these situations fast else risk a 3.5 star property. Now all that said, the positives are the Location (close/walkable to most sights and across the street from the non-stop bus to/from the airport), the sheer grandeur of the property (the lobby bar and restaurant are both excellent with among the best people-watching one can find), and also close to lots and lots of shopping and restaurant choices. For these reasons - and provided there is no further decline in the room shabbiness or service levels - this hotel still gets my recommendation. A word about Paris - it's a truly magical place, but a VERY VERY expensive one. For example - 7-8 Euro for a beeer in a local (non-touristy) cafe, 38 Euro each! for breakfast in the hotel restaurant, a glass of the cheapest champagne in the lobby bar is 19 Euro (beer is 12). And the traffic/exhaust pollution is perhaps the worst I've experienced outside of Saigon. I was really surprised - central Paris needs to get a handle on this or risk being on the decline amongst other European grand capitals. And while smoking is not permitted anywhere indoors, the number of smokers outside far exceeds non-smokers at any given time. I was shocked at how many people (especially the younger folks) are puff, puff, puffing away. Tragic. Forget sitting at an outside cafe unless you want to breath the smoke of others pretty non-stop. Go inside for a more pleasant experience, albeit without a view. That really disappointed me. If you have any sort of sinus problem or are prone to coughing due to outside irritants - you WILL be affected. I know this all sounds pretty negative, but in the end, we had an absolutely great time despite the disappointments noted above. Paris should be on everyone's Top 10 places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations - a very opulent Intercontinental Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pegasus8London
Reviews.Content: As a 'fan' of Intercontinental hotels, I was very impressed with Le Grand. It certainly is aptly named! I took our sons to Paris for a two night 'sight seeing' trip and this was an ideal Hotel to stay in. It's proximity to many of the sights was excellent and we managed to see almost everything we had hoped to, getting around either by foot or a short taxi ride. The food was gorgeous; the service was excellent and all the staff that we encountered were very courteous. Our room was very spacious, but also managed to be cosy, and we all loved the balcony. Le Grand is in my opinion - at the higher end of the Intercontinental chain; both in elegance and in price (!) - but I would visit again without hesitation. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great for honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jujubean45
Reviews.Content: My husband and I liked our room so much we skipped the local restaurants several nights during our honeymoon and had dinner by our balcony, which faced the Opera House. The location was unbeatable, though admittedly we lucked out. Since the entire left side of the Opera House was under construction, many of the rooms had views of the ugly girders. We on the other hand had the best view of the unobstructed front entrance. This hotel is ideal if you want to splurge, but if you decide to skimp on transit, this is the place. There's the Roissy bus, which picks up across the street, that offers a straight shot from CDG Airport to the Opera for 9 euros. There's also the local bus transit right on the street, which can easily, reliably and cheaply get you to Louvre and other tourist sites. I'd recommend it for the folks who want to live it up in their hotel room and splurge a little. Definitely not for the backpacker or rugged traveler in you.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: MazM
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night - we got the night free through our Priority Club. Quite strange to think we stayed two nights in Leeds in the UK and qualified for a night here! We had already stayed at another hotel in Paris so one night was just fine with us. What an amazing hotel. It really does leave you quite open mouthed on arrival. It is certainly Grand and from the moment you set foot in any part of the hotel you are immediately taken care of. The foyer was magnificent, rather like a gracious ocean liner and full of beautiful orchids. Check in was both quick, friendly and efficient. The centre of the hotel which has an amazing glass roof is where you can take afternoon tea or a pre dinner drink (if you can afford it). Even the lifts are pretty incredible with the dark wood, marble floors and brass fittings. Given our room was going to be free we were not expecting much but it was vast. A massive and incredibly comfortable bed dominated the room which also had a chaise longue. The bathroom was also enormous with bath and separate shower and toilet - all very clean and with some lovely L'Occitane toiletries. We didn't hear anybody next door to us or above us - if there were any guests in those rooms. The only downsides to the hotel were the prices charged for ... well...almost anything! We would not have dreamt of buying anything in the hotel at all - to charge 9 euros for a cup of coffee is extortionate but of course if you actually pay for a bedroom then 9 euros is nothing! The menu for food and drink was eye popping for prices generally. Also no free internet which quite frankly is a bit tight given the prices of the rooms. Strangely British television channels amount ed to two - BBC and BBC World - although ITV was advertised it was actually the BBC again. We were on the second floor so the noise from the traffic was quite loud (lorries tended to rattle the furniture) but I am assuming the higher up the hotel you go the more expensive the rooms are and maybe less noisy. It looked a beautiful hotel for a honeymoon or something special and the location was excellent. Step out of the hotel and you are right in the heart of Paris. Next to the Opera and of course the shops. Also closer to much cheaper places to eat. You can't get much better than that!

Reviews.Title: “Splurge on Club access for outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: amyruth
Reviews.Content: Although the "classic" rooms are not large, they are adequate especially when combined with access to the two-level Club Lounge with a terrific breakfast buffet and other food service during the day and evening. Club concierge is helpful, friendly and charming. Computers available along with wine and champagne afford a luxury experience for travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Queens”
Reviews.Author: washingtonDCGreta
Reviews.Content: I used my frequent travel points to plan a girls week in Paris. My friend, who had never been to Europe, and I planned the trip during a month to celebrate our birthdays. I speak some French and upon check in told them how excited we were to be celebrating our birthdays in Paris. I asked for a room with a view. The entire hotel staff took such great care of us even though we were not revenue producing guests. We had a great room with a large bathroom and balconies facing the opera house. The hotel surprised us with boxes of cookies, a 1/2 bottle of champagne and another certificate to have two free glasses of champagne in the bar. The room had great robes and slippers, high end bedding and killer views. The location was fabulous to take the Rossy Bus straight from the airport. The hotel is barutiful and elegant in a great neighborhood. The maids did a wonderful job and the concierges were very helpful and accurate in their information. We had an absolutely fabulous trip and this hotel made it very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing--Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: amandagaylev
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Grand for our 5 year anniversary. We had never traveled to Europe, so were concerned about where we would stay and the price. I found an amazing deal for this hotel on Priceline, and was amazed at how wonderful this hotel was for the price we paid. They were surprised at how good of a deal we received, but did not treat us any differently. They even upgraded our room for free! Room was comfortable and staf were nice. They were right around from the Metro, and the Opera District is a great location to stay! There's also a great restaurant around the corner ( I think near Edward's Theater) that made some amazing pizza. When we go back, we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Le Grand is lovely but you pay a high cost for it.”
Reviews.Author: Tadburger
Reviews.Content: The location is awesome. The Opera House across the street, a two block walk to Place Vendome, bus route to the Louvre, Ile de la Cite, etc. AND - the Roissybus to CDG is on the next corner literally so it truly is well situated. The staff was very friendly. The bell staff was the fastest I have ever seen. The room was too elegant to be comfortable. Nice beds and large bathroom though. Very nice that they give you a "personal use" section in the mini-bar fridge. If you are on the back wings you will have to walk about a block through the halls as this place is huge (800 rooms per the historic placard we read). Other reviews had said that if you stayed on the top floor you automatically had "Club" privileges. No longer true. We were on the top/5th floor and would have had to pay 150 Euros for Club privileges. You had to pay 40 Euros more to be on the side of hall with a view of the Opera House. Everything is a la carte here which is a bit of a shock when room rates now start at 720 Euros. If money is no object, it is a very fine, safe place in a great location. If money is at all a concern, you won't be so thrilled you chose Le Grand.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, and above expectations”
Reviews.Author: platinummedallion
Reviews.Content: right next to Opera House, very clean and pleasant hotel. Breakfast is only buffett, however. Concierge and front desk service was very helpful. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel. Service and location was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: swiper4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Le Grand last week for 4 nights. We stayed using points from a recent Holiday Inn promotion. This was a special trip for our 15th wedding anniversary. I emailed ahead of time to try and get a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel graciously upgraded us to a fantastic room on the 5th floor with 3 balconies and a great view of the Eiffel Tower! My wife loved watching the Eiffel Tower sparkle every night! The first night the hotel also layed out rose pedals in the shape of a heart on our bed, and the second night the hotel gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolates. We really appreciated the service from the hotel! The room itself was a very good sized room, and the bathroom was very nice. The room also was amazingly quiet. You could not hear the traffic at all outside with the balcony doors closed. I was surprised how loud the street was the minute we opened the doors to the balcony. The curtains for the balconies also kept out all of the light when they were closed. Very comfortable bed. The lobby and cafe were very nice. We tried the concierge lounge for one night (paid 90 euro), but did not feel it was that great of value. We cancelled lounge access after the first night. The normal price for lounge access is 120 euro per day, but they gave us a little discount as I am a Platinum Ambassodor status with Intercontinental. The location of the hotel is great. Right next to the Opera Garnier. We took the Roissy Bus from the airport, and it dropped us off one block from the hotel ($9 euro each for the bus). We bought museum passes right down the street from the hotel at the L'Open Tour office (concierge recommended this. no line). My wife I had coffee and pastries at illy each morning right next to the L'Open Tour office. The Opera metro stop is right in front of the hotel, so that was very convenient. I would highly recommend this hotel. This hotel was our favorite of the two hotels we stayed at on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chpoho
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. Room was pretty small, I think the bathroom was bigger than the room. Location is good. The only problem is that the room had a skylight but there was nothing to cover it. So at the crack of dawn, it was light in our room, making it impossible to sleep in. We asked them to cover it, but the cover they provided was velcro and kept falling off during the night. Kind of weird for a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and attractive”
Reviews.Author: Sheherezade
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel in desperate straits after another, much cheaper place managed to lose our booking. We had a very comfortable and attractive room - good bed, tasteful furnishings, spacious and well appointed bathroom. The service was very good, and the room very clean. There is a wonderful atrium in the grand style of bydone days where you can have drinks etc. And, of courrse, there is the Cafe de la Paix. The location right beside the Palais Garnier is very busy but wonderfully central, as several metro lines meet at Opéra. The staff were extra helpful when we needed help, opening the lock on my suitcase (lost key issue) despite the late hour. The only drawback to this hotel is that they charge you, and charge you A LOT, to use small conveniences. For example, 12 euros minimum to connect your laptop to the internet! So you need to watch your step if you're not on expense account ( we weren't) and this can be nerve-wracking. Other than that it's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fifty-traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from the Intercontinental Le Grand after a five day four night stay for our twenty fifth anniversary. We had a fantastic time. The room was very well appointed and very clean with a balconey looking down on rue Auber and to the Eiffel Tower in the distance. The hotel is just down the street from the Opera House and very well situated for exploring the city of Paris. It was a short walk to the Jardin des Tuileries and from there the Champs Elysees in one direction and the Louvre in the other. The conceirge was very helpful and arranged for things like our dinner cruise on a river boat down the Seine. The staff was excellent and politte and spoke perfect English. We took the advice of friends and used the hop-on-hop-off open-top bus tours to "get the lay of the land" and then to go back and visit the all sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: OxfordshireDreamer
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for our wedding anniversary. Our stay was free due to a holiday inn promotion. Found all front of house staff to be courteous and helpful. The room whilst not large was certainly adequate for the location and the only gripe was a useless shower. Thought that the daily parking fee of 40 Euros was a little excessive, but other than that the hotel delivers a feeling of luxury and quality throughout. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Penny1969
Reviews.Content: We have just returned and all I can say is the hotel was everything I expected and more besides. Check in was fast, courteous and efficient, as a priority club member we were also given complimentary late check out. We had room 5232 with beautiful views of the Eiffel Tower, my absolute thanks go to Nicolas from guest relations whom I emailed before going to ensure we had a twin room (I was travelling with my Mum) and preferably a nice view. As it was a special visit for my Mum, we were greeted in the room with chocolates, fruit, water and a lovely card. It made it very special. We travelled via Eurostar to Gare du Nord and took a taxi from the station to the Hotel, it was only 15 minutes and 7 euros. I would recommend asking the hotel to order a taxi for you beforehand as the queue was huge and took nearly an hour to get to the front! The location is lovely, right next to the Opera Garnier, the large department stores are minutes away, Montmartre is about a five minute walk where there's a huge choice of restaurants. A few people have previously mentioned the high prices at the hotel for drinks - what I would say is it's not just the hotel! If you're planning on hitting the tourist spots, these are the prices everywhere. At least at the Hotel the surroundings are beautiful. If you are considering going here, it is beautiful, we found the service from all the staff excellent and the location superb.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive and great location”
Reviews.Author: Fosseboy
Reviews.Content: We took 2 Australian visitors for 1 night. We were all bowled over by its magnificence. Entrance and public areas are fantastic. The Concierges gave great advice and were friendly as was the luggage guy. Concierge recommended tour bus which was better than the cars rouges I would have gone to and excellent restaurant in Montmartre. Staff standing in lobby and on reception looked bored with life. Apart from Thomas on reception, the others were quite miserable. One room was available at 1.30, the other wasn't. When we returned for the other key we were given the key to the room we already had. I asked the receptionist to check as I thought it was the wrong key but she was insistent she was right and then didn't apologise when I returned to change keys. She passed me to another girl who seemed embarrassed by the whole thing but was apologetic on behalf of her colleague. Location was great for tour bus and main shops. Room was beautiful but compact (a "classic" room). Lounge bar is beautiful and not overly expensive for Paris.
