Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Paris... but less-than-perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Papponchini
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the intercontinental for our first 3 nights in paris. checking-in ended up being quite a hassle. first we were given keycards to a room that didn't work; we had to return to the front desk. on our next try, our keycards worked, but it turned out that the room we were given was occupied. fortunately, the occupant was not there! on our 3rd attempt, we finally received the correct room and working keycards, but it was quite annoying considering we were already late for our lunch reservation. and no one at the front desk ever apologized for the mistake. i loved our room (#4103) despite it's distance from the elevator. we had 2 very comfortable twin beds, a great bathroom, a small dressing area, decent air-conditioning. the location was perfect! this was my first time to paris, and i couldn't have chosen a better area to start exploring. it's minutes from amazing shopping (printemps/galerie lafayette/chanel on rue cambon, colette and all the other boutiques on rue st honore). we walked along all of the beautiful streets/landmarks, right next to the opera house, through place vendome, past the louvre, over the seine, notre dame, tuileries gardens, montmartre, sacre coeur... and there are a ton of metro stops nearby. the fitness center was small but modern and free. breakfast was included with our room, and the buffet was abundant and delicious. we didn't make use of the spa (not enough time). the concierge was incredibly helpful in making dinner reservations and providing directions. my only complaint is that internet access was 24 euros per day!!! i don't even know how i'm going to expense that!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel with iffy service”
Reviews.Author: WanderLSP
Reviews.Content: Le Grand is a beautiful hotel. The building, rooms and decor are extremely nice. It seems to be the preferred hotel of royal Arabian sheiks which was kind of interesting since they travel with 100 of their closest friends and are kinda like celebrities. The negative to the hotel is the service. One night we came home and the power was off in our room (I didn't even know that was possible? They turned it back on after we let them know). They messed up our wake up calls three times - once waking us up in the middle of the night and once they just didn't call. So, I think it's just way too expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Great Service but Need to shape up !”
Reviews.Author: luxadvisor
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a long history which dated back to 1862 under the regime of Napoleon III - opened its door for the first time as Palast Hotel - Grand epoque style. Closed in April 2003 for renovation - this property capture back its Grand status after an extensive 18 months extensive make over. Just a stroll from Place Vandome and a cross from Opera Garnier, this property offers a great location for a sejour in Paris. I found this is a nice hotel, but I would not consider it as "Le Plus Grand" in Paris. I consider this property more as 4 star hotels. There are plenty others such as Park Hyatt Vendome, George V, Hôtel Fouquet's Barrière, Hôtel Plaza Athénée Paris, Hôtel de Crillon , Ritz Paris etc which I consider more as true 5 stars properties. The reasons why I choosed this property mainly because of a short week-end gateaway, plus I had to use my one night voucher which due to expired before the end of the month. The arrival went smooth - I found the front desk agent very friendly and went through all the check in procedures well (inclusive reconfirm our room type preferrence, etc). I rate it 80 for the check in. Bell person did assist us with our luggage and brought it up promptly. The room is clean and bright, eventhough we had only the courtyard view room. Latter during our returned back to the room - there was a welcome amenity awaiting (as a part of Ambasador member benefits). The breakfast is wonderful - Buffet style - great selections - good service. A Positive remark that i can praise for - is the Japanese breakfast style option - this is a plus value - and very seldom for european style Hotel. The Concierge was very helpful and knowledge. Great Clef D'or Concierge staff. One small negative remark that i can share - is regarding the Bathroom. Overall it is clean and nice - but unfortunately it needed a renovation for the wall and around the window. It is not a major fact but certainly for the standard room rate of €439 / night - one expect a good well maintain room. We mentioned this small remark to the front desk agent upon check-out , and she apologized for it. A few small points that the hotel maybe can put into their considerations: - Complimentary Tee or coffee in room - Complimentary Internet access - Ice machine on the floor (as the room service for a bucket of ice cost 10 €) This I can understand from Four Seasons / Ritzcarlton or Aman Resorts point of view but not from Intercontinental Hotel. Overall, I found this is a wonderful hotel. The service provided is great and fit to the 4 stars hotel category. It has an excellent location - great for shopping and pleanty outside dinning options to choose. Will I be back to this property again ? Not sure.. as there are many others which offered a great accommodation and a good value ( ex. Hotel Keppler, Ares Eiffel, De Sers, etc) One can not disagree - certainly it is a good value when you use your priority club points or combine with overnight voucher. But when it comes to pay a rack rate - then I better check my hotel lists again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: dwaNtheATL
Reviews.Content: This is a very pretty hotel. The staff was great for the most part. It was very good for us (American) because our French is not very good and the staff spoke excellent English without making us feel bad about it. Right by the Opera Garnier. Our rate inlcuded an American style breakfast which was very good. The only problems were small... the lady in the business center who was not very helpful ,both times I went there, and they missed cleaning our room one day (they showed up while we were showering to go out for the evening after being gone ALL day, we asked them to come back in an hour which didn't happen). The bar was nice as well and the bar staff was great! Ask for Christopher, if you go!

Reviews.Title: “Oh my!!!”
Reviews.Author: dsysana
Reviews.Content: On this front page it has the hotel listed at 3 stars. What?!?!? That has to be a mistake.... Granted, this is not my typical hotel class, but was a treat using points for a weekend in Paris. I don't think I could stay here if I had to pay out of my own pocket. As a Priority Club platinum member, we were upgraded to the top floor with two balconies overlooking the boulevard and a view of the Eiffel Tower. The room was immaculate. The bed (two singles to make a King) was probably the most comfortable bed I've ever had. Down, I think, comforters and a plush mattress. Linens were soft and smooth. I certainly got a sense that this place knows how to cater to those with high expectations, considering the room rate. Very romanitic appointments throughout. Almost museum like where your not sure if you can sit down or just look at the chairs in the lobby. The concierge was so helpful. We purchased the red bus tickets and Eiffel Tower elevator tickets there. Good thing because the line at the Tower was around 3 hours if you had to purchase on site. He also directed us to a little grocery store around the corner and we stocked up on water, fruit and snacks. Actually, the tap water there was pretty darn good, so we never bought water again. Taxi's were always waiting outside so no wait to go anywhere. Check in/out was a breeze. Always someone there for every task, from getting the taxi, to holding bags (we checked out and they held our bags until our train left later that night), to a quick introduction to the hotel. Very organized and not pushy at all. I was prepared from other reviews to eat outside the hotel. Good gracious!...and no refills! There were plenty of side cafes and restaurants within 5 blocks that you didn't have to break the bank to eat. The red bus tour stopped around 2 blocks from the hotel and it is a great way to see all the typical sites. I've read a few complaints about the headphones not working and I would have complained too until we finally understood how to use them. All recorded and timed so you can tour at your own pace (hop on, hop off). The Louvre is a bit a a stretch to walk, but not too bad. I think about a mile or so? Staff was very friendly and I didn't pick up any snootiness or anti-tourist, anti-American tensions I've heard about the French. Guess you can't believe everything you read :-) The mini-bar had a power adapter that it seems many guests have figured out how to use it and put it back in the package and not be charged. Even the front desk asked if we were going to keep it (they seemed to know everyone does it). Bathroom was elegant and comfortable. Nice robes and slippers. There was a nice quiet city sound at night when we opened the windows. A touch of traffic, a hint of conversation, and a nice breeze. Just beautiful. I think the large trees lining the street filtered out a lot of noise. Not much variety in TV channels, but who wants to watch TV when visiting Paris? If you have the cash, this would be the place to spend it. If you have the points, definately the place to stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible bait and switch hotel”
Reviews.Author: MillionsRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: This was my third and last time to stay at the hotel. I used 180,000 points to secure 2 "classic rooms" for 3 nights. I also offered to pay a surcharge which I know this hotel is always excited to receive from point stays. Staying at this hotel is like doing business in a 3rd world country--everyone is extending their palm for a tip, even the hotel itself needs to be greased to operate properly. A month in advance I asked to allocate adjoining and connecting rooms and the request was confirmed. I have names of all the staff that made these confirmations and I believe the initial request was honored at the time. On the day of arrival, in the morning, I let the hotel know in advance I would be arriving the first night at 11:00 pm. They used this to their advantage to swap out the rooms and when I arrived, the rooms we had been allocated were gone. Their story was that the guest staying in the room decided to extend the stay and so we couldn't get them (translation: you're staying with points, therefore you are worthless) Their usual story, "no rooms available". I asked to speak to the duty manager and after a long wait he appeared, no one is helpful at the hotel and they just want to get you out of their hair. This property is a laughingstock in this current economic climate, when excellent properties are working hard for their clients. Do not go to the Le Grand hotel, whether you pay with cash, or with points. I moved to the Park Hyatt and it was worth every euro.

Reviews.Title: “Best City Hotel Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Veronika78
Reviews.Content: This is by far the nicest hotel my husband and I have stayed at. It is definitely of 5 star quality. My husband treated me to two nights in Paris for my 30th birthday as a surprise. I felt like a queen at Grand Hotel Intercontinental. The staff were very very polite and helpful. The hotel is located quite centrally and very near to the Lourve and just accross from the Opera House (Music Academy of Paris). We had a very good room. It was large and spacious and so very clean and fresh with a direct view of the Opera House. The toiletries were in abundance and not just any toiletries - they used L'Occitaine, which is one of favourite to use and are quite expensive. I was surprised at how much was left in the room everyday - a bag was left on the bed, in the shower, near the bath and on the vanity table too. I never bothered to take toiletries home with me but this time, I did! The hotel deco was very grand with high ceilings and plants about. The reception area is very clean and guests are expected to dress properly for dinner. The concierge recommended a great french restaurant but I have forgotten its name. They served the best food we have ever had! It didn't look posh from the outside but they surely did deliver the quality of food. We have been to Paris before (2002) and so we knew what we wanted to do and planned properly for it (my husband did)! We had 3 days to explore and had a great time. On the last day, I ordered a hot chocolate at the hotel whilst waiting to go to the airport and was very impressed. It was the best hot chocolate I've ever tasted. The real thing - HOT CHOCOLATE, not powder. It was served in a small silver jug and enough for 2 cups and cost 8€ but it was worth ever sip. We will definitely stay here again if we had the chance. It is a very expensive hotel at probably 500€ a night for the room we stayed in. Definitely a luxury hotel and not to be done in vain! For new Paris visitors, make sure you get to the top of the Eiffel tower, definitely have a hot chocolate 'Paris style', visit the Lourve, the Notre Dame (get to the top of the tower for great views), take a walk along the river Seine at night and watch the Eiffel Tower from Chaillot Palace, which is near to arc de triomphe. Also take the hop on and hop off tourist bus to serve as your transport for the day. Very easy to get around and a good way to see most of the sites of Paris. Make sure you eat French food. Definitely walk the Champ Elysees. Finally, visit the Lafayette Department Store!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissEck
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great servive but everything in this hotel and Paris in general is a rip off!

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: Strathallan
Reviews.Content: Staying at The InterContinental simply enhanced the experience of a weekend in Paris - the hotel provided a warm welcome, excellent accommodation, outstanding service, and a fabulous atmosphere. This hotel doesn't just satisfy a need for accommodation - rather than a means to an end it is a destination in its own right, a place to be enjoyed. The location is a bonus - it's a perfect base for exploring, sightseeing, and just enjoying the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth $1,000 a night!”
Reviews.Author: travelmomAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The location is very good but the rooms and service are not worth $1000 a night. You couldn't swing a cat in the bedroom and yet they say a rollaway can be put in there for an extra $120 a night! Where? There is very little closet space or drawer space. There is no coffee maker in the room which means either paying $20 for a cup on room service or having to get up and get dressed to go to the cafe for a $10 cup!!!! I suppose if you are paying $1000 a night they think that kind of price just for a cup of coffee doesn't bother you. The iron was tied to the ironing board and the hairdryer was hardwired into the bathroom cabinet making it very difficult to use in front of the mirror. The bathroom was a nice size but the door for the shower only comes halfway along the tub and there is a large puddle on the floor after even the shortest shower. The A/C broke in our room and it took 3 days to get a technician out. Then he said, It is broken and sent us a fan as we did not want to have to pack and move rooms for one night. We had to sleep with the french doors open and the beeping noise of their window-cleaners' platform woke us at 5 am every day. The maid, the maintenance guy and the waiters were very friendly, higher up the food chain, not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AppleNick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. We really loved it. It is right next to the Opera house in a beautiful building. The lobby is impressive. The staff is very kind. We got an upgrade since I am an Ambassador Gold member so we had a beautiful stylish room with a balcony. The room was very clean and had beautiful furniture. The bathroom was very big. We got everything what you can expect in this kind of hotel. We stayed there for three nights. Don't miss out the wonderful breakfast downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Le Grande, le impressive, le welcoming, le safe and secure, le luxury.”
Reviews.Author: GLASGOLASS
Reviews.Content: Mum and daughter, birthday treat for both and wanting a touch of class and luxury in Paris, impressed by reviews and internet site, opted for Le Grand. We were not disappointed; we were given a warm welcome at Reception on arrival, bags arrived at our door as quickly as we did to be followed minutes later by the most exquisite birthday cake for us both. Quelle surprise! Yum yum, it was delicious! There was also a birthday card in the room from customer relations staff and --great touch--a personal welcome card from the hotel manager. We had breakfast each morning of our stay--7 days --in the lovely Cafe de la Paix--which is, in effect the hotel's dining room. What an experience in itself! Beautiful rooms, delicious food for the most part except for the coffee which was nothing like as good as the coffee available in other parts of the hotel, it tasted like cheap instant stuff and I'm sure the milk was UHT rather than fresh. Didn't seem to have cream available at breakfast for coffee. The bar prices are of course, eye-watering high. Coffee--although far better than the breakfast stuff , is about ten euros and the cheapest smallest glass of wine about thirteen euros. But, hey, this is central Paris and it dont come cheap! Another little quibble is the lack of any kind of hospitality in the bedrooms such as tea or coffee or water or fruit--even the most humble B&B here in Scotland will have these as standard in their rooms. For the record , we were staying in a Superior Room with view of the Eiffel Tower. Maybe you have to be club class for such basic hospitality items but when you think of the room rates, surely basic items such as I've mentioned are a mere bagatelle to Intercontinental? The concierge desk staff I found a trifle--let's say brisk--in how they spoke. That said, they did organise for us both to have Afternoon Tea at the Ritz--the price? if you have to ask, you cant afford it! Overall, I would most certainly recommend this hotel, it might not be the cheapest in Paris but remember you are not buying a bed for the night, you are buying into a luxury hotel and the experience of staying there---in any case, it's not the dearest either but gives the Ritz a run for its money when it comes to looks. Will we be back Certainment! We've started to save up already!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place!”
Reviews.Author: SAAAMumbai
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy access to metro/Louvre/shopping, spacious rooms & bathrooms, awesome spread for breakfast. Overall, good value-for-money!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience in a long time”
Reviews.Author: shakeyleg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental for one night on business in late May. The room they gave me was supposed to be on a non-smoking floor, but the smell of smoke was unmistakable the minute I walked into the room. I tried calling down to front desk but the phone in the room didn't work so needed to use my mobile to call downstairs! they said no other rooms were available. the room itself was clean and the bed was very comfortable, but it must be the smallest hotel room I've ever been in - you could barely walk around the bed. the room was very stuffy and the air-conditioning system didn't work. i called (from my mobile!) to complain (and ask them to fix the phone) but they said they could get an engineer up only in the morning, which was of course too late. called for room service breakfast in the morning (from my mobile!), breakfast order arrived incomplete and cost EUR 60 (for eggs, coffee, sausage and juice). i'm really not a unreasonable person, and I realize that things aren't always going to be perfect. what got me the most here was the fact that the hotel staff were completely indifferent to the situation and could not care less.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: nyprime
Reviews.Content: the staff and rooms overall are fine, but wait untill you hit the minibar... $9 for bottle of water. we ordered room service breakfest for 2, the bill was almost $200. even the excursions we booked through the hotel were overpriced. we requested at the time of the reservation an early check in, but we couldnt check in till 2pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara1997
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Paris. We stayed and this Hotel and loved it. We upgraded to a larger room and had one smaller room. The smaller room had a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower. I would highly recommend going with a room that has access the the Club Level. This allowed us complementary breakfast each morning as well as "happy hour" in the late afternoon. The beds were very comfortable and reminded me of a Four Seasons or Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable and stylish in great location”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Battersea
Reviews.Content: If you want to savour the experience of what it must have been like in turn of the century Paris, but not sacrifice modern comforts and amenities...stay here! It is grand, it is over the top, it has a lot of rooms and it is an Intercontinental Hotel. Everyone speaks perfect English. They have a huge business centre and the bars/restaurant (Cafe de la Paix) are excellent. The Spa is a bit disappointing, but you are in Paris for gosh sakes not Evian les Bains! The hotel still seems to exude charm, comfort and intimacy despite being a whole city block in size...the opulent fixtures and fittings and dark panelled wood, conservatory glass courtyard, and large halls/rooms all make up for it being a 'chain' hotel. Loved the service which was friendly and efficient. Great location, especially for the Opera Garnier and shopping. Rooms are great...bathrooms large (but, never wallpaper a bathroom - water/steam makes it peel off even if it is brand new...so don't be put off into thinking this is 'run down'. Rather, it is poor design). L'Occitane toiletries and good mirrors/lighting. Comfortable beds in 'faux Garcia' style (reminiscent of the Costes) but with more space and half the price! The complimentary water/fruit was a welcome touch (Priority Club members only, I think!?). Definately my favourite and most reliable place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, expensive and sometimes annoying”
Reviews.Author: MarkCWales
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for years and I keep coming back so it must do some things right. The location for a start is uneatable: right in the centre of Paris's great shopping district; just above the Auber RER station and within walking distance of most of what you want to go to in Central Paris. The place was completely renovated a few years ago. The main effect was to make all of the rooms much smaller. I have a Royal Ambassador card so I usually get upgraded to a junior suite. Even these are not that big; the "classic rooms" are tiny. The decor was also changed to some kind of Second Empire theme -- it's fine buta bit pretentious. All of Intercontinental's weaknesses are on show here. The refusal to standardise amenities around the world means no kettle or coffee maker in the room -- if you want a cup of tea or coffee, you need to call room service, wait 20 minutes and pay 7 Euros. I bring a travel kettle and a cup but it's annoying and forces me to the Hilton occasionally. The minibar prices and room service are incredibly high if you don't have the RA card (a 50 Euro breakfast is easy) but there's a supermarket 10 minutes walk away (behind the Printemps) that is open until 9.50 pm. The Internet access costs 25 Euros and the phone call prices will bankrupt you. The bedding, though, is of a very high standard: excellent cotton sheets and nice duvets. The gym used to be great -- well equipped and on the rooftop -- but not now. In the renovation, it became the Executive Lounge and the gym was moved to the first floor. Now, it has a few pieces of decent cardiovascular equipment but no resistance machines and no weights to speak of. The rest of the space is given over to a new-age, high-priced spa. It's a lovely old building and the staff are professional and friendly. Is it worth the prices? Maybe

Reviews.Title: “"WOW" Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: PearlAtlantaGeorgia
Reviews.Content: I spend two nights at Legrand on March 28 & 29th. This is a definite "5" star hotel. The service exceeded my expectation, room comfort is absolutley great, friendliness of the staff is out standing, location very central, cleaniness is immaculate. This place is worth every dime!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer811
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent some time in Paris and stayed at the InterContinental based on a recommendation. The hotel was beautiful, the room was clean, bathrooms were oppulent, and the service was excellent. The concierge was very helpful with suggestions throughout. Everyone in the hotel was happy to say 'bonjour' when they saw us. Great hotel--if you can afford it, worth staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Le Grand”
Reviews.Author: mollyann500
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at this fantastic hotel. Our room had a view of the Eiffel Tower as per our request. Great size and comfortable bed. Bathroom was small but ok for the two of us. We had club level so enjoyed the free drinks and food every day. And the location is wonderful for all the sites of Paris. We were able to walk just about everywhere and the metro is just around the corner if you want it. We will stay here again when we visit Paris. This hotel is not cheap but worth every penny if you avoid the mini bar and room service. Club level offered us breakfast each morning and lite snacks throughout the day which is great in a city like Paris where everything is very costly.

Reviews.Title: “Service totally opposite to reviews I have read.”
Reviews.Author: HoggyDubai
Reviews.Content: On my recent trip to Europe I took advantage of the recession and strength of the US Dollar to upgrade myself to the Intercons in London and Paris. I was a little nervous of Le Grand due to some terrible reviews which in particular seemed to refer to surly service. My experience was totally the opposite, maybe the fact that I had booked on a link from this site helped but I had some of the best service from a large hotel ever. I booked a car from the airport with the concierge in London, an Asian habit not to be repeated in Europe due to the cost. On arrival at Charles De Gaulle I found no car waiting. Phoned the Hotel to be told no booking had been made. Obviously a little upset I set off in a taxi, my mood recovering as I realised how much their mistake had saved me! On arrival at the hotel the receptionist seemed to be expecting me, and as we were checking in she said about a car for my return flight, I said don't bother to which she mentioned it was complimentary. This started a string of apologies from various managers, they had gone to the trouble of phoning the London Intercon and had had confirmation from there of the phone call. In addition to the transfer, I was upgraded to a much larger room and received a free bottle of wine. As a hotel it lives up to its name, am not sure I would pay the rack rate for my room of Euros 850 but at the price I was paying it is a great hotel in a very convenient location and if rates stay low I will be back there every time I am in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous LeGrande visit”
Reviews.Author: wildflower-Frisco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned just a week ago from a business trip . I was able to accompany him during our stay and visit the grand museums of Paris, and do some window shopping in the wonderful boutiques. We had the pleasure of staying at the "Club" level which allows you access to the wonderful concierge staff and light meals during the day, plus wine, champagne and appetizers at night. Although the weather was somewhat rainy and cold, the weekday crowds to the Louvre and Musee D' Orsay were nonexistent. The hotel is only about 10 minutes walking distance to most all of the sights and the major shopping opportunities on Haussman street. I must mention Alexandra to you and her colleague Ann. Alexandra helped us secure reservations to some very memorable restaurants, most which were in the 39-50 euro price range per person. Don't hesitate to use this hotel if you are visiting Paris. The location and staff cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: twin123185
Reviews.Content: Okay, I saw the bad reviews but I had a free weekend night coupon due to my Ambassador status so staying here for 2 nights was for me, a no-brainer. I booked the cheapest room and was upgraded to a better room on the club floor with an amazing view of the Opera House. We were treated very well and the front desk and Concierge (thanks Roger) were extremely helpful. The room was clean and typically French. Yes the prices for everything were crazy - the minibar as well as the restaurant and drinks - $26 for a bloody mary ! I just went to different cafes around the block. I was never more than an 8 Euro cab ride from anywhere and the metro and shopping were minutes away. Start your stay here with a smile and these folks will treat you royally.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental stealing issue”
Reviews.Author: datoWarsaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed in le grand hotel paris on 27 december 2008, we were out for dinner at around 6pm and came back at around 8pm. During those time, the cleaner cleaned up the room which we didnt know. When we came back, our belongings which are 1 nikon camera, 2 nokia mobile phones and 1 camera bag were stolen. We were sure the cleaner took our things. we reported to themanager of the hotel. we also went to the police. Until now, the hotel didnt do anything. We are so dissapointed on how the hotel did not do any investigation on our case. They simply didnt care and thought they always have customer coming to their hotel anyway. The manager also mentioned that missing things from hotel rooms sometimes happen there. Well, it is very clear that the cleaners there are thieves!. Be carefull staying there, or just stay somewhere else. More information at -------

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed by Le Grand paris”
Reviews.Author: reggob
Reviews.Content: Have to echo the sentiments of "travelsalotmore77". My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights Mon 29th to Thurs Jan 1st. I too was somewhat anxious as to what to expect from this hotel based on some of the reviews posted here, but was willing to give it a turn on the experiences of other Intercontinentals. From the moment we arrived on the Monday afternoon to a 4.00pm check out on New Years Day it was flawless. We are Ambassador members and we booked a club interconti room, on arrival were upgraded to an executive room and while it overlooked a busy street, it was extremely quiet. We incurred no room intrusions and as mentioned previously we felt we had the wing to ourselves. The facilities at the club lounge were spot on. Have been to Paris many times and this has been the best experience. It is certainly not the cheapest option but for its class it does offer good value when compared to some of its competitors. My advice is give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Serious service related problems at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monamonique
Reviews.Content: As is indicated in some of the other reviews, there is a serious customer service related problem at this hotel. I am used to the "Gallic indifference" one encounters in Paris, and in fact sometimes find it quite funny and charming. But the attitude of the staff at this hotel is not indifferent, it is hostile and incredibly rude. The problems we encountered at check in could have easily been resolved, as we are Gold Ambassador members and had all the details of our reservation in writing. However, after going into the back room, somehow they mysteriously produced an alternate reservation for an inferior room, and they absolutely refused to honor our original reservation, even though we got the Ambassador representative in the US on the phone to try and help. (She spoke with the manager, and gave up, apologizing to us for the problem, but agreeing that they were not going to honor the reservation no matter what she tried) This is a very large hotel, and it was not full, but they gave us a room that was so loud from the sound of the Metro and the outside street noise that, when I called to request a different room, I held up the phone, and the Manager said "WHAT is that noise"? When I told him that is what it sounded like in our room, he said that there was nothing he could do about noise, and hung up! Finally, after many calls and tears, we got a different manager on the night shift, and the problems were solved, but by that time it was 7:30 PM. During our short stay, we heard three different customers bitterly complaining or arguing about the treatment they were receiving, and one employee quietly apologized and told us that she had worked at other Intercontinental hotels in Europe and had never seen such terrible treatment of loyalty members. This is a beautiful hotel, incredibly convenient, and should be a pleasure to stay at. It is expensive, but if you are taking a special occasion trip, or money is not a real issue, then this hotel should be on the top of the list of possible places to stay in Paris. We have stayed here in the past, and did not encounter these terrible problems. But something has happened, and this hotel is no longer to be recommended. However, if you can tolerate the treatment, and do not care what you get for the money, but just want an expensive hotel in a terrific location, then by all means stay here. Bring a clock, because none of the rooms have one, and be prepared to argue about all of the charges they will add to your bill unless you protest. Prepare to pay dearly for coffee/tea as there is no kettle in the room, prepare to have the room service charge for bringing ice to the room taken off your bill (there is no other way to get ice than calling room service, and although they don't charge for the ice, they do try to access a service charge to bring it to the room), and hope that when you arrive and depart one of the more accommodating managers is on duty. I'm sorry to say this about this hotel, as I have loved it in the past, but I won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand!”
Reviews.Author: bodenseher
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in the Le Grand Hotel Intercontinental, paid with Priority Club points (40.000 points, no breakfast). It's right next to the Opera and close to Galeries Lafayette. Subway is 1 min walk. With ambassador status you get a complimentary 4 PM check-out. The hotel is all you expect from this price range, and it's quite big (we had to walk a couple of hallways to get to our room). I guess we got the most "basic" room, which was quite small, with a view into an empty yard. The interior was very luxuriuos, incl. the 50 cl Evian bottle for 8 Euros in the mini bar. Bed was great. Bathroom was OK, with the door having some paint falling off on the inside. The only annoying thing that we were unable to turn off the noisy bathroom fan - but I didn't bother to ask about it since it wasn't much of a problem when the bathroom door was closed. We didn't use any other features of the hotel (there's a spa and health club), and we didn't have any food there (There are some reasonably priced bistros around). At the check-out they tried to charge me chocolate from the minibar that we didn't consume. I guess they thought our trash looked like stuff from the mini bar. Next time I would try a different place I guess, just to be able to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room!”
Reviews.Author: 4everTravellingWorld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a suite junior and it was amazing!!! Very big and spacious,the bathroom was huge!! there was a big shower place and a huge tub. I dont know about the service in this hotel since we got there at night and left at the morning. I just can say that the Suite Junior its amazing...I travelled quite a lot to the same categories of hotel as this one and I can say that this is on my top 5.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but with a few cracks”
Reviews.Author: superdaveuk
Reviews.Content: As an intercontinental ambassador member you get a weekend “buy one night get another night free” – as my girlfriend and I wanted a weekend away this seemed the ideal time to use it. We booked a 2 night stay in a superior room with club access, which according to the booking site was one level below the junior suite. Now, as ambassador members you get a one level upgrade, so I was surprised to see that our booking had been updated to an Executive room with club access instead. This particular combination isn’t available on the booking site, so one might say this is to prevent ambassadors getting into the suites. After a few emails to and fro pointing out this injustice, this was rectified to a junior suite as an “exceptional upgrade”. Upon arrival (it's just outside the Opera metro station) we were greeted by the check-in staff (although no-one was there at the entrance to open the doors for us) and sent upstairs to the private check in by the very welcoming and helpful club lounge staff. All was very good, although as we had arrived early (12:30pm) the room that we were allocated wasn’t ready. No problem – it wasn’t as if we’d had a long journey. They stored our bags and took my mobile number so that they could call me when it was ready, which they duly did a few hours later. The room was lovely, if slightly smaller than I’d imaged, but I guess I’m being a little picky. The bathroom was big, with a separate shower and bath, there were 3 small balcony areas with a lovely view out towards the Eiffel tower – the Opera is nice, but personally I think this view is the better one! Complimentary water, fruit and biscuits were delivered soon after, but the staff member came into the room despite a very loud “Can you come back later please” from inside. It wasn’t until later that we noticed that there wasn’t any tea or coffee facilities in the room (although they are available free of charge at the club lounge 24/7). The TV was also a little small and disappointing and there was no separate radio / CD player. The club lounge itself was great – a full free bar and food from 6pm in the evening for 2 hours, followed up by free champagne for the rest of the evening. That glass of free champagne would cost about 16 euros downstairs, so it really is worth paying the extra for club access. We tended to go there for drinks and nibbles before we went out for food, cutting down the cost of eating out, which in Paris is expensive! The only quibble I would say is that the lounge closes at 10pm – not late enough for any post meal relaxation. It also includes breakfast, which offered a good selection of hot and cold items. However, the cafe le paix downstairs also does breakfast and as we were staying for the weekend I’d booked the hotel’s luxury weekend rate which included breakfast and a late checkout. On the first morning we headed down and had a very nice breakfast, in lovely surroundings. Lunch and Evening Customers pay a lot of money to sit here (the hotel is situated right next to the opera house, so it’s a place to be seen), so I wasn’t going to pass up the chance, even though we hadn’t been specifically told breakfast was included there at check-in. At the end of breakfast I was given a slip to sign, which I thought was a little odd. Afterwards, I checked with the usually helpful club lounge staff who, unusually turned on the Gallic shrug of the shoulders and said that it wasn’t included. Ahh well, some you win... we thought. However, I’d checked against the printed out booking and later on went back to check again with the staff – it appeared that the cost of breakfast hadn’t made its way on to our bill, so there wasn’t in the end a problem, but either another unlucky customer had 2 extra breakfasts added to their bill or they had finally got it right. We didn’t chance it on the second morning though – the club lounge was our destination then! If you do stay on the club make sure you check out the splendour of the rest of the hotel – the ball room is quite amazing and is usually not occupied during the weekdays – pop in and take a look, you’ll more than likely get it all to yourself! All in all it was a lovely stay – Paris is a wonderful, if expensive city to visit, but despite all its splendour there are a few basics with this hotel that were missing. We were treated, in the most part very well and the complimentary food and drinks in the club lounge were very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent Staff”
Reviews.Author: docGamba
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days at this property in September '08. The decor is what you would expect from an upscale hotel. However the front desk and concierge were lacking. If you pay a high price for a room you expect that service comes with it. The concierge had little to offer regarding resturant recommendations and even with providing simple directions on getting around Paris. One time they even put us on the wrong bus. They really didn't care and felt they were doing you a favor in simply listening to your request. We've stayed at their other hotels and were always pleased by the level of service. This hotel has a systemic service issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but reception staff need to be more responsive”
Reviews.Author: Pavarroti
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an enviable location for a lot of Paris attractions. It also has fabulous public areas and grand corridors befitting of a 5* star hotel. It was a bit of a shock to find our Classic Room was tiny, with a poorly designed bathroom and little storage space for clothes. If you can afford it, pay more for a larger room. There were some problems with service and attention to detail which I would not expect of a hotel of this standing. Our bathroom had several cracks in the basin which could have cuased cuts to your hands and no evidence of the safe meant to be in the room. We reported this to the reception on arrival, but nothing happened! The receptionist alluded to us not being able to recognise the safe in the storage area!! I do know what a safe looks like. By the end of day three we got frustrated with no action and called the duty manager. Barbara came to our room and inspected it. She offered to move us immediately, but we were on a tight turn around that evening, and couldn't change rooms. We did the next day, and she had kindly moved us to a suite with a balcony overlooking the street. Overall a great hotel, but more attention needs to be payed to customers feedback and immediate action from reception staff, rather than just fobbing you off.

Reviews.Title: “An Adequate Choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tommy0609
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 8 nights in mid-September in a standard room. We were generally satisfied during our stay, but not to the extent that we would not try other hotels during future trips to Paris. Location: Extremely convenient with respect to commute to and from the airport. The Roissy bus stop is about 100 meters from the hotel entrance. With respect to being a convenient base for tourism, I have some mixed feelings. Very close to certain landmarks like the Opera, Vendome and the Madeline, and for those who don't mind walking a bit, within walking distance from the Louvre. But the neighborhood itself is basically a busy shopping district (Lafayette and Printemps within 5 minutes walk), without the typical easy access to cozy cafes and intimate restaurants. What this means is that for those people (such as ourselves) who prefer to dine and hang out in neighborhoods such as Saint Germain and Latin Quarter, the hotel is a bit of a pain. Rooms: It's a hotel in Paris. Rooms are small, but at least Le Grand has separate shower and toilet. Clean and well-kept. Restaurant: The main restaurant (Cafe de la Paix) does a reasonable buffet breakfast and above-average dinner. Ambience: Not quite a noisy tourist trap, but it's not Plaza Athenee or Four Seasons either, in terms of decor, ambience or again, location. Overall, not a bad choice - a reasonable compromise between true high-end hotels and tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid stay at the Le Grand”
Reviews.Author: jetsetpanda
Reviews.Content: The Le Grand is strategically located next to the major stores (Galeries Lafayette and Printemps), airport bus stop, American Express office and Opera metro. As an Ambassador member I was upgraded to a suite and had access to the Club floor. Every staff member was unfailingly polite and professional, from the concierge greeting you upon entering the property to the housekeeper wishing you "bonjour" passing you by in the halls in the morning. The ladies manning the Club floor were the epitome of courtesy and hospitality, always wearing a smile and being accommodating. Breakfast and afternoon snacks at the Club were satisfying and impressive with a great assortment of food items and beverages. The only negative thing that I have heard about this property is that the standard rooms can be very small, although I could not verify this fact personally.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: gwillen100
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. My wife and I spent 4 nights here. The location was great for walking trips in Paris. The hotel staff was very friendly and the concierge was helpful with all trip accomodations. Beds were the best that we slept in during the 10 nights we spent in France. Room was large with a balcony on the 3rd floor with a great street view. The price was high compared to the the Le Parc Hotel that we also spent 2 nights in during this trip. The LeParc was in a quieter area and $200 per night cheaper then the Le Grand. However, the Le Grand had far more amenities. So for value I would go with the LeParc, however, if you want to spend a little more the Le Grand had more to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Bfulk
Reviews.Content: First, I would like to say that we are Ambassador status customers. My husband stays at least 20 nights each month in hotels for business. That being said, we have a ton of priority points and decided to use them for our 7 day stay. We do not know if it was because we are American or the fact that we used points to pay for the stay, but we were treated unkindly to say the very least. We were checked in by a very abrasive woman, who seemed to be "put upon" just by having to do her job. Second, this is not a luxury hotel. This is the second Intercontinental we have stayed at and niether can be considered luxurious. We have stayed at Holiday Inn Express hotels that were 200 % better than this property. We were glad to have used points to pay for the stay. If we had paid out of pocket, we would have never checked in. The traveler photos here, are accurate. But, photos are photos and much is not seen and comfort cannot be felt visually. There was bottled water and a plate of fruit when we entered the room. The fruit was covered in mold. Upon giving it to the staff, nothing was said. I guess this is the "norm". As mentioned in some reviews here, our room too, was entered frequently without explanation. It is our belief that they enter the room in order to turn off the air conditioning. The woman who entered our room was not housekeeping. We were dressing for dinner when she entered and we tried to stop her but she bolted down the hallway as we were asking what she needed. We started leaving the t.v. on to deter any entering. Before this, we came back to our room to find the air conditioning off. We understand saving energy.....but the air conditioning system didn't do a good job of cooling the room and trying to get the room cool after it was off for several hours was difficult. The concierge desk was another area that could be greatly improved. Upon arriving in Paris we had no luggage. Air France for whatever reason failed to put our baggage on the plane in NYC. Not a huge deal, we are world travelers, we've had lost bags, delayed bags, many, many times. We have the ability to buy what we need. The concierge desk was informed that we were expecting our bags to be delivered. We were without our bags for 2 days and when we finally were informed the bags had made it to Paris and would be delivered between 9pm and midnight, we went to the concierges' desk and told them, that no matter what time the bags arrived, to please have them sent up. He even asked, "If they arrive at 2am, send them up?" "Yes," we said. "No matter what time it is." At 12:30 am my husband calls to see if they have shown up yet. Yes, they had shown up some time ago, is what we were told. Upon asking if someone can bring them up, we were told.....yes, in about 20 minutes. Frustrating to say the least. In about 10 min. the bags arrived. Other than that, we are still waiting for our 4am wake up call on our departure day. For all of these reasons, we would never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raluca25
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights .The hotel is in a great location for walking and shopping. It is close to everything if you like to walk and very close to the Metro. Nightlife is pretty quiet. The hotel itself is very luxurious, and the staff genuinely friendly and helpful. Our hotel room was very clean, modern bathroom, the bed was comfortable and big heavy curtains blocked out all daylight. We love this hotel and plan to stay every time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: jp7125
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, close to everything if you like to walk and very close to the Metro. The hotel itself is very nice, what you would expect ambiance wise from an Intercontinental Hotel. The lack of follow thru leaves much to be desired. We never received our Ambassador welcome gift, our room was not serviced an entire day and our minibar was overcharged. Fortunately, on the last night of a 3 night stay (and after complaining each day) a guest relations manager named Marta showed concern and fixed all the problems without delay. It is a shame such a lovely property has such indifferent front desk and telephone staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lis24
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights and were made very welcome. All the staff appear genuinely friendly and helpful. The hotel is very grand and luxurious . The bar of an evening was just a little too quiet, there is plenty of seating just outside of the bar area which can be used if you wanted a quiet space. Our hotel room was immaculate with all mod cons. The bed was comfortable and big heavy curtains blocked out all daylight. The shower was a little disappointing and could be difficult for some climbing out of the bath as the shower door is a touch obstructive. Mini bar was expensive and unfortunately no coffee making facilities in the room! Room service for a morning coffee was in my opinion too expensive. The location of the hotel is ideal for all sightseeing with public transport stops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Paris hotel luxury”
Reviews.Author: clarissa_pants
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a trip to Paris for the first time - I know I shouldn't have got to forty something without going there, but thats life. Stayed at the Le Grand, which is just opposite the Grand Opera. It is a beautiful luxurious hotel and I could have stayed for ever! It is only 2 minutes walk from the bus stop that goes to Charles De Gaulle (in fact we drove to the airport and parked there, getting the bus in/out was fantastically easy). The room was beautiful, it helped that we got an upgrade being Priority Club members. The concierge team were fabulous, very helpful, even helping us book another hotel in France for other nights. They sold tickets for all the attractions, a couple of euros more than at the attraction itself but then you don't have to queue. In fact at the Eiffel Tower we walked straight in through a VIP lane! Very cool! Had lunch in the restaurant on the Sunday and I have never tasted such a beautiful steak, plus the mashed potato was divine. the restaurant staff were attentive and professional without being stuffy or overbearing. Not at all the stereotypes of French waiting staff. Loved the place and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Big Rooms - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tvlgirlnj
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Le Grand is a very large hotel - but (other than when you're hiking to your room!), you feel like its a much more intimate property. Very impressed with the rooms -- modern bathrooms, very comfortable and beautifully appointed. Not to mention a nice size for Europe! You can walk to the Louvre and the Opera House is just across the street. I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jlsween
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 night stay at Le Grand hotel, Paris. After booking it I read some reviews about the shower leaking and the staff being unfriendly but nothing can beat a stay at this hotel, it's definitely a 5* experience and every member of staff I spoke to was fantastic. When we arrived we were 2 hours early and our room wasn't ready so, as we are priority club members, we were given a free upgrade and complimentary late check out. The hotel is everything you would expect - within 10 minutes of being in our, absolutely exquisite, room our luggage was delivered by the bell boy and the head of housekeeping called by to make sure everything was ok (it was). The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in and was freshly changed every day when we went out. And when we came back from our evenings out, housekeeping had been in and closed the curtains and turned down the duvet. I wouldn't advise eating or drinking in the hotel too often or your room bill will be huge (12 euros for 50cl Kronenburg/48 euros for breakfast) but there are several restaurants locally that are very reasonably priced...the Gallopin is a 10 min walk and the food is to die for (3 courses + wine & coffee came to 148euros), Chez Clement is just over the road and is not bad either. On our last night we visited the Drouant which is a very classy place but has a very limited menu (a bit more expensive than the others but still reasonable). Also, the concierge at the hotel are the most helpful people I have ever met and will book a table at any restaurant for you and call you a taxi (you'll get a better service at the restaurant if you do it this way). You can also buy tickets for loads of monuments like Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Moulin Rouge, Seine River Cruise Evening Meal (expensive but worth every penny) and queue jump everywhere (you'll appreciate it at the Eiffel when the queue is going right around the monument). A fantastic hotel - only complaint would be that at £600 per night I'd like to be able to make a cup of coffee in a morning (although extensive mini bar - no kettle/coffee etc).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome as Always”
Reviews.Author: Jonas31
Reviews.Content: When in Paris I have always alternated between the Grand Hyatt Vendome or the Le Grande. I have travelled to Paris many times, usually in summer for the TdF and always on vacation. This year I was with my wife who is newly pregnant and had not been to Paris before. I chose the Le Grand because of its proximity to the Grande Boulevards - my wife is quite the shopper and it is an easier walk from the Le Grande. As per my last stay here - July 2006 - the full package was excellent. We stayed in an Opera facing Junior Suite - ( I was upgraded from an executive room due to their record of my frequent stays - great perk for frequent travellers). The room was enormous with 3 balconies, large King size bed, dressing room, lounge, the usual Huge bathroom and great internet service. The service at all levels was fantastic - food great, room service incredibly effecient (even brought us a kettle for my wife to boil water at 2 Am - she was feeling terribly nauseous), lobby an oasis of calm and concierge service superb. The maid service and turn down service was excellent - the room always looked like a palace in the evenings - big bed, bigger duvet, huge pillows and gowns etc all laid out. the rooms are sooo quiet at night and the curtains block out any night light. we love this hotel and plan to stay every time in Paris - the Vendome is just not really worth the extra Euros per night. We will be back in July and look forward to more of the same.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: PMACCA
Reviews.Content: Had organised this hotel as special 40th birthday trip for my wife and I and we were not let down in any way. We flew into Paris CDG airport, caught the very busy Roissy bus and couldnt believe how close it drops you to the hotel, highly recommend this. Upon arrival our room wasnt ready...no problem as we were offered complimentary champagne, coffee etc in the luxurious and grand lounge of the hotel, at this point you start to realise you are somewhere very special. We decided to go explore and came back an hour later and went to our room to find cases and hand luggage already there. Room was lovely with twin balconies overlooking the Rue Scribe, excellent bed and wife loved the L'occitane toiletries, as previously mentioned room service very quick, value for money and great food. My wife had a few treatments at the spa on the morning of her birthday and being a spa junkie she was very complimentary of the masseuse and spa staff.I would suggest booking in advance as it does get busy. We done all the usual touristy things...louvre, eiffle tower, champs elysee and so on. Most are within walking distance if moderately fit and healthy if not Paris taxis very reasonable. If you do plan to go to the Eiffle tower get your tickets from the concierge, they will be more expensive than the face value but you will avoid the queus...we went at 9 am saturday morning and were suprised to see at least 500 people waiting to purchase tickets, we joined the blue queue and were on the first lift up to the second floor when the tower opened at 930, we took the usual holiday snaps then took the lift to the top...we were at the top at 945am with only 2 other people...simply wonderful. Can recommend the river cruise, we done the none stop cruise but i believe Bateaux Mouche let you "hop on and off" at various points along the river. To summarise great City, great hotel and will definetly return soon.

Reviews.Title: “loved the le grand”
Reviews.Author: tripjunkie8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel!!!!! Our opera room was beautifully decorated and well equipped. Walk in closet w/safe, shelving, luggage storage, iron w/board, built in drawers, umbrella for your use during your stay and a light that automatically comes on when you walk in to it. Super comfy bed with the fluffiest feather pillows I have ever slept on and down duvet with pretty coverlet and gold satin decorative pillow. Also had lovely burgundy velvet drapes. Bathroom was almost as big as the room with bathtub and separate shower, and great amenties such as extra large bath towels big enough for two, bathrobes, slippers and best hair dryer ever! Our room had two balconies, one off the room and the other off the bathroom! This hotel has the fastest room service in existence, I think they must have a chef that cooks just outside your door. You barely have time to slip on a robe and get your tip money out before they get there! Maid service and turndown service were both excellent. Most staff speak english. Concierges are fluent. The hotel restaurant is beautiful and the food fantastic. Try the french onion soup and the asparagus with vinegrette. Some rooms overlook Opera Garnier with the hotel being 1 1/2 blocks from Galeries Lafayette and Printemps. Fragonard is across the street. Quiet rooms with double paned windows.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Sitges2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as newly qualified 'Royal Ambassadors' with Priority Club. We had booked a standard room but at check in we were upgraded to a Junior Suite with Opera House View, including Club Lounge Access. The room was fantastic with a very nice view and french windows. The room was a great size and we were informed that our minibar consumption would be complimentary due to our status. The Club Lounge is very nice with a good selection of nibbles, pastries and snacks during the day and an open bar during the evening. We ordered room service dinner one evening and this was really good quality however there was too much on the plate. We requested an extended check out until 6pm due to us having to catch a late Eurostar and this was not a problem. This was my second visit and I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Grand experience at the LeGrand”
Reviews.Author: Vkash
Reviews.Content: Intercontinental LeGrand was a fantastic experience. We celebrated our wedding anniversary and the hotel upgraded us to a Junior Suite. The Lobby is amazing and the staff very courteous and helpful. Our room was fairly big sized with a wonderful view of the Opera Garnier. The bed was cozy and the bathrooms clean and neat. The best thing about this hotel is the size of the rooms and location. The hotel is very close to the Louvre and other attractions, buses, and restaurants. We had the best experience and I would love to stay here again...but for the price...it is pretty expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience at Le Grand”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoWanderer2008
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using my Priority Club points. Initially, I booked two rooms because I could not find on the web site whether any of the "classic" rooms had two beds. Since I was traveling with my Mom, we need two beds. We when arrived, I found that one of the rooms we were assigned had two beds. They gave me both keys and we looked at both of them. One of the rooms was much larger so we took it. Since I had booked with points, I didn't expect that they would be refunded. To my surprise, all of the points for all five nights were refunded without question. The room was large with a separate shower and rub. The toliet was in a separate room just off the foyer which did cause some challenges when needing to wash the hands! The staff was excellent. My Mom fell in one of the museums and when we got back to the hotel, the maid was in the room and immediately got more towels so we could prop up her leg and wash cloths for the ice. She was very concerned and tried to help even though she didn't speak much English. We found that attitude throughout the hotel. The location of the Le Grand is excellent for visiting Paris. It is only steps away from the Opera and from the Hop-on Hop-off main bus stop. You can walk to the Lourve and the Madeline. We would stay there again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Inexcusably inefficient check-in, otherwise only just good enough for the price”
Reviews.Author: brittripper
Reviews.Content: I arrived with two young children at 3 pm from the airport expecting our room to be ready. It was not. This is completely unacceptable for a 5-star hotel. The receptionist said they were very full but this is no excuse. A room should be ready at check-in time. Lots of muttering by receptionist, 15 minutes wasted while she pored over a computer and talked to colleagues. Eventually we were found a room. She said proudly that it was an "upgrade" with a view of the opera house. I.e. same sort of room, but a view of a building. Big deal. The room was very clean and comfortable with an excellent bathroom with separate shower. Telly didn't work properly but at least that made the children read their books. No free water in room so had to buy at extortionate price from mini bar because forgot to find supermarket on way to dinner. No free mineral water in an expensive (£350+ per night) 5-star hotel in Paris? You gotta be joking.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: Susurs
Reviews.Content: Though in a magnificent location, magnificent building and with the most comfortable bed-pillows in the world, I had expected more from this hotel. My room was surprisingly small and very loud. I could hear my neighbors speaking on the phone and everything that was going on in the hall. Especially disturbing was the personnel, who steadily tried to get in my room: at first they knock, and when you ask what they want, they just come in - and then they apologize, seeing that you are, for example, in bed and go away. I was disturbed like this for some 5 times during my 3day stay and still don't know what exactly they wanted, as there was no explanation. So because of the small room and the noise (and also some other small details) I don't think the price is worth paying. There are actually other - better and also cheaper - places in Paris where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worse five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freedom99
Reviews.Content: First , the service was worse than a 3 star hotel. I walk pass the staff and they dont even greet you. Even better you find the hotel staff staff just speaking to one another around the star case of the hotel. Second, try asking the conceige for help and it like he doing you a big favor. Worse, he gave use the wrong information on where to go. Third, the room you have door handles missing. Mildew on the bath tub, light that dont work. Gone thur two room and it all the same If your looking for 5 star hotel stay at the four season George V, it was magic when we stayed there just few months ago. Finally, Le grand give you free coffee in the morning - instant coffee. Please dont waste your money, they suck

Reviews.Title: “Only let down by breakfast”
Reviews.Author: emsland
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully situated for sights and shopping. Excellent and smiling welcome at reception. Overall ambience fine. As others have said, our room was cramped but for two nights quite acceptable. We had dinner in the restaurant, the food quality was superb but at the north end of Parisian prices. But unless you have breakfast included in the rate, go to one of the many cafes around the corner. You are more likely to get a smile. At 37.50 Euros we might have expected not to queue for 10 minutes, a pot of coffee rather than the cold dregs from a flask (after many requests for any coffee at all) and someone to clear the dirty plates.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: tmlondonLondon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights at this wonderful hotel, this is the first time I have ever bothered to write a review on anything on my return, but having had such a great time I really felt I should. The main reason our trip was so good was that we booked through the website whatahotel with gives you free complimentary room upgrade and access to the club lounge which has free food and drinks. Considering a breakfast in the hotel is 45 euros you are saving quite a bit. On our arrival our room was upgraded simply because the website we had booked through (and we still paid the exact same rate that the hotel had offered us directly), the room was huge. The location of the hotel is perfect for both shopping and sightseeing, you can get almost anywhere by walking or there are plenty of taxis outside. All in all I really can't fault the place, just brilliant. But you would be mad to book direct rather than whatahotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but could have been better...”
Reviews.Author: S_plus_P
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend - booked an executive room at the luxury weekend rate (which includes breakfast) and as an intercontinental ambassador member was upgraded to an executive room with Opera view. Our room was on the 3rd floor in the Opera wing and contained a small entrance area with mini-bar and a door to the toilet, a fairly large main bedroom area with a huge comfortable king sized bed, one wall of wardrobes/drawers with a widescreen TV located within the inset, a desk, a table, a few chairs, a bathroom with small bathtub and a walk-in shower - toiletries are L'Occitane which are very good indeed - and tall windows (in both the bathroom and the main bedroom) which opened up allowing access to a balcony - we had a fantastic view of the opera house. The room had a slight musty smell which we managed to reduce by opening the windows as often as possible to let in fresh air. Street noise at night with the windows closed is ok, but the slight vibration/noise from the metro every 5 minutes from early until late can be a little annoying - I'm not sure if this affects the entire hotel - but if I'd been paying the full rate of €740 a night (!) then I'd have been unhappy. We noticed some small imperfections which you'd think would have been checked/repaired: small patch of peeling wallpaper in toilet, a flaking ceiling in the shower, and the bathroom sink plug wouldn't stay closed. Saying that, I've experienced similar problems in almost every 4 or 5 star hotel I've stayed in. Location wise it is very good, a short walk to some large department stores (the food hall at La Fayette is gorgeous), the Louvre, the Seine, a selection of cinemas often showing films in the original language (identified by V.O. in the listings), and obviously the Opera metro station is very close. A tip here: turn right from the hotel's main lobby when exiting, and there is a small station entrance at the end of Rue Scribe. Breakfast in the Cafe De La Paix was good but I doubt we'd have paid the €37.50 charge if it had not been included in our room rate when you can get breakfast at a cafe for around €8-15. However the breakfast choice was amazing (eggs made to order, huge range of fruit, bread, hot breakfast items, smoked salmon, cold meat, and a good Japanese section too - only surprise was a very poor range of cheese: a brie and 3 different very plain mild cheese slices - in Paris?!). The service was reasonable. The front desk staff were friendly and efficient, as were the concierge: the tickets we purchased here for the Eifel Tower (level 2 only) and the Louvre bypassed the need to queue for tickets at either place (saving at least 45 minutes at the Tower), and I can absolutely recommend the restaurant which the concierge booked for us: the Gallopin (see www DOT brasseriegallopin DOT com) - average 3 courses here with wine from the a la carte was €50-60, and it's a 15 minute stroll from the hotel. The spa seemed to be very good, and the prices appeared to be reasonable - the gym is small for a 500 room hotel but the 8 machines they have are very good, and the sauna was good. Had a slight problem at check-out with the breakfast being charged to the room, When I pointed out this was an error, I was then told the rate did not include breakfast. I insisted it did (I had the print out of the reservation which stated this, it is a standard part of a "luxury weekend" booking, and I was told at check-in that breakfast was included), so they checked their paperwork, found out it was, apologised, and removed this from the account. I'd stay here again based on my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sashina
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend here staying on Holiday Inn points. We had a small room in the Capucines wing (not so far from the lifts, unlike some rooms!). It was small, but extremely comfortable and gloriously sunny, with French doors opening onto a narrow balcony with a view to the street. At night we really appreciated the blackout drapes: it was pitch black in the room - fabulous! The bathroom was good, but no better than the shabbiest motel when it came to the shower flooding the floor. Luckily a spare hand towel had been provided! Toiletries are L'Occitane and lovely. We'd stay there again ... but definitely only on points!

Reviews.Title: “Vey Impressed”
Reviews.Author: calvados13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this wonderful hotel for a long weekend a couple of weeks ago. I booked via IC Hotel website and used my loyalty points to claim reward nights (I am Intercontinantal Royal Ambassador). On arrival we found we had been upgraded to a Club Executive room which was beautiful. There were complimentary bottles of water and large fruit plate awaiting. The bathroom was luxurious and the bathrobes were changed daily. My wife particulary liked the complimentary (expensive) toiletries. As a RA the mini bar was also complimentary and was restocked on request. This hotel is ideally situated and unlike some previous reviewers we found all the hotel staff to be attentive and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Cherry on top of a Wonderful long weekend”
Reviews.Author: TXfigment
Reviews.Content: If you can afford the Intercontinental, or if you have any Holiday Inn points saved up, I highly recommend this hotel. Now, I was an Ambassador with the Priority Club when I stayed at this hotel and was upgraded from Opera view to Opera view Suite. When we arrived at the hotel we checked in at the front desk, the check in was very smooth. They did not have my room ready yet, but it was the upgraded room. They appologized and offered for us to use the Club to relax or the health club. We had siteseeing to do so we left our bags with the bellhop and they were placed in our rooms when it was ready. The View from the room was great and we sat by the window on the couch at least 2 nights drinking wine, with cheese and fruits that we purchased at the store. Everything about the hotel was very comfortable. we loved the location and the metro located at the doorstep of the hotel. Another big plus is the location of the airport shuttle bus that drops of only a couple car lengths from the front door of the hotel. The Bed was very comfortable and I loved the Bathroom which also had a great view of the Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Grand”
Reviews.Author: thetravellerdxb
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Grand before so I knew what room size we should have got. I booked 2 executive rooms described as size 35 m on the intercontinental website. Upon arrival we were shown our rooms which were tiny. The hotel then started a very long process of trying to have us pay extra to get a room the size that we had booked and already paid for. We felt the hotel was following a policy of upsell on their internet rates. After much discussion we checked in to our 2 tiny rooms. So disappointing -why weren't we given the room we booked and why were we treated so badly as club intercontitnelat members. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Le Grand Jr Suite & Club = Great New Year's Celebration!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaTraveler7740
Reviews.Content: Wow! The Intercontinental Le Grand Hotel in Paris is tremendous and highly recommended! We had a junior suite, which I couldn't really find out much about on the internet before we went - but it was REALLY Big! It did not have separate rooms, but there was a king bed, a desk, two benches, a seating area with a love seat (which opens to a bed) and two chairs. We added a roll away and still had lots of space. The marble bathroom was also large, with a separate tub and shower, and a table beside the sink for all your stuff. We had access to the Intercontintental Club, which was also great. The breakfast at the club (served late each day), made getting to the sights much more efficient, and there was good champagne flowing every evening after six. Plus, it has a business center with free internet access. The hotel gets an A+ for cleanliness and comfort. The lobby was beautiful (if small), and the restaurant, Cafe de la Paix is divine. The only complaint is that the concierge left a little bit to be desired, but they are french. We would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Superb location”
Reviews.Author: shayes7
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner recently stayed at the Le Grand Paris and we couldn't of asked for a better experiance and location for our stay in Paris. We checked in on 21st Dec 07 for 3 nights and after an eventful expedition getting to the hotel (do take the RTA bus service that goes from CDG to straight outside the hotel-we went tube, not the choice) we were greeted at checking with an free upgrade overlooking the Opera. When we arrived to the room, the views were stunning of the Opera and the room itself was amazing. I've read previous reviews on the Le Grand and people were moaning about how small the rooms were. In all fairness, it is a Major city, and all Major cities have reletively small rooms, but i did think the room was very spacious and elegant. You have a seperate dressing area and a very spacious bathroom, with a seperate shower and bath. Can't be that small!!! The hotel itself is pretty spectacular. I happened to come across a banquetting hall on my way to the public toilets, and it looked like something out of a Cathedral!! Truely Spectacular! I recommend a peak! We didn't eat at the hotel at any point. 40 Euro's for a Buffet breakfast...which i know are very good...but not for 40 Euro's. Unfortunately, you are in Paris, and Paris being Paris, is possibly the most expensive place i have ever visited and do expect to pay high prices for food and drinks. If you don't want to pay 40 Euro's for breakfast, there is a small traditional French Cafe around the corner opposite the American Express, which serve a Traditional French Breakfast for 13 Euro's. If your thinking of comming to Paris, i truely recommend this hotel, even if it is abit pricey, but all worth it. Treat that special someone if a special occassion.

Reviews.Title: “The Grandest of Grand”
Reviews.Author: EURTravels
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was the highlight of our European vacation. We researched quite a few places, and having stayed at what is now the Westin Paris before, we knew of the Le Grand Hotel. It did not disappoint. It is pricey, but the location is outstanding, the staff very friendly, and the rooms were beautiful. Only downside was the Concierge. They are quick to recommend tourist traps for english speaking guests, without even asking what type of dining we were interested in. This was irritating, but the rest of the staff made up for it. I would highly recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Grand experience at Le Grand Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelingroberts
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about Le Grand Hotel in Paris, currently an Intercontinental Hotel. We stayed there for our 15th anniversary, and it was the perfect hotel and location for a home base as we explored Paris for the first time. We booked through the whatahotel website, never having used it before, and were pleased beyond our expectations. Booking through whatahotel allowed us access to the Club Level, where we had excellent service, around-the-clock access to food and drinks (saving us much money), and a fantastic room in which to relax and enjoy the view of the Opera House. The room was beautiful (small, yes, but it is Paris) and the welcome gift much appreciated. The only odd thing about the room was the 1/2 shower door which allowed water to get all over the bath floor. Bed was very comfortable.
