We will definitely be using Lorraine Travel and whatahotel again and recommending it to friends! I would most definitely choose this hotel again for a stay in Paris. It is expensive but I am very picky, so it was worth it to me. It is not for you if you want an intimate, small hotel (it is large and designed by the same person that designed the Paris Opera House, right across the street), but if you are looking for luxury and like to be in the middle of it all, you'll be very pleased with Le Grand Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loving it”
Reviews.Author: Chloe81love
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights as I was in Paris for Business. One of the best hotels I have stayed in Paris. It is a bit pricey, but it is definitely worth it! It is located in the centre of Paris, near majority shopping centres, and 20 minutes walk to the Lourve! When I got to the hotel, they upgraded me to the suite as I was staying there for almost a week, the staff are nice and friendly! The room is realy big and the bathroom is clean and posh too (it comes with a bag of Molton Brown!) I will definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: fhjasfh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely weekend trip to Paris. It is definitely a five star hotel. The Le Grand is centrally located, you can walk to many attractions, lots of high end shops and boutiques, neighborhood did not seem super-touristy. The hotel is charming, nice lobby and lounge. We had a standard room with a street view and a darling balcony. The room was a good size for Paris, good bed and linens, reasonable size bathroom with L’Occitane products, bathrobes and slippers. The concierge was helpful. They sell tickets to for certain museums so you can avoid lines at the museum. Did not try their restaurant, but it receives good reviews. One point to mention is that we received an excellent corporate rate, so for the price we paid, I found the hotel to be excellent. Now if you are paying 500 plus Euros, then you may expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed for what I thought was a Grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: europeantraveler1953
Reviews.Content: First mistake was I had thought I had stayed there 5 yrs ago and had a great experience. I even asked my agent and the hotel directly was there another Intercontinental in Paris. The one I later found out I did stay at is now the Westin. It changed about 1 year ago, so this hotel was the other location after all! I had called directly to inquire about upgrades,prepaying entirely, and the embassy club...to see if they had a problem with the free night or the room upgrade that comes with it. They said it depended on availability for an upgrade. When I had stayed at the Intercontinental in Paris..now Westin, 5 yrs ago, rooms were great, so was service, locale, etc. When we arrived, after a long flight from Atlanta, we were checked in by a frontdesk person who said he was new. He said we would have to wait a few hours to get an upgraded room. I said no problem, it would be worth it for me. He spoke to a woman next to him and she told him to put us in a room ready now. After going to the tiny room I called front desk and said I know the hotel, and this is not an upgrade. They said they were full and that is all they have. I said I will wait, I am not staying in such a tiny room that is not an upgrade being an embassdor member. After telling me to wait in the bar and I would have a room in a few minutes, they just left me hanging , finally after an hour I went to the desk and they said youre room has been ready. Went to the room, a bit larger, but not upgraded.The staff at the front desk, except for the Asian woman who checked us out, were very rude, condescending, could care less if we were happy or ever stayed there again. Room key never worked and everytime we took it back to the desk they said it was our fault,,must have been by our cell phone. It was not. Before going to the hotel I asked was breakfast included, they said yes we were on the floor for members as we were and included breakfast. We went there and the girl curtly told us it was for special members, not us, and that was it. I agree with what the other writer from the oct stay said about the folks who work there at the front desk. Location was fine, not as good as previous Intercontinental now Westin. Which for my money is where I would stay. I have stayed at Intercontinental Hotels on every previous trip and this was by far the only bad experience, but it made me so mad I most likely will never go back to their hotels unless I get referred to the manager as I did and Rome and they were Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: guillermohoter
Reviews.Content: I stayed two years in a row : 2006 and 2007. Both times they did not respect check-in time. Had to wait until 4:30 PM for a room. This year invited a group of friends : we had 4 rooms. Both times they did not respect the cathegory of rooms booked. As the hotel has many different room sizes they lie about cathegory reserved and assigned at check-in. Result : you end up in a room smaller than what you reserved and paid for. I checked many rooms after my 2006 fiasco and it happened again in 2007. Loisy reception desk, no concern about guests relations, it looks as they are trained to cheat. I shall never go back. The building is OK and location very central, although in very busy area. For same rates, there are many other hotels who take care of their guests. I complained to the hotel and Intercontinental Central Offices, never got any solution. If you go there you will feel helplessly lost and cheated.

Reviews.Title: “Just splendid - fabulous weekend”
Reviews.Author: Prospector1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are just back from a fabulous weekend at this hotel, at part of a trip to enjoy the rugby worldcup. Yes the bedroom is on smallish side but the comfort, style and character of this hotel make it well worth it. Great location too convenient to some great shopping as well as the culture. Good breakfast selection but can't comment on dinner as we ate elsewhere. Canapes and light lunch we were offered as part of a trip we were on were excellent. Good atmosphere about the hotel too. Weather was fantastic which made Paris magical. Pity about the Irish rugby team losing to the French though!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 2ksmom
Reviews.Content: I stay here most of the time that I come through Paris for business, which is several times a year. The rooms are small I admit, but the bed is extremely comfortable and all the services are top-notch. Plus there is just so much history in this hotel. Now if I stayed here for pleasure I would use my points, because I can't really afford the prices on my own. You might want to splurge once in a while and try the buffet breakfast. It is expensive, but you can fill up through lunch. Otherwise I usually pop into a nearby Monoprix to get some water, snacks, etc to save on meals.

Reviews.Title: “What do Points Make?”
Reviews.Author: Tazmaniac
Reviews.Content: Just come back from my stay in Le Grand Paris, where I took my wife for our 30th wedding anniversary. What a lovely hotel. Location Just 1.5km from Gard de Nord and adjacent to the Opera Metro (which is cheap(€1.5 per trip), clean, reliable....) An ideal location for sightseeing Paris. Accommodation Hotel is very large, but thanks to the corridors having their own names, finding rooms is easy. I used Priority points for my stay (40,000 per night) as I would never pay the rates the hotel are asking (€6 - 700 per night) even for my anniversary! The "Classic" room you get is more than adequate - clean, bright with a large bathroom. Maids are very good and carry out a turn-down service in the evening, at which they even change the towels. Meals Who would pay €37 each for a continental breakfast when there are numerous cafes within walking distance wher eyou can buy TWO breakfasts of similar quality for only €8?? Rue d'Italians has countless restaurants to accommodate any discerning palate. Plat de Jour at many may look good value, but quantity and quality is far less than main menu. Overall A great base for looking around Paris, watch out for the mad drivers/bikers and enjoy. Use Priority points unless you have a fat wallet!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, opulent”
Reviews.Author: MrKitty
Reviews.Content: Such a classic French hotel. We were lucky enough to be upgraded and the room was just perfect, overlooking Opera Garnier. The house maids were great, the room very clean and a large bedroom and even larger bathroom. I would stay here - it is fantastic - however, not for the budget traveler! I am sure there are a lot of other hotels in Paris that can offer awesome accommodation at a better price, but treat yourself and stay here. Great location and run with French efficiency. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Suave & Chic - A fantastic way to use your Priority Club Points”
Reviews.Author: yog99
Reviews.Content: Location Hotel is in a good location next to the Opera. Roissybus from CGD stops outside for a cheap & painless transfer from the Airport (Save your taxi money for the rest of the trip – you’ll need it IT’S PARIS) Accommodation Hotel very large but easy to navigate. Hotel Rack Rate incredibly high (min approx €600 per night). If you can use your Priority Club Points (now 40,000 per night) – you will only get a “classic” room but it is still fantastic. “Classic” rooms are “small but perfectly formed” – Remember you are in Paris why would you want to spend too much time in your room. L'OCCITANE toiletries in bathroom that were topped up regularly. Breakfast Buffet Breakfast is actually €36 (despite what previous reviews indicate) & is good value when you consider the selection. Breakfast is taken in the historic Le Café de la Paix which actually is a very good value method of experiencing this famous location. There was also a “Japanese Breakfast Buffet” which accounted for about 1/3 of the selection – there appeared to be far less than a 1/3 of the breakfast diners who were Japanese but “C'est la vie” it is an Intercontinental Hotel after all. Staff & Service The Staff were very helpful & courteous – even when it became apparent that we on a budget & weren’t the big spenders that they were probably used to. We arrived early & attempted to check in at 10.30am – were advised politely that our room wasn’t quite ready & given a complimentary drink in the lounge. We actually returned at 12.00am when the room was fully prepared Security (mentioned in a previous review) We encountered NO Security issues. There was a bolt for the door for when you are in the room & obviously there was a (free) safe in the room. There were always plenty of staff in the lobby area. Overall A fantastic historic Hotel in beautiful Paris – Expensive but not necessarily prohibitive if you can utilize your Priority Club Points. A TRULY MEMORABLE EXPERIENCE IS GUARANTEED!

Reviews.Title: “Money Stolen - Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: ichimunki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel in Paris as our engagement trip. I was so excited! It was my first trip to Paris. Unfortunately, money was stolen by a member of the hotel staff and no one at the Intercontinental addressed the situation appropriately. Apparently, the card reader system that tracks who enters and exits the hotel room was broken only for our room! We asked them to fix the card reader so that at least we had some sense of safety after the theft but the hotel never fixed the card system. They did not move us to a safer room. They discouraged us from filing a police report. The way it worked is that the hotel room has a separate room for the toilet and a separate room for the shower. My partner was using the toilet and I was using the shower. A hotel staff member entered the hotel room with fruit and water and I was completely naked in the shower, I asked him to go away. When my partner and I came back out, we noticed that the money was out of his wallet and that money was missing from the wallet. We contacted the hotel management immediately and they did nothing. They told us they would try to read the card reader system - they found out it was broken and did nothing to fix it. They said they would contact the hotel security manager - he did nothing except to say that the card system reader was broken. The only compensation that they gave to us was a 50 euro correction on our hotel bill. We paid thousands of dollars to stay for one week in this hotel. Usually, I am a very easy going person as I understand that different hotels have different problems and they need time to resolve their problems but this was absolutely horrendous. I also felt bad for other hotel customers who were continuously at the service desk for loads of issues (most notably about the Ambassador Elite status thing - which Intercontinental seem not to honor and for not honoring many reservations booked in the United States). I would strongly advise not staying at this hotel regardless of the appearance or the location as safety and security is at risk in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great freebie not so sure if paying full price!”
Reviews.Author: BarryBethal
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service and very swarve (as you would expect). Stayed for 4 nights using priority club points built up from staying away with work. Was in the classic room (obviously not going to give you any better for a freebie!) Room was small but perfectly fine for our needs as we were usually out and about exploring. Staff were excellent and very helpful, concierge recommended a great restaurant called the Royal Madeleine which was a 10 minute walk. Dined in the Cafe de la Paix the first night which was good but would say it was overpriced as I've had better food for less money! Though I suspect you pay for the surroundings as much as anything. Plus it is Paris which is a rip off of a city anyway! Like the title of my review says, this was a brilliant hotel, lots of character, thought Paris was a great city considering I'd never fancied it before but having said that if I'd had to pay the 415EUR per night price as opposed to using rewards nights I'd be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loud wedding band spoiled great stay”
Reviews.Author: Kirkberta
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at this hotel. The location is superb. It's right around the corner from L'Opera in one direction and all the great department stores in the other. The lobby is beautiful and luxe in that Old World sort of way. Our rooms were beautiful. We had a suite with an adjoining room for our kids. The bathrooms were large and looked recently renovated. All the fabrics looked fresh, too. Our rooms faced inward with the windows overlooking the Louvre-style pyramid that covers their bar area, so it was all very quiet...until the wedding. On the second night, we went to bed early because we had to leave for the airport at 6:30a the next morning. The music started around 10:00p. At first we thought it was a rock concert. It was that loud--and it was, well, rock music with a whole lot of bass going on. We called the desk. They said it was a wedding and offered TO SEND US EARPLUGS. I am not kidding. We asked if they could move us, but they said they couldn't. So we opted for the earplugs. A half an hour later and still no earplugs, but at least the band was now doing slow songs. Then, there's a knock on the door and a guy is standing there with pillows. These are the earplugs. Then the band cranked it up again...until 2 am. The next morning there were no apologies or anything. Needless to say, we were pretty stunned (and tired and semi-deaf) and won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not fantastic for the price”
Reviews.Author: MVagusta
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, but not fantastic. The room was clean and new, but very small. For some reason, I can hear water flowing down everytime someone flush their toilet or take a shower upstair, really loud, it would wake me up at night. The front desk staffs are professional but seem overworked and hurried. And the gym is tiny with dirty equipment (from people working out)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toomanybags
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I recently stayed at Le Grand to celebrate his Birthday. I had emailed the hotel prior to arrival to explain this was a special occassion. I had booked an Executive room but on arrival we were given a wonderful corner room on the top floor. Best wishes were conveyed and a bottle of wine sent to the room. The room was large and in excellent condition and decorated beautifully. The service was professional and discreet. We have been to Paris many times and this was the most enjoyable stay we have had. We will be returning next year to celebrate my Birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best Paris has to offer.”
Reviews.Author: LondonBusinessAgent
Reviews.Content: As a Platinim IC Hotels card holder, as well as a business travel agent, I have stayed in more than a few hotels in my time. After a while, one hotel room becomes the same as another. The never-ending passage of beige, blonde wood and pay per view... Then comes along Le Grand.... The reason for my stay was my fathers 60th. I had flown my parents from Australia to Paris for a small birthday treat. I had not stayed at Le Grand before and was hoping for something special - this is exactle what I recieved. The Lobby is somewhat understated so I was rather nervous while ascending the elevator to the sixth floor... Were the rooms I had booked going to be the special treat I had wished for my parents? Card inserted, green light flashing I opened the door...... As the door swung open, a feat for all the senses ws revealed. Plush carpet that matched the embroided feature pillows on a bed that begged to be slept in. Period french furniture, view to kill for, spotless and scented by fresh floweres. The sight of the room alone reduced my mother to tears... Le Grand had managed to provide the exact experience I had wanted for this special occasion. Although my parents are from rural Australia and are not that cultured or experienced in the finer hotels of the world, with my work I have seen my fair share......On this occasion, Yes... I know where she was coming from - THE ROOM WAS THAT GOOD!!! (note - we had been upgraded to a higher catagory than the entry level rooms) The hotel had also provided cake and wine (with pre notice) and a hand written birthday greeting for my father and welcome message for my mother from the hotel manager. Although I have stayed at several of the 'finer' hotels in Paris before - the Scribe, Hotel de Lourve, Westminster, Sofitel etc etc.. I shall not be staying with them any more. This is not because I have had a bad experience or have a single bad thing to say about any of them - they have all been lovely!! However my last stay with Le Grand has been so exceptional in every way that I have no want to ever stay anywhere else in Paris ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lauren_NYNY
Reviews.Content: After spending the week in the french countryside, my boyfriend and I returned to Paris to spend our last night at the Intercontinental before returning home to New York. Upon our arrival, the bellman took great care of us and was tremendously helpful with all our bags - we had a lot for only two people. Once inside the hotel, the entry was lovely, beautifully adorned with colossal cymbidium flower arrangements. Its opulence was rather gracious and not overdone. There was a large atrium just beyond the reception that was particularly inviting - a comfy sitting area to relax in that was flooded with light. Checking in was simple, however, the receptionist was a bit stuffy and not overly accommodating, not particularly the greeting we were looking for or expecting from a hotel of this caliber. The rooms were decent sized, however, the beds were only queen size - I know this may seem like a trivial complaint, but in all seriousness, wouldn't you rather have one less nightstand to accomodate the bigger bed. The location of the hotel in my opinion was not particulary interesting. The area was very touristy and obviously catered to out-of-towners. I prefer the Latin Quarter for a little more flavor and character, but the location was still convenient to many of Paris' famous attractions. Overall, it was a nice, elegant hotel. Front desk service could have been better, but it didn't ruin our experience. I've had better experiences and worse at this type of hotel, so my opinion is somewhat neutral.

Reviews.Title: “Well located if pricey”
Reviews.Author: Andy Hayler
Reviews.Content: Rue Scribe is just yards from the Opera, so this is about as good a location as one could wish for. The hotel has an attractive central courtyard bar covered with a very large skylight, which is nice for a summer drink whatever the weather. Rooms are a little small given the price (we paid EUR 330 a night via the internet, v a rack rate of over EUR 600) , and I found the bed a bit hard. A "queen size" bed must have been for a very small queen, as it seemed exactly like a 4 and a half foot double bed to me. Staff were unusually friendly for Paris. Breakfast is a ludicrous 45 euros, but Fauchon is just a short walk away. I preferred what is now the Westin on Rue Castiglione.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlNY07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our anniversary trip to Paris where we stayed at Le Grand Hotel InterContinental Paris. We could not have been more pleased with the hotel and its location. We walked EVERYWHERE! It was such a pleasure. The opera house was right around the corner (literally) from the hotel. And it was a 15 minute walk to the Louvre, a 20-25 minute walk to the eiffel tower and 10 minutes to the Champs Elysee and Avenue Montaigne. The Opera area itself was very lovely - filled with great little bistros, night life if you want it and shopping. The concierge was very helpful in pointing out places to go and things to see. We did find however the reception staff to be either very new or simply not trained well enough. We had booked a standard room. Upon our arrival, the receptionist informed us that the standard room was "rather small" and perhaps we would be interested in upgrading to a larger "executive room" for 60 Euros a night. Seeing as this was a special trip we thought why not. But what bothered us was that after saying that our room was too small she couldn't find the larger room at first. It also bothered us that after spending money on a nice hotel and telling them it was a special occaision that they could not be more accomodating with the rooms. Finally, by chance we checked our credit card statement online only to find over $3000.00 charged by the hotel!! My husband went downstairs to inquire and the best answer we got was "we have no idea how that happened". It was taken care of immediately but not something that inspires confidence while abroad on vacation. The overall experience was EXTREMELY positive. The room was fantastic and clean and the cleaning staff were phenomenal. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It was very spacious and the hotel has recently gone through a renovation so everything has been updated. I defintely looked forward to going back to the room at the end of the day. I did not eat in the hotel itself but we did eat in Cafe de la Paix which I believe is the hotel's. It was pricey (very) but delicious and the service was impecable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Chain Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JChua
Reviews.Content: I for one, would avoid staying at chain hotels where possible. But the Hotel Paris Le-Grand is definitely an exception to the rule. We (my mum and I) stayed at this beautiful Hotel from 30 April to 02 May for 2 nights, in an Executive room. When visiting any European cities, I would always try to stay at different hotels so as to experience different parts of the city. But then again, this Hotel is an exception to the rule - whenever I return to Paris, I would seriously consider staying at this Hotel, again and again! As requested, we were given a high floor (4th floor) room, far from the elevator. However, our request for an Opera view room were not met with, unless we paid 30 euros extra per night. The room was extremely spacious, and sumptously decorated! However, the WC was separate from the bathroom and there wasn't a wash basin nor a mirror in the WC. As the name of the Hotel implies, this is indeed a Grand Parisian hotel - the common areas, the Cafe, the Restaurant, the Salon Opera (from the website's picture, I initially thought this Salon was in a different location, not belonging to the Hotel but boy, I was so wrong .....stood there with my mum, in awe of the grandeur of the Salon!), the nicely carpeted room corridoors , oil paintings, etc etc. Breakfast was a whopping 45 euros per person, so we gave it a miss since we were not breakfast people. But the plus points of staying here are the nearby great departmental stores like Galaries Lafayette and Printemps, easy access to the Roissy Bus to and fro the CDG airport, Metro station, Opera Garnier, Gare du Nord for a day trip to London, cafes, restaurants, even Montmarte (not too far away). After staying at different hotels in different parts of Paris, I have finally found my dream Paris Hotel. Trust me, stay here if you can (book at least 2-3 weeks before arrival on their website to enjoy special savings!)

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Niffer56
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing..couldn't ask for anything for more. Good stay all around. Very clean, good location. Absolutely perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Large, Comfortable, and Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: Monterone
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised by some of the negative comments regarding the service at this hotel. In general, I found the staff to be exceptionally friendly, competent, and professional -- probably the best hotel service I've ever experienced in Paris, after a number of stays at other hotels, both large and small. I stayed for six nights with my wife and 2-year-old son, and the bell staff would always leap at the chance to help us with our bags or our stroller going up or down the stairs, and they always did so with a smile. In addition, the concierge was very efficient and humorous -- helped us out greatly with making babysitting arrangements and confirming dinner reservations. It's true that babysitting services are expensive at the hotel (25 Euros per hour plus tip) but that seems to be the going rate at the 4-star hotels in Paris. The one exception to the general friendliness I encountered was with the staff at the spa, who seemed rather cold and indifferent. We stayed in a junior suite, which was not huge -- basically, two small rooms separated by a double door -- but more than enough for a couple with a young kid. It was nicely furnished and well maintained. In fact, the housekeeping was so swift that we never saw them, even though our room was always cleaned as soon as we got back from either breakfast or lunch. We got a decent deal on the rate -- 330 Euros per day (including access to the "Club" for part of our stay), which is certainly not cheap, but pretty good for what you can get in Paris. I agree with those reviewers who recommend access to the Club room, which was very comfortable. They kept the breakfast buffet out until noon (great for our first couple of days when we were jet-lagged and would sleep until past 10am), and then the afternoon and evening drinks and snacks were also nice. Our two-year-old loved relaxing in the big chairs with milk and cookies in the evening. My only disappointment was that we were only able to use the club for three out of our six nights because JP Morgan had somehow managed to reserve the club (as well as a huge chunk of the hotel) for its own private function for the other three nights. That was somewhat annoying. The fitness room had four treadmills, one stair-stepper, one elliptical trainer, and one stationary bicycle, all relatively new, so it was OK for cardio. Unfortunately, the weight selection was weak -- just a few dumbbells -- so it was not a good option for strength training. At least there was always bottled water, juice, and a lot of fresh fruit on hand. Did not get a chance to eat at Cafe de la Paix this time, but we had been there years before (before the renovation) and had enjoyed it. Now, post-renovation, the interior looks beautiful, with high prices on the menu to match! The main reason we stayed at Le Grand was the excellent location right next to the Opera Garnier. Perfect for shopping at the big department stores, metro access, and walking to nearby monuments, museums (esp. Louvre and Orangerie), and the Tuileries Gardens. After having tried a number of different hotels in Paris, this one is both my and my wife's favorite, and we won't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, poor service”
Reviews.Author: JT14
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the past 18 months, once on business, once with my (young) family. The refurbishment is impressive, although starting to look scuffed earlier than it should. The rooms are excellent and large for Paris. The rates are reasonable for the room quality you get. BUT.... The service is terrible. Every aspect - queues to check in, poorly trained staff who don't seem to know how to work the computer, doormen who just stood and watched as my wife struggled out of a taxi with 3 children under age 5. I wouldn't accept this at any hotel, quite apart from one has Le Grand's pretensions. My impression is that the hotel management needs a shake-up. As you would expect, this leaves a rather nasty aftertaste. All the extras are priced at the very highest level for Paris (e.g 3 hours of babysitting is €90) which is just not acceptable when it is delivered this sourly. So, if you plan to just use the room and can put up with very bad service, it's one of the best rooms for the price. Otherwise, pay a bit more, go to the George V and get proper service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but ???”
Reviews.Author: JacksonNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Arrived early 10am but was pleasantly surprised to find our room was available. We are at Platinum Elite Ambassador Level, but did not receive an upgrade and hotel staff did not appear to know what that level was. Our room was a classic room (very small) but overlooking the Opera House which is quite spectacular, especially at night with the lights. The bathroom was quite small, but the shower was abysmal. The showerhead squirted water all over the bathroom and we had to put towels on the floor to soak up the water when finished in the shower. Coming from the US, where non-smoking is everywhere it is quite unpleasant to have cigar and cigarettes always around you in cafes, bars and restaurants, but that's the way in France. The service was great in the Cafe/Restaurant attached to the hotel, but the bar and coffee area leaves something to be desired. You had to attract the attention of the wait staff and even when they acknowledged you, you waited. We ate in the Cafe on the first night and the food was superb. We would have to rate it as one of our top meals. The interior of the hotel is quite attractive and very clean and sparkling. We ordered a very late room-service and it was very prompt. Arriving in less than 15 minutes and very well presented. The hotel is in the heart of the shopping district and easy walking to most tourist attractions. I would stay here again, but book a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic Property”
Reviews.Author: olisonic
Reviews.Content: Le Grand is a beautiful hotel in a central location. The rooms are all tasteful and richly decorated. I had a view of the Opera house which is an absolute must in my opinion. It really looks incredible at night. I think for the price and value for money, this is the best hotel in Paris; to get a better hotel you really are shelling out some serious money; think 500 Euros plus a night for only a basic room; at Le Grand you can get a Junior Suite, probably around 40 sqm for the price. I would recommend getting a Club room which has access to the Club lounge. The lounge is a oasis of calm and overlooks the Opera; it is pure Paris. Food wise I was not particularly impressed and have eaten in the restaurant on two occassions (two separate stays). As you can imagine it was fairly expensive but not thrilling; moreover, the young man serving me knew nothing about wine when I complained it was corked; however, the bottle was replaced. Breakfast was better; the hotel tries to cater for all nationalities; Asian guests, for example, can eat food local to their our country. Overall, although I had one or two niggles about the quality of service, I would definitely return to Le Grand. Why? It is in an incredible location (remember the Opera view tip) and represents good value for money in the luxury hotel market. Moreover, the rooms really are beautiful, with rich fabrics and Empire style furniture. If considering a romantic visit to Paris with your partner, I think this hotel is worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: travelerfromCA,usa
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Intercontinental. We had an "Opera View Room" and it was very large. The only complaint is that the toilet was in a separate room from the sink, shower, and tub. So after using the toilet, one had to walk around the room and go into the bathroom to wash one's hands. The bed was nice and firm with down comforters and down pillows. The bathroom was nicely decorated with travertine and marble. The lobby and restaurant areas are very nice. Included in our room rate was the buffet breakfast. The breakfast was delicious and included eggs, bacon, sausage, crepes, cereals, fruit, cheeses, sliced meats, croissants and other fabulous French pastries. There was also a Japanese breakfast available at the buffet. We would definitely stay here again. Staff was friendly and everyone seemed to speak English. Room service is great...the soups are fantastic! They have this incredible shell fish platter for dinner. It's huge! Sitting in Cafe de la Paix is an enjoyable experience watching the world go by. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: larover
Reviews.Content: Just as its name implies this is a grand hotel that has undergone major renovations and it shows. Very nice common areas and beautiful lobby/bar area. We had a superior room with a king size bed. The room itself was quite small but very well appointed. Comfortable beds although not as good as Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons but hotel is not as expensive. The windows were great and cut out all the street noise. Bathroom was quite large but only a single sink. I would have preferred a smaller bathroom and more space in the room but overall the room was quite nice. Our room was not ready when we arrived and we were given a voucher for a glass of wine or champagne or coffee at the bar which was a nice touch. Prices of incidentals are very high……a can of diet coke through room service was 11 euros. There was room in the mini bar for our own items…..not much room but some which was nice. We had breakfast included in our rate and I would recommend that. The buffet at Café De La Paix is quite nice and comprehensive and a beautiful Café. Staff were all incredibly helpful. This is not my favorite part of Paris as I find it too touristy and I prefer the 7th androissment as it is quiet and not nearly as touristy. I also prefer boutique hotels when I am in Paris. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel if you want a top notch environment in a large hotel setting with a very helpful staff in the 8th androissment. The room rates are pricey but not that pricey compared to the other top Paris Hotels in its class. I would stay here again. By the way there is a Roissy bus right across the street (diagonally across) that runs every 15 minutes to the airport at a minimal cost of 8 euros. To me that makes a car service unnecessary.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good”
Reviews.Author: RJB
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay here in 4 years. It is truly an outstanding property - the refurbishment was total and the interiors, both in the public areas and the rooms, is outstanding. The standard (Classic) rooms are very small, I admit, but on this stay I had a large Junior Suite with a superb view of the opera house which was perfect. It is worth considering a Club room as it is one of the best I have ever used - a decent breakfast and evening spread, with unlimited champagne flowing all evening. The club is on 2 levels and has more than enough space, including sofas, plus newspapers, books and 2 free internet PC's. For leisure, the location is ideal - literally 2 minutes to Gallerie Lafeyette and Printempts, and a short stroll down to the Louvre, Champs Elysees etc. Highly recommended if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve at the Le Grand”
Reviews.Author: HolyBoy
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Le Grand is conveniently located in the Opera distict, very close to the Place Concorde, Rue Faubourg Honore, Champs Elysees etc. The hotel was recently beautifully refurbished and remodelled and surely is one of the most beautiful and luxurious hotels in Paris. I booked a classic room and being IC Ambassador, I was told I was upgraded. I did not believe this first as the room I was given was very small, but then, passing the corridor, I took look in another room and it was really even smaller so it seems I really received an upgrade. The size is the only complaint about the room, as otherwise it was very cozy, comfortable, beautifully decorated, quiet and spotlessly clean. The rooms of the lower categories are sufficient for shorter stays, however if you plan an extended stay or want to receive guests in the hotel, I would recommend booking at least a Junior Suite or better. I had access to the Club lounge and it was very pleasant place, on 2 levels, with breakfasts, drinks, Moet champagne, snacks and internet access included. The staff overall is efficient, pleasant and helpful however as the hotel has near to 500 rooms, the service lacks the personal touch. The service in the Bar was a bit slow as well but that was the only complaint I could make regarding staff/service during the whole stay. The gym is also a bit small, just with the basic equipment and there is no swimming pool or whirlpool in the hotel. Despite the rooms being on the smaller side, I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a really deluxe, centrally located Paris hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Umm, this is it?”
Reviews.Author: kconsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in November. I used my American Airlines miles for this stay and used extra points for a room upgrade to a deluxe suite. I had contacted the hotel for early arrival and was told noon would be ok. Most people from the States fly overnight flights and arrive early in the a.m. to European destinations, so the check in time of 2:30 isn't terribly convenient when you've been on an international flight and have 6 hours to kill before you can check into your hotel. I arrived at noon and was told the room wasn't ready, to come back at 2:30 or 3:00. We dined at the seriously understaffed Café de la Paix and came back at 3:30. It STILL wasn't ready- and yes, that was how long lunch was. Finally, 30 minutes later, we were given a room that was supposed to be a upgraded suite and I am positive that it was not. Tired at this point, we didn't complain, we went to sleep. An hour later, we were awoken by someone coming into our room. Hours later I would realize it was someone bringing welcome treats, but they weren't left and they didn't come back. The room was nice- for a standard room at a five star hotel. I just think that the staff could be more accomodating and be of a higher standard than your average hotel. This is a major hotel in one of the most beautiful and visited cities in world. Great location and of course the hotel was very beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and stay”
Reviews.Author: JustVacationing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Le Grand Intercontinental Hotel from 11/24/2006 - 11/29/2006. I had heard from past reviews that the hotel recently completed a renovation - and it shows! The hotel is absolutely beautiful inside. Dark wood, and marble everywhere. The atrium, located off the reception area is quite grand indeed with an iron and glass ceiling. The hotel's old world grandeur is exactly what we wanted. It's perfect for couples, honeymooners and business travelers. (I'm not so certain it would be a good place for children). Our room was located on the fifth floor, and I was told at check-in that they upgraded us to a slightly better room. Our room was excellent for European standards - meaning it was smaller than what one would expect in America, but certainly larger than most European hotel rooms. It was very updated, with a good bed, great linens, and small but very modern bathroom. The closet was small. Our room also has a small balcony overlooking the street below. We could see the Eiffel Town in the distance. Overall it met our expectations and we would welcome a stay there in the future. One note - prices for everything at this hotel are EXPENSIVE. Internet access in your room will cost more than $25 USD per day for example. I would recommend using the business center if you need to check email as they will sell you access cards to their computers at a rate of 6 euros for 15 minutes. One ticket lasted us our entire trip. Also, think about purchasing a calling card in the states with a local Paris access number if you plan on making calls from the hotel back home.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Cachet”
Reviews.Author: omegaet
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed five incredible nights at the Le Grand Hotel InterContinental Paris….the structure dating back to the 1800s but the recent renovation has incorporated all of the high tech in-room services, including flat screen monitors for TV and Internet access. We stayed in a spacious junior suite on the fifth floor with views of the Opera House. Paid extra for access to the VIP Club….worth the extra Euros. Geoffrey, and his staff, sees to the hospitality needs of the guests, with attentive but unobtrusive service. Our morning omelets were done to perfection and our champagne flutes never seemed to empty during cocktail hours and for night caps! With a Meto entrance right by the main door, the Le Grand makes for a perfect location for seeing all of the sites and good times Paris has to offer. Yes, there are less expensive hotels in Paris….but why not live a little and enjoy the good life!

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: Stephlovestravel
Reviews.Content: Paris is one of those citites where I can never seem to find a great hotel. Finally, I have found one! HURRAH! I arrived @ 10am and was immediately shown to my room. There was no wait @ check-in and my luggage was brought up 10 minutes later. The room was large and very comfortable. The bathroom was huge and I loved all of the amenities. The hotel is so centrally located that we could be anywhere in Paris in a few minutes. The concierge arranged several dinners for us and helped us some other things too. The lobby was beautiful and I adored the piano player in the bar at night. We will stay here again easily.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: davidf37
Reviews.Content: Cashed in my AMEX membership rewards to stay here and was upgraded to a suite with a view of the Opera which incuded a terrace. Most beautiful room I have ever stayed in (and I've had the pleasure of staying in a Four Seasons). Did not have a single issue while there so I could not speak to the service level of the hotel. However, the hotel itself is absolutely opulent. My rview might be biased by the fact I stayed at the Louvre Sainte Anne prior to moving to the Le Grand and the difference was night and day.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Location in Paris, WOW”
Reviews.Author: sfcafox
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a great location near major shopping and the Opera of Paris. I would highly recommend this hotel. The ballroom with the amazing chandelier is probably the largest chandelier I've ever seen. I heard one man rented the ballroom out and proposed to his girlfriend under the chandelier, the two of them completely alone in the room. WOW. Located near Champs Elysses and Galleries Lafayette shopping areas. A 10 minute walk to the Louvre from this hotel. It's just beautiful but very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: ivo_k
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed in Intercontinental Paris Le Grand Hotel for 5 nights from 27th October 2006. The hotel is recently entirely refurbished and it is very beautiful. Green polished granite stone all over the place, plush carpet and nice wood. The room we stayed is deluxe room with Opera view. The room is spacious for Paris standards (35 sq.m) really nice with very convenient bed and marble bathroom. The amenities are nice and the toiletries are from L’Occitane. So far so good. It is a shame that such a nice place (location, history, money invested in the new place) have SUCH A TERRIBLE SERVICE! Starting with the check-in. The check-in personnel are much less than it should be and this creates a huge queue ate the check-in counter. It took half an hour to check in and we were just the second couple at the queue. Then the receptionist asks me “did we need a help with our luggage” and with the answer “yes” the story began. From 7 to 8 pm i had to wait for my luggage in the room. It took more than one hour for the bell boy to bring my luggage to the room. During that time I called 3 times the “instant service”, I went down to the reception at 7.30 to ask them where the hell is my luggage, since I have a meeting at 7.30pm and my girlfriend and myself were needing my clothes. The receptionist told me the luggage is on the way up in the elevator and should be in our room any second. After apologizing to my partners about the delay, I went up in the room and after another 15 minutes without my luggage arriving, I start calling the guest service manager. The lady named Ann (guest service) told me that the luggage is on the way and will be there in 3 minutes. I told her that I’m listening this story already 45 minutes, and let they tell me where is my luggage, so I can really go and take it myself. After 2 more phone calls on a very high tone with the guest relations manager, the luggages arrive in about 8 pm. That entire event made mine and my girlfriend evening really dead. That is not the service from 5 star hotel. Absolutely not. 3 days later we received a half of bottle of wine and some sweets from the guest relationship officer Ann, and that was at least some gesture of good will, but it can not clear even half the awful experience we had. Also the housekeeping is not in due course. They have regularly forgotten cleaning liquids in the room, glasses were left dirty and not properly changes and so on. The hotel is quite noisy, because of its location, and you'll feel the underground trains passing by. We felt them on the 3rd floor, so I can imagine what the feeling on the 1st floor is. We have booked a king size bed and we got a one bed with 2 matrices, but that is not king bed. It seems that there is a big mess with the assignment of the rooms and during our check-in there you can hear many unhappy customers with rooms’ problems. Café de la Paix is also in my opinion understaffed and the service is bad, especially at lunchtime, where there are many visibly empty tables, but the receptionist says that there are no available tables. That is simple example of lack of personnel to clean the tables. Overall, It is a shame for Intercontinental to have such a wonderful hotel WITH SUCH A BAD SERVICE. I would not be back in that hotel, and I’m sorry that we have fully prepaid our stay because I would change the hotel, even if we had to pay more in the other place.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning architecture, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Marge246
Reviews.Content: This hotel, with its storied past and magnificent architecture mirroring the Garnier Opera across the street, has just undergone a serious renovation and is working hard to regain its place among Paris' palace hotels. I traveled to the Le Grand on business and two days of personal time during fashion week and the auto show - a crazy time in Paris. U.S. visitors who don't speak French will be happy to note that the staff almost universally speak English. Reception and Cafe de la Paix staff were friendly and efficient, and the bellmen went out of their way to remember me and help me with a lot of special requests on my departure date. Travelers from the U.S. take note - the check in time is real; many of our group arrived early in the morning, and the hotel's full occupancy meant that they waited several hours for their rooms until the afternoon check in time. This is not unreasonable for a full hotel, so plan accordingly. The sumptuous, 19th century public spaces make for a scenic wait. If you have a chance and the room isn't occupied, peek into the Salon Opera, a 19th century gorgeous marvel. Breakfast buffet, though pricey, is a relief to carnivores who require protien, and not just a croissant, to start their day. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of all major Paris sights as well as shopping and on a main metro line - it is the most conveniently located hotel I have stayed at in Paris. The gourmet havens at the Place de la Madeline are only a five minute walk away, and if you just can't adjust to French coffee, there's a nearby Starbucks. Room amenities include L'Occitane toiletries and outstanding beds with big eiderdown comforters and lots of pillows. All technology is up-to-date, including flat-screen plasma TV's that have a wake-up function. The only peculiar feature was that the room did not include a clock, although you can use your TV. Plenty of outlets and blessing of blessings, operable windows to let in fresh air. Staff never once messed up my wake up call. The only negative I can report is the icy interchange with the concierge, but in a week's worth of contact with many staff, it was the exception, not the rule. The cafe hostess remembered me, and most of the staff were openly friendly - not typical among the Parisian service culture. If you are enamored with the hotel, there is a large, coffee table book available that covers its history in high fashion and with notable famous guests.

Reviews.Title: “I can't Breath in this place! Worst / Rudest front desk ever”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnobs
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thinking it was a deal for a 5 star hotel in Paris. Even at $750 a night after taxes (opera view room, NOT WORTH IT, the view is horrible, its too close) etc the room was disgusting. All the rooms are smoking in the whole hotel, despite booking directly with intercontinental they neglected to inform me and made it sound like there was such a room. To "transform" a room into a non-smoking room they spray it down with a lung killing toxic chemical to kill the smell. Trust me this chemical is worse than the tar/smoke. I had house keeping hand me the bottle and it even had English stating "do not breath or use in an unventilated area". The first night I woke up with a bloody nose and pain in my lungs, but that's getting ahead of myself. The hotel was full when I arrived at 3pm and was told completely rudely to come back at 4 for my room. (I really had to use the bathroom and have a thing about public toilets) We went and grabbed lunch and returned around 4ish and the room was still not ready and they were rude as can be. I guess when your hotel is constantly full it might as well be a 1 star. Forget even a star, you'd get better service on a park bench. I should have boalted at the first bit of rudeness, I definitely should have split on the second, but we only had 2 days in Paris and the clock was ticking so we stuck it out foolishly. This is the last hotel on earth you should stay at. I stayed at the Carlton in Cannes and it was very nice, but again the concerige was an(--). Intercontinental has to get it's act together. I'm boycotting them all together.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for our first Paris trip.”
Reviews.Author: Trvlgrl31
Reviews.Content: Got a steal of a deal on Priceline.. I believe it was $231/night. This hotel was right in the middle of everywhere we needed to go. Usually we stay at places with a little more local flavor, but for our first time we wanted a clean, comfortable safe haven... Just in case. The service wasn't the best, but our room was wonderful and we had a great view. We were celebrating our 1st Year Anniversary. The room was very large for Parisian standards. Clean, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was clean. But as mentioned before, the showers are interesting, but we managed. Just don't stay in there too long, or the water will overflow the little basin on the ground and into the bathroom. There was a safe in our room and a mini fridge. Just remember, you are in FRANCE... and things don't move very fast here. So don't be surprised if your room is not ready when you arrive. Just sit downstairs in the beautiful atrium/cafe and have a glass of champagne.

Reviews.Title: “A grand place!”
Reviews.Author: Seckel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights as a member of a group of 12 other people visiting Paris for the Biennale Antiques Show. I thought the hotel was very beautiful, immaculate and up to date in every way. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in - and we have been traveling for over forty years -, the room very quiet and clean. The lobby, bar and Cafe de la Paix are gorgeous, with plenty of space and delicious, albeit pricy, food. The hotel is centrally located, just across the street from the Paris Opera Garnier, 2 minutes from the Galeries Lafayette and Au Printemps, the two biggest department stores in Paris. The metro, the Louvre, the Rue St. Honore are within walking distance. I was pleasantly surprised with this huge hotel that I have seen, but never been in before, for many years. The hotel is very large indeed; you will need a long walk to your room. The rooms, for the most part are extremely small, as are the bathrooms. The bath tub and shower were very tiny, with a propensity to scatter water all over the (marble=slippery) floor. Even the soap was miniscule. Closet space was small, even for one person. I can't imagine two people staying in the room for much longer than one night. With the exception of the business center, which charged 12 Euros per half hour to use the computer, but had an excellent and efficient staff, the rest of the staff was rather impersonal and indifferent: civil, but not inclined to go out of their way for anyone. I guess one could say "impersonal, but impressive" to sum up the hotel. On the whole, I thought this a good, but expensive, choice for group travelers or business people: just bring your laptop and be prepared to navigate the very long hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: onlyGeorgeVwilldo
Reviews.Content: It is not easy to judge this hotel. It is imposing, has a lot of character, it is beautiful and offers all the amenities you expect in a large hotel. It has a great location, but then there many more in the area to choose from. Some rooms are large, but some are small, for the same price; they are well equipped and decorated. The hotel is noisy, because of its location, and you'll feel the underground trains passing by. The main hall looks stunning, but the stench of cigarette smoke never leaves. The big disappointment was management. They messed up our credit card and they were unwilling to do anything about it. The breakfast buffet is good, but pricey at 35.- Euros a person; however kids enjoyed breakfasts at no charge. Beware of phone charges: they are simply outrageous. Roaming with your cell phone is cheaper. In the end it was less than perfect, which is what we expect from a hotel in this price class. We'll try another one next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, cannot fault it.”
Reviews.Author: mclachlan4321
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for a business trip. Cannot fault the place. I stayed in a Superior room, which, whilst ti was close to the elevators, and you could hear them, it was still very peaceful. Excellent bathroom, excellent tv and mini bar, and generally a good hotel. THe location is perfect, right near the Opera metro station, a major metro hub in the city, Gallieries Lafayette etc etc. The restaurant was also very good. Itis expensive, but this is a capital city where everything is expensive. If you have to stay in Paris, and can afford this hotel, go hear.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bluenoser11111
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, lovely room, small in comparison to North American standards, but still very nice. The bed is very comfortable, pillows heavenly (we slept well each night). The decor is incredible, the hotel location is ideal and central to the metro and tourist attractions. Any small concern we had was addressed quickly, efficiently and professionally with follow-up - wow. Now, that's service! I read recent reviews and yes, the shower is not exactly inviting. It was a bit of a challenge - from the poor water pressure from the shower head, to the half shower door - quite honestly, every morning, I dreaded this process. I was surprised that they didn't have a deluxe rain shower and a full-fledged shower door, but perhaps this was part of the design......? After each shower, there wa a bit of water spillage on the floor, but nothing too serious. The cleaning staff made the room up perfect each day, so there was never a worry. The amenties provided in the room were very nice - Molton Brown products from the neighboring "Old England" store next to the hotel. The only negative that my husband was upset about was the fact that there was no bedside radio in the room. If you wanted a radio or music, you can access it on your wide screen bedroom TV, but at a cost. We didn't sign up for the music service, but certainly missed this bedroom standard during our stay. Other than that - the staff were amazing (the concierge staff were extremely helpful and gave us some wonderful restaurant recommendations and directions to get around town during our stay) - the lobby was spectacular, the service incredible, etc, etc. It is one of the finest hotels in the city of Paris and we were thrilled to have enjoyed this experience! Review from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good But Some Tips If You Are Considering”
Reviews.Author: Lily034
Reviews.Content: The Pros: This is a lovely clean hotel with amenities that you want when staying at an expensive hotel. The room had internet access and the right adapter for any of your non-european appliances or electonics. Funny enough, the adapter is kept in the mini-bar and they forget to mention this when you check in. The location cannot be beat. The hotel is right outside the Opera metro stop (which is a hub metro stop where you can catch lots of other lines) and you are centrally located to almost all of Paris. Overall, the staff is friendly, courteous and knowledgable. The Cons: The hotel is very large and when you go up to the floor where your room is located you might feel as if you are staying at a convention hotel. Our room was facing the Opera Garnier (the best view and side of the hotel- which I highly recommend), however, when you get off the elevator be prepared for a hike to your room. It can feel like a overwhelming walk especially after a long day of walking and sightseeing in the city. Like all Eurpoean hotels, you must remember certain translations problems. When you say 2 beds, this can translate into one big bed with one headboard but two separate mattresses (see picture). When you say a big room, this can translate into a room with no sitting area, one big bed that you can get out of without hitting the wall next to you and a tiny closet for 2 people. Our room was one of the better rooms with balconys off the bedroom and bathroom looking at the Opera Garnier but still felt very small. When I asked the front desk about it they said it was the top floor and the ceiling sloped so it probably felt smaller. Clearly, they just don't have the same definition of big. The shower - OK we all know how this works in Europe. Can someone please tell me how that silly glass half door is supposed to keep the shower water in the tub versus on the floor of the bathroom??!! (see picture) The hand held shower does not make this any better because the shower door moves off the tub if you hit it with your arm (which you will do) and the water bounces off the tub onto the floor. I always needed at least 2 big towels to take a shower, one for me, one for the floor. The hairdryer. You have to hold down the button while you blow dry your hair or it stops. I think for this level of hotel they can do better. The price - this is a very expensive hotel. For the space you get, in your room, you must adjust your expectation level or you will be disappointed. Definitety have your meals outside the hotel. There is a great little cafe near the hotel - come out the main entrance make a left and then your first right. You will see it off on its own across the street. It is lovely and reasonable. Also, "Paul" is a chain of high quality sandwiches and pasteries. There are several in the area and great for a quick bite. I loved the sandwiches and the pistachio macaroon!

Reviews.Title: “San Diegan Honeymooners in Paris”
Reviews.Author: superdeejayanna
Reviews.Content: We spent eight days at Le Grand Hotel in July and it was a beautiful hotel. We stayed on the 3rd floor Club Level in an Executive Room - which was nice, but smaller than I expected, but it is Paris. The A/C was awesome and it made coming back between rendez-vous's to the hotel a true pleasure. The king size bed was wonderful, it was so hard to wake-up! *TIP:Paying extra for the Club level benefits were worth it due to the luxurious Club Lounge on the 5th floor that offered free breakfast, afternoon/evening snacks, champagne, espresso drinks, internet and a beautiful view of the Opera. It was the perfect place to go when we were hungry or thirsty between meals. PROS: Beautiful building, wonderful bed, perfect location. The Concierges were great about getting us reservations at all the restaurants we wanted and they made great recommendations as well. The breakfast buffet at Cafe de la Paix is awesome, though slightly pricey. The air conditioning! Apparently many hotels do not have it, it was hot and we needed it. CONS: Front desk staff were surly at times, particularly during a frustrating exchange concerning my credit card, where they had me trekking all the way across the lobby and back three times to the payphone to call my company- because "we do not have a phone here". Really? What is that you were just talking on? All the while, a large line of people were lining up behind us and seemed pretty pissed off. Also, we had the maid bust in every morning even though we had the Do Not Disturb sign up. And then they would call an hour later asking when we would wake up! We were jet-lagged, jeez, let us sleep Overall, a great hotel, and definitely the most "affordable" of the Parisien luxury hotels I researched, but maybe there is a reason for that...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful But...”
Reviews.Author: BeccaGrim
Reviews.Content: My husband I have just returned from a ten day tour that took us to both Paris and London. We had a wonderful time. Our first look at the Le Grand Hotel InterContinental Paris were breathtaking. Really, I have been all over and never seen a lobby quite so beautiful. The front desk staff was lovely and very apologetic that we were going to have to wait at least an hour and a half to check in (we got there after our flight from the States at 1 PM and there check in was 2..the room was not ready until 2:30) and they paid for a drink at the bar. They were friendly and helpful and the concierge confrimed all of our dinner reservations while we waited. However, the room itself was quirky. We had booked a room with a view and instead got one with a view of the other side of the hotel. The room seemed small and the bathtub/shower was problematic. It was broken when we got there (they had to call maintance to come immediately and fix it, which to their credit they did do) and standing in the shower, it is impossible to stay under the spray without closing the drain on the bathtub so by the end of the shower, the tub is full. Our wake up calls were sporadic-coming sometimes ten minutes late or two hours early and they were very sorry about that. The safe broke twice. All in all, it was a very pleasant stay at the hotel but I'm not sure I would stay there again. To me, the exterior and interior of the lobby does not make up for problems with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, we had a great time”
Reviews.Author: adn1966
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris for three days and chose the Intercontinental after having read most of the reviews on tripadvisor. The hotel is magnificent, the lobby, bar and cafe deserve the term "breathtaking". The rooms are small (which is a Paris standard, obviously), but clean and very beautifully furnished. The service is good, as is the opulent breakfast in the incredible "cafe de paix". It is a bit pricey, but again, that's Paris standard. The location is excellent, the airport bus and the metro station is just around the corner. Also, a lot of nice shopping areas and sights are within walking distance. We can absolutely recommend this hotel for a nice, luxurious and romantic getaway in Paris. Norbert Adamek, Svetla Vassileva Vienna, Austria

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, opulent, and pricey”
Reviews.Author: kaceevh
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Le Grand. Very expensive hotel, but we got an upgrade to one of the large rooms on the 1st floor in the opera wing - double windows with balcony and view of the entire front side of the Opera Garnier. Comfortable beds, wonderful down comforters, big bathroom. Price quote was 900euros a night, but our room (1126) was booked through our company so we did not pay anywhere near that. Truly the heighth of luxury. Huge windows with red velvet curtains, red velvet and gold motif in room, lots of floor space with a couch and two chairs and coffee table. Others who traveled with us did not have the upgraded room however, and they complained about tiny rooms, tiny closets, and tiny bathrooms. Upgrade if you can. We thought it was worth it. We found the staff to be very cooperative and helpful, but we were a large group so I assume they were well compensated in advance. This was our 3rd trip to Paris and we had never stayed in this area before - love the Opera district! Wind your way around to L'Absinthe restaurant (make reservations unless you are going after 9pm) for excellent country french cuisine at a reasonable (for Paris!) price. Breakfast at Cafe Le Paix was amazing, but 74euros for 2 people! We would definitely stay here again, but it is truly a splurge. Shop outside the opera district however, unless you're in the market for designer and haute couture items as that is mostly what's in this distirct(try St. Germain des Pres or Le Marais for smaller stores with better prices); but we did find some reasonable prices in the Galleries Lafayette (dept. store). Didn't make it to Printemps (other dept. store) but heard it was about the same. For antiques and odds-and-ends, try La Boite a Musique at 96 rue de Bac in St. Germain des Pres - wonderful lady owns this small shop, specializing in antique music boxes, crystal, books, etc. Another odds-and-ends shop that is very, very reasonable prices is Entrez Sans Frapper at 31 rue de Bourgogne, near the Musee de Rodin.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel and we enjoyed every minute of our stay. My wife and I were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and could not have been more pleased. The staff is very professional and everyone I interacted with spoke English. We were allowed to store a few bags at the hotel while touring Provence our second week. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: rachelh9610
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel for the start of our honeymoon as it looked like a top class hotel in a fantastic location. It was both of these. The hotel architecture was truly impressive, and we had a quick peek in the ballroom, which wouldn't look out of place in stately home. The check-in lady was really pleasant, organising a "triple" upgrade as it was a special occasion, which meant we got a room overlooking the opera on the 2nd floor. This has a spectatcular view, but as others have mentioned, there were constant rumbles from the Metro below, which could be annoying on a longer stay. We decided we didn't want to indulge in the €34 breakfast, but I would like to go back sometime to sample the food. A truly magnificent hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “The Le Grand is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After much research and reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to book the Le Grand for my 9 night stay in Paris. Was very hesitant since it was a bit pricey, but did want to stay in a nice place since my stay was relatively long. The Le Grand is in a perfect location, a block from the Roissy bus from DeGaulle and near shops, the opera, and the Metro. Service was responsive and very friendly. The room itself was comfortable, very clean, 5-star in terms of marble bathroom, luxury bedding, and furnishings. The room was extremely quiet with turn-down service and Fauchon chocolates at night. The hotel was worth the price in every way! Would definately stay there again without hesitation! The decor of the public areas are also tasteful and high quality. Only drawback was the overpriced Cafe de la Paix, nice atmosphere, but like much of Paris, average food, and expensive! Do yourself a favor and treat yourself to a stay at the Le Grand!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and bad service”
Reviews.Author: JohnGoodman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel recently for 2 nights over the week-end. The hotel looks great from outside, and even better from inside - truly luxurious, even decadent ! It's a great place, but, like often happens it's ruined a bit by the staff, not always so good and welcoming as them should be. But what you can do, it's hard to find truly good servants in this days ;-) On arrival we have been assigned a "superior" room, on the second floor. This was quite a small room, all in red colours. Not that great, I have to say - too small and too red ^^. But the worst thing was that you was able to hear the traffic rumours from the street below ! Even when I have closed the windows, curtains and everything that was possible to close, the rumour was still clearly present! I have called the reception, and have asked for another room - the answer was "it's already evening, and it's very difficult for us to move you in another room" !!! And we have arrived just 10 minutes ago.... So I demanded to speak with a manager, and surprise, surprise - them found not one, but 2 rooms that we could choose from ! The very competent and nice manager arrived and showed the rooms to us - man, this rooms were all other story ! Much bigger, finished with nice yellow colours.... so we accepted one of the rooms strait away. There were no traffic rumours at all this time. The breakfast was really expensive, looked like a rip-off to us. So we used a small cafe outside - it's about 5-6 times cheaper and the food was ok. Apart from the manager, the rest of the staff looked a bit snobby to me, but I guess it's a general problem in Paris. Them forgot to give me the Ambassador gift - so I have to ask for it. The concierge directed us to a totally wrong place when I have asked him for a address of one of boutiques that I would like to visit. The volume of TV was blocked on such a low level that we had to do our best in order to be able to hear the words in the movie ( pay-per-view, them have tried to bill it to us, even if it's offered to Ambassadors ^^ ). On the departure day I have advised them that we will stay till 16.00 ( another ambassador privilege ), we went out, came back to the hotel around 14.30 - and the keys for the room did not work anymore! So I have to go down, and ask the clerk to reprogram them - not even word of apologise !!! This does not happen in other lux hotels ! So the service was not really perfect, but the hotel itself and the room was great - a truly opulent and luxurious place.Would recommend the place for a short stay in Paris, but in case I will ever come back to the town ( actually I did not liked it much, really old, bit dirty and the people seems to be a bit full of themselves ) I would try a different place - Ritz, Four Seasons and others are available ! Oh, yes - do not pay more that 250 euros a day for it, if it costs you more - there are plenty of alternatives in Paris !

Reviews.Title: “beautiful luxurious hotel, a real treat”
Reviews.Author: kitty75
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Paris for a three night stay. A romantic break for a couple with two small children, so we really wanted to treat ourselves. After looking at various hotels we decided on this one, and boy were we happy. It was absolutely fantastic. From the minute we stepped out of the taxi to our check out we had absolutely no complaints. We got a delux room on the fourth floor with a view of the opera house. Every member of staff that we met was friendly and curtious. We could have literally stayed in the hotel for the three days without leaving. We had dinner in the Cafe de la Paix one evening and it was magnificent - expensive at around 200 euro but a definate treat. We also had a few treatments in the spa which were lovely. Basically we couldn't rate the place enough. It was quiet expensive but for a treat once a year or so it was really lovely. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Uniaue experience at Intercontinental Paris Le Grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Your website is a great help for the traveller. I have followed the reviews for the Grand Hotel in Paris, most of them are excellent so I have decided to book there. The hotel is exellent ; exellent location next to the biggest shops of Paris and in the center of the city. Safe and luxuruous suroundings. The room was excellent, nice view over the Opera house, very clean, very new - so different from many other properties I have experienced in Paris..na;e sounds great but room are so poor and tired..The service was very friendly and usefull. I have to admit I hardly understand the bad comment from one of your review, this person who had a restaurant booking cancelled and mention the Cafe de la Paix as bad...it is a UNIQUE place, great service and high quality of food. I am glad I have trusted the other reviews...and wonder how you can leave such a bad review not in line at all with all the others...if this person has a problem..we should not leave such an audience which may harm the business of this hotel for no reason...hope other web user will follow most of the positive comments...they will have for sure great time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews here are on the money!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne1
Reviews.Content: I debated long and hard as to where to stay and felt this was an excellent choice. I had stayed at the "other" Intercontinental last year which has become a Westin. I booked thru the hotel web site- $387 euros for a triple. A triple was 2 super comfy twins put together but with separate down duvets and a nice size cot. I am a member of the hotels' Ambassador club ($150/year)which gets you a free weekend night stay. It was easy to use....so I paid approx $900 for 3 nights which is not bad. If the third person is over 18, they add 80 eurs/night to the fee. We did get a paper everyday, and a welcome gift- but it was a heavy glass vase with tangerines which looked nice but since there was no note, I did not know until the end when I saw a carry bag that it was designed to be taken home by club members. How many will carry a heavy glass vase ( really a tall cylinder?). There was also a 1/2 bottle of wine and 2 bottles of water. We were not escorted to our room by a "club" manager as she was "tied up" but she did leave a long message in French which we got just after settling in which I assume was meant to see if we needed anything. Here is what I found: I had access to the club floor which I found helpful since we were 3 people who wanted breakfast at different times. The food & drinks were plentiful. I learned by day 3 if you want something different- you should ask. My 14 year old wanted "cereal" but did not see it. Upon asking, it was brought to her. The club is beautiful but caterers to smokers as the second floor (smoking) is 5 times the size and has all of the couches and comfy chairs. It also has 2 high speed computers that were not very busy during our stay. They were enjoyed by my teen who loved using the instant messaging to friends back home. The lower level has the main food and a nice TV but only eating tables and chairs. I found the staff to answer questions when asked but they did not go out of their way "four seasons" style to engage you or call you by name. When I aksed the concierge at the club desk to reconfirm my Jules Verne reservation- she suggested the main concierge in the lobby do it. This distinction in service to me is what separates the Intercontinental from the other top brands. I guess I was waiting for someone to ask "how my day was" or if I needed any help before heading out. Their main function was food upkeep and keeping things tidy which may not leave them much energy for small talk. They do check you in and out and I did notice they seemed to keep track of assistance they did render to guests in a log book. Rooms: Beautifully decorated, very nice size....but in our room we had 2 window balconies covered by heavy drapes and furntiure- one in the bathroom and one in the main room. You had to move the table, slide the heavy drape and step up 1 foot to access it-very odd. Even more strange is that it appears that in the multi-million dollar renovation they replaced the toilets in the bathroom with gorgeous stall glass showers. So....where is the toilet? In a small room near the entry area- great you say? Well- it is just a toilet, no garbage can, towel rack, mirror or sink. That means if you use the toilet, you need to walk 15 feet to wash your hands. Now does that make sense? Housekeeping twice a day was nice as were the plentiful Molton Brown products, but on my first day, the room was not made up by 4pm and then on the last night I asked for turndown after 8pm and it was done by 6pm. The housekeepers, although very polite, spoke little English. The location of the hotel is amzaing- right next to the Opera House and a metro stop with access to all the major lines.
