The lobby and common areas are worthy of brides in and out all day for photo shoots. I did not see the spa and gym but saw many people in robes walking around! The main think I learned is that if you pay alot of money for your room and it is as grand as this hotel, you tend to come back a bit more and put up your feet. There are probably many hotels much less expensive that would do well as a base. If you are looking for grand luxary in an ideal location- this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris Loved Le Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: muffinSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors to Paris we were unsure of what to expect. We used the reviews on tripadvisor extensively to decide which hotels to book in Switzerland, Italy and France. Needless to say we were not disappointed. We found the Intercontinental Le Grand in Paris to be amazing. She has truly been restored to the highest standard. Reception areas, restaurants and guest rooms are exquisite. Staff is extremely friendly and helpfull and nothing was to much for the concierge desk. The breakfasts served in the Cafe de Paris is truly great with a fantastic variety to choose from. The club facilities on the 5th floor is good although I will rather not be part of this on my next stay. Although one gets good value there eg. free breakfasts, snacks, coffee and drinks, we found that you loose a lot of the ambience of the hotel reception and dining areas. Well we will definately be visiting Paris and Le Grand very soon again. Greetings from Fred, Ina and Angelique le Roux.

Reviews.Title: “Fanatstic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mrs-Scanlan
Reviews.Content: Managed to stay on the club floor which was just out of this world. Access to private dining area, which served cakes at tea time and canapes and cocktails at six! View of the Eiffel Tower and the Opera House from the large seating area. Bedroom itself was large. Bathroom complete with molton brown accessories,bathrobe and slippers. Fanatasic service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Extremely nice staff, georgous hotel, basic rooms huge, pampering! We needed a "roll a way" bed for a third person next to our king feather-topped wonderful bed. Wow, it was delux, not your average "roll a way", slept great, and we still had room to spare (rare,especially for Paris!) Wonderful bathrooms-marble, granite, deep huge tub, seperate glass shower. Great toiletries, fluffy robes, slippers,etc. Brasserie has wonderful Parisian style, and great food, and service. Very popular place to sit outside also. It's right by the Paris Opera House, wonderful location. The "Metro" is accessible accross the street. Very handy. We had a little problem with a seperate day-tour company, and our consierge went way out of his way to help us, and called the company and worked out an alternative tour, and took care of all the details. We are just average "American folks" and they treated us like "royalty". And some people say the French are nasty to Americans- we didn't find that at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great service; lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: borninthebronx
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here to bookend a trip to Nice: Dec 17-20 and 26th-28th. The staff was wonderful and we had great views and comfortable beds. The layout is bewildering, but we enjoyed the lobby and the very friendly staff. Tough to find stores to pick up food in the area (room service breakfast is exorbitant) and the resturants are dear, but that's to be expected in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: diving4gold
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and 3 children from Dec. 18th-22nd 2005. We had two delightful rooms on the 5th floor. The location of this hotel is absolutely perfect if you love to shop, just 1 block from Galleries Lafayette. The rooms are very clean and nicely appointed. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed as a business traveler Early Jan 2006. I was traveling with someone and requested 2 twin beds- it was essentially one king bed/one headboard/one set of sheets. While the room was well appointed, the toilet (sans sink) was 15 feet from the bathroom! The Molton Brown products in the bathroom were nice as well as the down comforters. It is not suited for a business traveler- the internet did not work half the time and the front desk was VERY slow to respond. It is a good location- right next to the opera. The gym was excellent- with fresh juices, towels, water bottles. Our breakfast plan was at Cafe de paix- very nice hot chocolate.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice”
Reviews.Author: JTB74
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel, and I have to say that it was not as good as it should be for a 5 stars hotel. Indeed, I think that the price is quite high, despite a good room service. I think that the junior suite was nice (nice colours, nice bed very comfortable, big bathroom and toilets in a separate room..) but sometimes, it was noisy (the noise came from the hotel, not the streets, I guess that the staff was preparing some rooms late in the night). This hotel is nice, I just think that the price of the breakfast in the Café de la Paix is too much , the food is not fantastic. I would recommend this hotel for the business travellers, not for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: kdowneymd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights at the end of November.We live right outside New York City and I was somewhat nervous in choosing the hotel given we stay at great city hotels frequently. We had a lovely room overlooking the Opera, the closet space was fine for two and the bathroom great, the bed VERY comfortable. We were in a club room on the third floor. The only complaint was when the concierge made a reservation for dinner for us and gave us the wrong address and directions and we spent 45 minutes searching in the rain only to finally return to the hotel and be re-directed. This is a great location and extremely convenient to excellent transportation and shopping. Would definitely return. The Ritz it isn't, but it is very nice hotel that doesn't bankrupt you and is a great place to stay in an elegant setting.

Reviews.Title: “Out Of This World!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beony
Reviews.Content: I took my wife for our anniversary to this Hotel. I was absolutely amazed with the lobby entrance with all the details. The concierge and the staff were outstanding. The room was out of a french movie, stunning and very clean. The restaurant in the Hotel is a must for breakfast with incredible croissants and coffee. We stayed for a week and felt so at home. The location is great and very safe. Very central and cabs readily available right up front. The double decker bus tour stop is across the street, which we highly recomend on a nice day.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: frednuff
Reviews.Content: Great location, grand entrance and halls. My room was small but well appointed with a decent bathroom. Room service food was average and so was the service. Overall a good hotel but expensive and not top rate.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first trip to Paris. We had a wonderful stay at the Intercontinental Legrand. We found the the staff to be quite friendly, especially the asst. mgr., Benjamin. A great location, close to everything. The metro is only steps away. The inside of the hotel is beautifully appointed. The rooms and especially the shower and tub area are quite small. Other than that we loved the hotel and their staff. We had read some bad reviews of the hotel on this site, so we were a bit concerned about this hotel. Rest assured, you will love your stay. P.S. Another great feature is you can take the Roissy Bus to and from the airportto the fotel for only 8 Euro. The Roissy bus stops rightacross the street at the opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Too Much”
Reviews.Author: sweetgirlSt_Louis
Reviews.Content: After a trip through Burgudy and Provence my husband and I spent one night at the Intercontinenal LeGrand upon our return to Paris. On the front end we stayed at the Intercontinental on rue de Castiglione. (Another post) However, as my husband stays at the LeGrand on business, he insisted we spend at least one night there. This hotel is great if you are on business and I can understand its appeal for that reason. However, for a vacation traveler it was not what I like in a hotel. As at the Intercontinental we stayed on the Club level. However, at the LeGrand I felt uncomfortable. The staff was not friendly and I felt that I needed to flash my I.D. everytime we walked into the Club area. We had to have someone type in an ID and password on the computer each time we wanted to use it and the staff insisted upon making our drinks for us. The hotel is plush and lavish and the wide screen T.V. had a personal welcome on it. However, on the day of our departure, we requested bag pick-up at ll:00 a.m. and exactly at ll:00 a.m. the T.V. went off. The room was large, the bathroom spacious and our room had a small balcony overlooking the street. No complaints about it at all. In my opinion the location is not as good as the Intercontinental unless you are attending the Opera every night. We did not eat at the hotel although my husband insists the food is excellent. While I know this hotel has recently been renovated and is most likely the Intercontinental's crown jewel in Paris, I was not sorry to leave. However, Benjamin, who assisted us upon check-in and obtained an upgrade for us to the Club level, was most helpful. He identified himself as the assistant manager and apologized for our no more than 60 second wait in line. I only wish that the rest of the staff we dealt with was as friendly as he. All in all there is nothing really bad about this hotel. If you are a shiek (my husband says Colin Powell has been sighted there) or some other important person or want to impress whomever, this is the place to stay. However, for my vacation needs I will head back over to the other Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Good - not great”
Reviews.Author: a_robyn
Reviews.Content: This was my honeymoon trip, so I did a lot of research prior. I was prepared for small rooms and expensive food prices (hey, nothing one can do about the current exchange rate). I purchased an Ambassador membership at the advice of a reviewer below. I hoped that the guaranteed room upgrade would at least get us a room that wasn't a box. Nope - we weren't given the room upgrade at checkin and we were too tired and jetlagged to argue. We were, however, allowed to check in at 10AM for no extra cost. (I emailed the hotel prior to our arrival to arrange this). The basic room is small - I've stayed in NYC hotels so I'm used to small, but this was by far the smallest room I've ever stayed in. The bed was a queen and took up at least 80% of the room. No view of the Opera from our room. One night our housekeeping crew left our windows open - at least 15 mosquitos invaded our room. We had no sleep that night, we stayed up trying to swat them all. We were given a free welcome gift of fruit - unfortunately, it was not fresh and some of the fruit was bruised. :-( Still, we were there for the sites of Paris and not the fruit. This is where the positives come in - the concierge services were wonderful! Everything the concierge suggested and arranged was better than we ever expected. We asked for a jazz club, we received premiere seating in a hip club in St. Germain. The dinner cruise he arranged was the highlight of our trip. He also talked us out of doing certain tourist things and suggested alternatives, saving us time and money. The hotel buffet is wonderful, also. I have never had such marvelous food at a buffet. Have at least one chocolate crepe! All in all, it was enjoyable, but, reading reviews of other Paris hotels, we could have received better for the amount of money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “You know what they say about Paris hotels....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a couple of nights in Paris, and I had the absolute Pleasure of staying in Le Grand. To benchmark it against other hotels such as the Waldorf-Astoria, Amstel Intercontinental, seems fair enough - and like for like Le Grand came up trumps. Room was unmistakably Parisen in Size, but never the less was delightfull - There was ample space for me (at 6ft4) to do all I needed to do in 2 days... 5th Floor, Sloping Ceiling, French Windows (also in the Bathroom) the best hotel bed ever, and so much caricture and charm that you will love it. air conditioning that is so quiet, even on full power, the only way you know its working is because your room is chilly, when it's 33Celcius outside. My room did have a view of the interior courtyard, but in honesty i dont go to a city filled with stunning archeticure to look out the hotel room window. So I dont really feel that I lost out, That being the only downfall I can think of in two days - is above my expecations of a hotel of this vintage, and where I expect flawless service. Worth of specail mention is the extent to which staff are happy to speak english, registration card, room bill, turn down weather card, all in english - the attention to detail even extending to it being the lauguage the the menu on the TV was showing, and the maid presenting my room service breakfast menu englis side up each day when turndown was done.

Reviews.Title: “HATED the Intercontinental LeGrand”
Reviews.Author: WeLovSuisse
Reviews.Content: Not even close to being a 5 star hotel. Reminded me and my husband of a stage set -- looks beautiful from the outside, but when you get up close enough to examine the details, there's nothing behind the facade. It took us over half an hour to check in b/c the hotel wouldn't honor the coupons we had been sent through AMEX. Four phone calls later, they finally relented. Rooms were spacious but poorly maintained -- room air conditioning unit did not work despite their sending up a maintenance man three times; the rubber stripping was hanging off the doorways, there was a torn comforter, etc. The built-in hairdryer was IMPOSSIBLE to use; you have to hold a button down in an awkward position the entire time you're using it. I requested an additional plug-in (regular) hairdryer, but was told they didn't have any. For some unknown reason, they cancelled our dinner reservations for us on the second night of our stay (we were supposed to eat at Chez L'Ami Louis) and did not inform us; when we arrived at that restaurant, we were told that our table had been given away b/c the concierge at the intercontinental "could not locate us to confirm our reservation." We found ourselves with nowhere to eat at 8:30 pm on a Saturday night in Paris. When we complained to the hotel, we got no apology, but were grudgingly given a terrible table at the Cafe de la Paix (hotel restaurant). Food was awful. Staff was superficially friendly enough but did not go out of their way to help us with any requests and we found ourselves calling downstairs MULTIPLE times to resolve room maintenance issues. All in all, a beautiful hotel, but I would NEVER go back. TERRIBLY maintained and serviced.

Reviews.Title: “worth the price”
Reviews.Author: CoClare
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in Paris before, but this was the first time with our 9-year old son. We all enjoyed the Intercontinental LeGrand (be sure to specify the LeGrand on Rue Scribe, as there is another Intercontinental in the city). Our room was on the 5th floor, and the balcony opened up to an excellent view of the Opera house across the street. The room was a good size by Paris standards, and the bathroom was large. The people in the hotel were very helpful and polite (as we found nearly everyone with whom we dealt in Paris - contrary to popular US belief). The food was very good, and the atmosphere is that of a turn of the century grand hotel. We would certainly stay there again. Be aware that the cost is not cheap at all (approximately $400/night), but we feel it was worth it, and our son loved the hotel and Paris in general. The one drawback for the city in my son's eyes was the the French national sport of smoking everywhere - be prepared for that. However, we booked a non-smoking room, and there was no scent of smoke. Also, when the windows were closed there was minimal street traffic noise (don't worry, the room was air conditioned). The Metro and bus tour stops are nearby, as are the grand boulevards. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Le Grand for my birthday and I have to say that this hotel exceeded my expectations. The room was large and well equiped and service was above and beyond. This hotel has an excellent location, within walking from most places to visit and just steps from the underground train rail. Definetely a place to stay when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “You know you are in Paris at Le Grand!”
Reviews.Author: susanaq27
Reviews.Content: Before booking with this hotel I checked out trip advisor reviews and became an Ambassador Club member as advised by a TA member. With this membership we got a guaranteed upgrade, a free night, fresh fruit and bottled water upon arrival and private check-in. There was a group of 7 women (ages 19-64). We decided to book three rooms, 2, 2 and 3 in a room. Three of us, one from each room got an Ambassador Club membership and split the cost with the other person staying in the room so we all reaped the benefits! After booking with the hotel via internet, we picked the $254 (14 day advance) rate~ They did not bill us until we got there. It is there policy to wait until you arrive. I made contact with the concierge immediately via email as I wanted to establish a relationship before our arrival. This is the address in case you are interested:(---) They were wonderful!! Replied immediatley, to several requests, booking for Jules Verne restaurant at the top of the Effiel Tower, Pick up from the airport and back to airport and questions about upgrading and request for all of us to be on the same floor if possible. So far so good! Upon our arrival at CDG we were greeting immediately by our driver~ Thank God! I was a little nervous about that on the plane. He held up a name card and called our name out so we saw him within seconds. He was very friendly and gave us a tour as he drove to our hotel 20 mins away from the airport. Upon entering our hotel we KNEW we were in PARIS! At the check-in everything went smoothly and they were able to accommodate two rooms connecting to one another and the third room a few rooms away on the same floor. They upgraded all of us to JR. Suites and upgraded us again to full view of the Opera Garnier. What an amazing view! StoryBook Land. Metro right in front of the Opera House~ Thought that might be a problem with the noise~ But the only problem I encountered with noise at night was my mother's snoring~ Sorry Mom~ She said the same thing about me too! While waiting for the others to check-in we had our first cafe in the Paix Cafe~ 15 Euros with some pasteries,gratis~ expensive~yes~ priceless moment~ absolutely! Checked out the Grand Ballroom( where Karen and Raven said they would like to get married!) and the Lounge " La Verrière" area where unbeknown to us we would gather every evening to have a nightcap and talk about our adventures for the next day! When you order a drink they bring you little bowls of olives, chips and some other snacks~ Very nice! Price of the drinks ranged from 6-15 Euros. I had the french beer for 6 Euros and it was fantastic! We arrive in our room ahhhhhhhhhh breath taking ~Clean, parisian, extravegant, View: breathtaking! I took photos ~ so make sure you check them out! Pleasantly surprised by the large size of the room! Bathroom was in a separate area in the front hallway~ Which was great because someone could use the vanity and the shower without being interrupted by the toilet! Plenty of storage space for hanging clothes~ We did have to ask for extra hangers which arrived 5 mins after the request!~ Plenty of drawer space~ Easy to use safe~ which we kept our passports and jewlery in. Amenities: Included use of the gym~ HELLO ~ I just got back from Weight Watchers and lost two pounds on this trip just from walking and we used the metro! I can assure you I did not keep track of my points! Lovely Spa: No time to use the spa services however two of the girls did get manicures and they were 15 E~ Not bad~ They commented that the manicurist was super friendly and wish we had more time to book a message and facial. Free Movie for Ambassador Club members~ No time to take advantage of this~ But I did browse through the list~ All movies available in different languages and English was one of them~ OH` And when you turned on the Plasma TV it said "Welcome Sue Meyers"~ Cute~ The room had a complete communications and entertainment center, multi national TV, video on demand and double phone lines with high-speed Internet connections. Didn't use the internet. Included also were two super fluffy bathrobes, slippers and blowdryer. We bought our own adaptors but they ahd them available at the hotel free of charge. Mini- Bar~ Expensive Fresh Fruit, bottled water and other goodies were waiting for us in the room. Turndown service nightly. Room Service~ Twice we ordered desserts ~ Excellent! The hotel itself is immaculate, the flowers beautifully groomed, every square inch of that hotel was a sight of magnificent beauty. The staff: housekeeping, reception area, concierge( Sophie and others) , everyone spoke English and everyone was extremely helpful, friendly, and polite. Service was exception. The Concierge: Every morning before our departure we checked in with them to plot out the metro route we were going to take. They took their time with us showed us on the map, and printed out directions for us. Of course that didn't stop us from getting on the wrong metro or heading in the wrong direction or even some getting off while the others could not get out hehehehe~ But by the second day we were champs~ The metro is directly in front of the hotel, very convenient! The surrounding area of the hotel is know as the Opera district. Very large Grand historical buildings. We had the Opera Garnier a hop, skip and a jump away. Place Vendome, which is the Town square was lovely with beautiful Sculptures. Famous: Happy Harry's, Willies Wine Bar and Buddha Bar are all within walking distance. Galeries Lafayette just one block down for all of your shopping needs. The area is spotless, sparkling clean on every street corner~ For the most part we felt this way everywhere we went in Paris! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to add an extra day in Paris on our return trip from Tblisi, Georgia before returning to the U.S. I used Priceline to bid on a 5* hotel for $240 and got this hotel while other sites had the same room at about $440 for a confirmed reservation. It was a wonderful hotel at the price we paid, but I am not sure that I would have been as happy with it at the higher price. It is close to many of the sights and very close to the sight-sseing bus ticket office. Obviously, it was a whirlwind visit with us not spending much time in the room, but I could not find any fault with the hotel or in the helpfulness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “This Place was Great”
Reviews.Author: twinkles
Reviews.Content: We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Paris. We were there for nine days in February. We initially booked only two nights thinking we might want to move somewhere else. Couldnt find anything nearly as nice for more money. Highly recommend the Le Grand.

Reviews.Title: “romantic break”
Reviews.Author: hondalondon
Reviews.Content: good 5 star hotel but surprised had no pool hotel spotless and beautifully decorated great atmosphere staff very helpfull although breakfast service slow and some tables left dirty when left not up to five star standard. metro under hotel so do get rumble now and again.great spot to see paris .wife loved it five stars for me

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location next door to the Opera. We had a beautiful room with a view of the opera. Bathroom was large and had floor to ceiling glass french doors with a great view. It doesn't get much better than taking a bubble bath while taking in the views. We never heard a peep during our stay- even though we were out all night and sleeping all day several times. Impeccable service. Would HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: FreqFlyerLondon
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great for shopping, but aside from that, compared to other hotels such as the Tremoille, it has nothing particular to recommend it. The interiors for the bedrooms are not that plush - high style but cheap execution. The room was small and a bit noisy. The room service prices were extortionate. The gym was small but OK, although you need to get a separate key from the lobby which is not much fun if you're in gym clothes. The common areas and restaurants were nice enough but not huge. Service again was OK but patronising. I wouldn't bother staying here again. Not a treat.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Ruined Our Trip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Intercontintal Hotel in 2003. It was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I don't know if it has been remodeled since then, but when I stayed there it was filthy. The carpets in the room were stained, and the bathroom had mold. The wallpaper was coming off the walls, and the bed broke when we sat on it. The drapes were torn also. We did not go into the restruant to eat because as we were going in to eat, the man in front of us was complaining to the management that his wife had become ill earlier in the day from eating there. He asked for help and they rudely turned him away. The staff was rude to us when we asked for a new room. I have never been treated this way before in a hotel, but I felt that for what we were spending at this hotel we should have had a better room. We could have stayed at the Ritz for the same price, but they were full. Even if the hotel has been remodeled since then, there is no excuse for the way the treated us.

Reviews.Title: “a true five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Herman36
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short and agree with all the other positive reviews. Great rooms, superior service, perfect location (right next to the Opera house, and a minute walk from the metro stop). I was in Paris for New Year's and this hotel was perfect. I could not believe the deal I got for this hotel. I can not imagine a better hotel in all of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was wonderful. Had club level suite which was lovely and large. The club level staff were fantastic. I have nothing bad to say about this experience
